story:
UPDATE!

We made it to our $50,000 goal! Don't let that stop you from donating, though. Every cent raised above our original $50,000 goal will continue to go toward building our inventory of queer books. More books means we can share even more queer stories featuring the variety of LGBTQIA+ identities and experiences. 

Overview

Salt Lake City is one of the ten queerest cities in America, but we have hardly any queer-specific spaces and even fewer that are accessible to all ages. Having spaces available for queer youth to feel safe and validated is especially important—check the FAQ section if you're interested in the stats about this—and we all deserve a space where we can be ourselves and build community. One bookstore isn’t going to change the world, but one bookstore can be a place of refuge, a place of validation and celebration, and a place to learn more about yourself and discover that you are not alone. 

According to the 2019 GLSEN School Climate Study, only 16% of LGBTQ+ students in Utah were taught positive representations of LGBTQ people, history, or events. We deserve to have our stories told, shared, celebrated, validated, and loved. And that is exactly what Under the Umbrella, a queer little bookstore, will do. 

*A note on language: I identify as queer and use that term and LGBTQIA+ as umbrella terms for anyone identifying as not-straight and/or not-cisgender. Queer has historically been used as a slur against LGBTQIA+ people, and many still do not feel comfortable with its use. This is a reasonable response to the marginalization and systemic oppression of our community! I honor and respect the right of other LGBTQIA+ folks to not use that term for themselves, and I expect queer and non-LGBTQIA+ folks to respect them as well by not using the term for them. 

 

Everyone Under the Umbrella Is Welcome at Under the Umbrella

Under the Umbrella is a safe space to experience and create queer stories and queer community. The bookstore will offer a sense of community and inclusion for all folks who fall under the queer “umbrella,” as well as queer allies. 

Our mission is threefold: 

  • Prioritize, share, and celebrate LGBTQ stories.
  • Provide a space for queer people to gather, build community, and celebrate their identities together.
  • Offer a means of livelihood to marginalized members of the community. 

 

CHOOSE A REWARD & HELP US BRING OUR MISSION TO LIFE
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>

 

Queer Stories

Less than 5% of the publishing industry identifies as non-cisgender, and the industry is 81% straight, according to a Diversity in Publishing survey by Lee & Low Books. The most diverse segment of the industry is the interns—who make the least money and have the least decision-making power.

It's not surprising then, that representation in the books that are published is overwhelmingly white and straight. According to author Malinda Lo, 81% of LGBTQ YA fiction in 2016 featured a cisgender boy or girl as the main character. And according to the Cooperative Children's Book Center, only 18 YA books written by LGBTQ authors of color were published in 2017 and 2018.

Representation in publishing is slowly improving, but general bookstores don’t necessarily have the capacity or desire to prioritize these stories. Under the Umbrella will highlight the stories by and about people who have traditionally been excluded from publishing and mainstream media. We will also prioritize the marginalized voices in an already-marginalized group by bringing more attention to stories written by and about QTPOC, disabled queers, fat queers, and identities that are often excluded, including asexual, aromantic, and intersex identities. 

When you walk into Under the Umbrella, you know that the books and other items you’ll find there are queer. Books will be clearly labeled based on the representation found in the books, as far as is possible, so individuals have the opportunity to see themselves represented in stories or learn more about other identities within the community. Every product will offer a way to connect deeper with yourself and the community at large. 

Queer Space

A bookstore is obviously about the books—but it’s also about so much more than that. Under the Umbrella is about having a space where you can go and know that you are accepted and validated and loved. It’s about knowing your pronouns will be respected and your identity will be celebrated. The bookstore is specifically designed to be a safe space for those who are questioning or exploring their own identities, as well as those who are established in their identities (queer or otherwise) but want to learn more about the LGBTQIA+ community. This is a space to experience and create queer community through the books and other goods sold, as well as community events and projects. 

Under the Umbrella will serve as a community hub for connection between LGBTQIA+ folks. We are working to establish relationships and programs with Drag Queen Story Hour, LGBTQ Books to Prisoners, and Black & Pink, as well as other queer groups to offer ways for us to build connections beyond the books we read. Our plan is to offer book clubs, poetry readings, letter writing activities, and a space for groups to congregate (once it is safe to do so). 

Queer Employment

Our mission includes offering a means of livelihood to queer folks, who experience higher rates of unemployment and lower wages. These issues are systemic and are compounded for POC, disabled folks, and trans folks—especially trans women of color. 

We plan to hire queer booksellers and other staff members as our budget increases. We are dedicated to providing a minimum $15/hour wage, which means it may take us a little while before we are able to hire additional staff. In the meantime, we will offer consignment for local queer authors to sell their work in the store, and we plan to offer sideline items (candles, stickers, pins, socks, art, etc.) made exclusively by LGBTQIA+ individuals. 

Our services will include new and used books with a buy-back program, which will allow us to meet the range of budgets in our community. 

About Kaitlyn

I’m Kaitlyn (she/they), a queer reader, editor, and bookseller from Salt Lake City, Utah. I identify primarily as queer, but specifically as pansexual and nonbinary/genderqueer. Those are words I didn’t know existed 10 years ago. Growing up religious in Provo, Utah, I didn’t have the language for or access to identities beyond heteronormativity. It wasn’t until much later in life that I realized that gender and sexuality weren’t the binary structures that I had been taught they were. What followed was more years of learning and critical thinking about my own identities, and reading every story I could find about queer people and queer identities.

 
Finding stories that featured people like me—and people unlike me but also queer—was transformative. It made me feel powerful and seen. But it shouldn’t have taken so long to find that.

 

While I’m proud of my journey, I don’t want anyone else to have to wait to find a space to experience and create queer stories and queer community. 

I have spent the last 14 years of my professional life as an editor focused on making language as accessible and inclusive as possible. Last year, I started an Instagram account dedicated to the queer books I was reading. I found an incredible community of queer book lovers and a world of queer stories I didn’t know existed, because traditional media didn’t prioritize those stories. This year I decided to expand that by providing space for queer stories to thrive. 

Here’s how else I’ve immersed myself in the book industry:

  • Completed an intensive course on the realities of bookselling and being a bookstore owner
  • Joined the American Booksellers Association and the Mountain and Plains Independent Booksellers Association, attended industry events, and networked with industry professionals across the country
  • Joined the Utah LGBTQ+ Chamber of Commerce, National LGBTQ Chamber of Commerce, and the Salt Lake Chamber of Commerce

 

Making Under the Umbrella a Reality: Timeline and Budget

So, turns out bookstores are expensive. With my personal investment and business plan, I’ll be able to cover a lot of costs for fixtures and furniture, rent, licensing and insurance, marketing, etc. I have received a $5,000 0% interest loan through Kiva for the bookstore-specific point of sale system that we will need to get the inventory up and running. In addition, I am investing $70,000 of my personal savings into the bookstore, and 50% of the salary from my current full-time job is being added to that fund biweekly. I anticipate paying myself a $15/hour wage at the store for the time it takes to become profitable. 

But I still need help to purchase the opening inventory. Opening an account with wholesalers and publishers requires pre-payment for the first order, and ordering enough books to stock a bookstore costs a lot. The numbers below are an estimate based on a 1,500 square foot space.

  • Books and non-book merchandise (queer candles, mugs, pins, bookmarks and other book accessories): 1,300 selling square feet @ $70 per square foot (~7 titles per square foot) = $91,000. All of the money raised from this campaign will go toward building this inventory. If we raise $15,000 that's what our opening inventory will be! If we raise $100,000 that's what our opening inventory will be.
  • Indiegogo fees: Indiegogo gets part of the amount we raise, 5% of funds raised and 2.9% + 30 cents per contribution. In order to actually get $50,000 for our inventory, we need to raise about $55,000. 
  • Cost of perks + shipping: We’ll do our best to keep these funds as low as possible, but some funds will inevitably go toward fulfillment of perks. If you’re local, consider opting for local pickup to help us save on shipping costs! (The cost of shipping is included in the perk cost.) 

 

Perks will ship ~30 days after the campaign ends. We hope to open shop in June, in time to celebrate Pride with y’all. 

Risks and Challenges

The margins on bookstores are very slim. If I try to compete with sellers like Barnes and Noble or Amazon on price, the bookstore simply won’t make any money and will have to close. As it is, I estimate it will take three years for the store to break even and start making any sort of profit. 

Many bookstores have had to close over the last year because they were not equipped to handle online ordering when COVID forced stores to pause in-store shopping. I won’t be able to compete with Amazon on shipping price or speed, either, but I am building this business with a focus on online capabilities to ensure we can survive if in-store shopping has to pause again.

I’m in this for the long haul. Opening this store is my dream, and I deeply believe that our community would benefit from this space. I’m not doing this to make a lot of money, I’m doing this because I believe we deserve a space like this in our community, which means any profit the store makes will be reinvested into expanding the store, employee benefits, and community-building programs.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute financially, that’s ok! Your support in any form means the world to me. 

 

Spread the Word

A project like ours depends on word of mouth. Please Share this campaign using Indiegogo’s share tools, follow us on social media, and share the story with your family and friends! 

  • Instagram: @UnderTheUmbrellaBookstore
  • Twitter: @UTUBookstore
  • Facebook: @UnderTheUmbrellaBookstore
  • LinkedIn: Under the Umbrella Bookstore
  • Yelp: Under the Umbrella Bookstore

 

Buy Books Through Bookshop and Libro.fm

We’re not up and running with a physical location yet, but you can support us by purchasing books through our affiliate links at Bookshop.org, Libro.fm, and HummingbirdDM! These sites aren’t based on our store inventory, so you can order books that are not queer and we will still get a share of the sale price. Any money raised through these links will go directly back to building the store’s physical inventory.

Donate Books

If you have queer books that no longer spark joy for you but are in good shape, we’d love to receive them! Once we are open, we will start a buy/trade/sell program, but for now your donations will help us build our inventory with a smaller upfront investment required so we can get in business faster! Contact me to arrange donations and figure out a reward if you’d like. 

Tell us what you want to see in the store

Under the Umbrella depends on community. There are thouuuusands of queer stories out there, and we want to make sure we are providing the ones that are most valuable to you right off the bat. Send us your recommendations for queer stories, queer artists, queer merch, etc., that you’d like to see in the store. Email your suggestions to kaitlyn at undertheumbrellabookstore dot com.

Join Us

Most importantly, join us at Under the Umbrella when we open in summer 2021. Can’t wait to see you there!

Under the Umbrella in the News

Utahn launches crowdfunding campaign to bring a 'queer little bookstore' to Salt Lake City: Salt Lake Tribune

Under the Umbrella Bookstore Coming to Salt Lake City: Shelf Awareness

Kaitlyn Mahoney talks about Under the Umbrella: KRCL RadioACTive

One Utahn Raises Over $53,000 To Bring A 'Queer Little Bookstore' To Salt Lake City: KUER.org

Kaitlyn Mahoney and Their Queer Little Library: peculiar journal

A New Literary Umbrella: City Weekly

story:
Some of you know us as Mary Puppins, some know us as Lisa and Reed. Many of you have seen our vans around the town but maybe some of you don't know what Planet Puppins is!

We established the Puppins Empire back in 2017 with dog walking, doggy day care and home boarding. (Some of you have been here from the very beginning!). In April 2018 we had to move to bigger premises but now the time has come to expand once again in order to really make an impact! 

Our vision is to move into a building in the heart of Kilmarnock- you cannot and will not miss this place. This will be a cutting- edge facility,  incorporating everything your dog will need from puppyhood to senior years. Daycare, training classes, dog grooming, pet health care and so much more. 

Our onsite dog friendly coffee shop will be open to the general public to pop in for a coffee, cake and a catch up.

We need your help though.  Your generosity will allow us to purchase the building and our goal is £90,000 within 49 days. By doing this, you will not only see the result of your donation but you, your pet and the wider community will be able to personally benefit from that. 

The Puppins vision can only be achieved with your help. Many of you have been supporting us from the start and many more have become Pack Members recently. We appreciate that the last year has been incredibly tough both personally and financially for everyone but we thank you all for your continued support.

Every single penny counts. Together, we can do this. 

Are you ready? Let's go!!

story:
ATIPICO se fundó en 2017, en Barcelona. Es la creación de mi hermosa familia trabajando unida y es la prueba de que todo es posible cuando tienes amor y sueños en tu corazón.

Siempre quise construir un espacio dedicado a crear una comunidad fuerte, a través de la comida, el arte y la creatividad. Pero no estaba seguro de cómo y dónde. Un día, justo antes del nuevo año, encontré ATIPICO, el espacio perfecto, estuvo vacío durante 15 años y tenía mucho potencial.

Mi hermano Theo y yo empezamos y con mucho trabajo, la ayuda de muchos amigos y el apoyo de nuestra madre Michele, con quien nada hubiera sido posible transformamos el espacio en un Rooftop Bar & Restaurant que acogió innumerables eventos culturales. actividades y artistas, tanto locales como internacionales. Se convirtió en un lugar mágico donde se unieron diferentes culturas, todos aprendieron unos de otros y se conectaron maravillosamente. Todos se sentían como en casa y lo habíamos logrado ...

Estuvimos abiertos durante 2 años, pero desafortunadamente en junio de 2019, tuvimos que cerrar, necesitábamos hacer una renovación seria, para cumplir con las nuevas regulaciones. Tuvimos que destruir todas las instalaciones existentes y empezar de nuevo. No hace falta decir que fue un momento muy triste. Luego llegó 2020 y la pandemia no facilitó las cosas, el mundo se cerró y la cultura en todas partes se extinguió. Nos enfrentamos a una verdadera crisis cultural y social. Los espacios necesarios para que las personas se mantengan conectadas están desapareciendo uno a uno. Entonces, mientras todos estamos haciendo nuestro mejor esfuerzo ahora para combatir este virus desagradable, es muy importante proteger nuestros espacios locales e independientes. Los lugares que hacen vibrante y llena de sorpresas una ciudad.

Y es por eso que estoy aquí hoy, estoy aquí para hacerte saber que

No me he rendido, sé lo mucho que importa este lugar. Así que con mi socio German hemos estado trabajando sin descanso, en silencio en las sombras y estamos orgullosos de anunciar que después de muchos pacientes, papeleo y planificación, RECUPERAMOS NUESTRA LICENCIA.

 

Aún así, necesitamos su apoyo, para terminar y necesitamos fondos para comprar sillas de mesa, stock y todo lo que necesitamos para abrir. Si tenemos la oportunidad, volveremos a crear magia. estamos aquí para trabajar duro y reconstruir el lugar increíble que todos recuerdan. Queremos que la gente vuelva a estar unida. Con el poder colectivo, creemos que podemos recaudar suficientes fondos.

Un hogar para la creatividad casual en un mundo post-pandémico, donde toda nuestra experiencia comienza con los sentidos: un lugar de base, evolucionando y descubriendo nuevas formas de ser.

Su (re) diseño se basa en los principios de Wabi Sabi, que celebra la esencia y la aceptación del pasado. Un lugar donde el tiempo se convierte en arte; rescatar objetos, suelos, paredes y edificios como práctica sostenible. Buscamos traducir esa energía y crear un espacio terrenal y discreto que sea un lienzo para nuevas formas de ser. El nuevo diseño dará nueva vida a lo que alguna vez fue y ayudará a los visitantes a nutrirse y crecer a través de la experiencia.

 La mejor forma de ayudar es donando a esta campaña de crowdfunding. Preparamos increíbles ventajas de edición limitada. Todo lo que puedas aportar cuenta. Pero también para que tus amigos lo sepan. Por favor comparta esto.

También queremos conocer tu experiencia de ATIPICO comparte con nosotros tus historias en Instagram con la mención

@ a.t.i.p.i.c.o & #saveatipico
story_txt:
ATIPICO se fundó en 2017, en Barcelona. Es la creación de mi hermosa familia trabajando unida y es la prueba de que todo es posible cuando tienes amor y sueños en tu corazón.
Siempre quise construir un espacio dedicado a crear una comunidad fuerte, a través de la comida, el arte y la creatividad. Pero no estaba seguro de cómo y dónde. Un día, justo antes del nuevo año, encontré ATIPICO, el espacio perfecto, estuvo vacío durante 15 años y tenía mucho potencial.
Mi hermano Theo y yo empezamos y con mucho trabajo, la ayuda de muchos amigos y el apoyo de nuestra madre Michele, con quien nada hubiera sido posible transformamos el espacio en un Rooftop Bar & Restaurant que acogió innumerables eventos culturales. actividades y artistas, tanto locales como internacionales. Se convirtió en un lugar mágico donde se unieron diferentes culturas, todos aprendieron unos de otros y se conectaron maravillosamente. Todos se sentían como en casa y lo habíamos logrado ...
Estuvimos abiertos durante 2 años, pero desafortunadamente en junio de 2019, tuvimos que cerrar, necesitábamos hacer una renovación seria, para cumplir con las nuevas regulaciones. Tuvimos que destruir todas las instalaciones existentes y empezar de nuevo. No hace falta decir que fue un momento muy triste. Luego llegó 2020 y la pandemia no facilitó las cosas, el mundo se cerró y la cultura en todas partes se extinguió. Nos enfrentamos a una verdadera crisis cultural y social. Los espacios necesarios para que las personas se mantengan conectadas están desapareciendo uno a uno. Entonces, mientras todos estamos haciendo nuestro mejor esfuerzo ahora para combatir este virus desagradable, es muy importante proteger nuestros espacios locales e independientes. Los lugares que hacen vibrante y llena de sorpresas una ciudad.
Y es por eso que estoy aquí hoy, estoy aquí para hacerte saber que
No me he rendido, sé lo mucho que importa este lugar. Así que con mi socio German hemos estado trabajando sin descanso, en silencio en las sombras y estamos orgullosos de anunciar que después de muchos pacientes, papeleo y planificación, RECUPERAMOS NUESTRA LICENCIA.
 
Aún así, necesitamos su apoyo, para terminar y necesitamos fondos para comprar sillas de mesa, stock y todo lo que necesitamos para abrir. Si tenemos la oportunidad, volveremos a crear magia. estamos aquí para trabajar duro y reconstruir el lugar increíble que todos recuerdan. Queremos que la gente vuelva a estar unida. Con el poder colectivo, creemos que podemos recaudar suficientes fondos.
Un hogar para la creatividad casual en un mundo post-pandémico, donde toda nuestra experiencia comienza con los sentidos: un lugar de base, evolucionando y descubriendo nuevas formas de ser.
Su (re) diseño se basa en los principios de Wabi Sabi, que celebra la esencia y la aceptación del pasado. Un lugar donde el tiempo se convierte en arte; rescatar objetos, suelos, paredes y edificios como práctica sostenible. Buscamos traducir esa energía y crear un espacio terrenal y discreto que sea un lienzo para nuevas formas de ser. El nuevo diseño dará nueva vida a lo que alguna vez fue y ayudará a los visitantes a nutrirse y crecer a través de la experiencia.
 La mejor forma de ayudar es donando a esta campaña de crowdfunding. Preparamos increíbles ventajas de edición limitada. Todo lo que puedas aportar cuenta. Pero también para que tus amigos lo sepan. Por favor comparta esto.
También queremos conocer tu experiencia de ATIPICO comparte con nosotros tus historias en Instagram con la mención
@ a.t.i.p.i.c.o & #saveatipico

story:
Short Summary

We are Danny, Dylan and Pete; residents of the Arbor Lodge neighborhood.  When LLBC went up for sale, we thought, "there isn't really a great beer spot with a nice outdoor space to drink year round in Arbor lodge."  We saw the opportunity, despite the pandemic for that beer garden at LLBC.

The 3 of us don't have the funds to create what we want right now, so we thought we'd take the opportunity to get the community involved and raise some money through this campaign.  The goal of the campaign is to provide future value to our current and future customers in exchange for some money now.  Some of the perks will actually save you money on beer!

In the future, we hope that LLBC and the other businesses on the property will provide a community hub and give back to the community through engagement in civil projects and community service in exchange for your generous contributions!

What We Need & What You Get

  • We have a grand plan to build a spectacular patio complete with coverings for rain and sun, natural gas fire pit, and mixed use open space for yards games/kid play/basking in the sunshine.  We expect that we will need $25-$35K to get the project going and another $10-$20K to put it over the top.  To be clear, we aren't looking for that all to come from the community.  We will be accessing funding from private loans as well as what we can raise from crowdfunding.  
  • We have some awesome perks, from as low as a few dollars.  Everyone gets a great reward, including beer, swag, challenges, a chance to brew with us.  And anyone who contributes any amount gets their name on a supporters wall at the patio!
  • Rest assured that every dollar will go towards the project, whether we reach the goal or not.  But the more local support we get the less burden it will put on us to do other things to help develop the brewery and taproom into more than a pub.   

Risks & Challenges

  • The three of us are working with professional architects and contractors to make sure the project gets done right! 
  • Running a business during the pandemic has been a challenge, but thanks to our loyal patrons we are able to keep the lights on and even pass some money back into the community via employment opportunities.  
  • Construction projects can be challenging, but we already have the pieces in place to execute once the plan is finalized.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Come to the Brewery and say hello.  Enjoy a fresh pint or a seltzer water.
  • Come get some supplies to make beer, cider, wine, beer, kombucha, or cheese at The Homebrew Exchange.
  • Get the word out there in the community.  
  • Let your friends and neighbors know we are here and we are doing great things.  
  • Share on social media and Indiegogo.

story:
We are Aldaskeller Wine Co.

Aldaskeller Wine Co. began with Brandon Opalich—a lifelong service industry guy from a wine-loving Italian-Serbian family—who wanted to take his passion for natural wine and create a welcoming space where both seasoned wine lovers and folks new to wine could come together to explore and enjoy the wonders of natural wine. In 2019, Brandon and his wife, Erin Francisco-Opalich, partnered with friend Tim Benedict—humble culinary wizard and kitchen disco king—to host their first food and natural wine pairing pop-ups. Through the connections they made with all the great people who came out to these events, they realized something: Rochester loves natural wine but it’s hard to find locally. Thus, the idea for the Aldaskeller Wine Co. shop was born. We aim to bring natural wine to the people!

Natural wine is our passion; these wines are made from biodynamically farmed grapes and are free from added sulfites, yeasts, and other industrial additives—several of which are derived from animals, including albumen (egg white), isinglass (fish bladder), dairy, and gelatin—that are commonly used to alter the appearance, aroma, and flavor of conventionally produced wines. Natural wines are better for the earth and better for human health. Just like the return to organic food, the natural wine movement seeks to support sustainable agriculture and restore winemaking to its roots, bringing true terroir to wine drinkers around the world. 

Contributions to our campaign will help to complete the construction work we’ve started at Aldaskeller’s future home at 289 Gregory Street in the heart of the South Wedge and—most importantly—enable us to purchase the shop’s initial inventory. The more we raise, the greater the variety of wines we’ll have waiting for you on opening day! We’re so grateful for the support from our community and we cannot wait to bring the world of natural wine to Rochester.

What We Need & What You Get

The funds we raise will help offset the costs of the electrical work, painting, flooring, display fabrication, and a refurbished 1970s turntable and sound system arriving from the west coast that will be bumpin’ while you shop and during in-house tastings, meet-the-winemaker events, and workshops. Most of all, the funds raised will help secure the biggest expense: the wine inventory!

To say, "thank you" for contributing, you can choose from some awesome PERKS! Perks range from sticker packs and t-shirts designed by artist Jason Look of Look’s Discount, to the Aldaskeller "After Hours" experience—a private evening party at the shop with complimentary wine pours for up to five guests. You can also simply make a donation if you’d rather not select a perk.

Even if we don’t reach our entire goal, every little bit helps to cover the work that’s underway. We’re starting the Aldaskeller Wine Co. shop to grow the natural wine movement and serve our community. We’ve been blown away by the excitement and support folks have shown us at our pop-up events and we're heartened by the high demand for environmentally conscious wines here in Rochester. We hope you’ll join us in bringing the first natural wine shop to our region!

Other Ways You Can Help

The pandemic has been hard on so many (us included) and we know that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help! You can help by making some noise about our campaign. Use the IndieGoGo share buttons at the top of the page to post about the Aldaskeller campaign on social media and spread the word to neighbors, friends, and family. We appreciate your support so much and can't wait to see you in the shop!

story:
Help Juturna Springs get the funding necessary to be the world-class EcoResort of your dreams! A one-hour drive from the DC, VA, and MD area, Juturna Springs will feature eco-friendly design, minimal environmental impact, a state of the art educational center, shallow and deep water access for all levels of divers as well as paddle boarding, snorkeling, and other aquatic pursuits, and best of all... a genuine military C-130 will be sunk at the bottom of the quarry for divers to explore, and with some parts shallow enough for snorkelers to see as well!

We are looking to raise $40k through this fundraiser, which compared to our lofty goals sounds like a drop in the bucket. We’re not expecting to be funded solely through crowdfunding, but donors like you are crucial to our strategy. 

Let us give you a picture of what we have already done, where we are now, and where we’re going from here.

In 2018, we held a soft opening of our current facilities in order to determine how popular Juturna Springs might be, how big we could reasonably get to accommodate demand, and what might need to be adjusted to make that growth achievable. It went really well and generated a lot of interest, but showed us just how much work we had left to do. 

To date, we have already invested $250k to get the plans for Juturna Springs drafted and submitted to Frederick County, installing preliminary infrastructure, acquiring a compressor system and more. As you read this, those plans are queued for approval. We successfully campaigned to change a county zoning law to allow our facility to operate, and we have approval from the Mining Safety and Health Administration as well as the Department of the Environment. We are no strangers to the process of dealing with the nuts and bolts of government approvals and zoning, and we are clear on what exactly needs to be done to make our dreams into reality.

This is where you come in! We are currently looking at further funding - equity funding, etc - and the funds we raise through this Indiegogo fundraiser will be used to restructure our company for investment growth and initiate the bidding process with contractors. When investors see an idea that’s not just a concept but already well on its way to fruition, and with popular support already teaming up to start filling the coffers, they are more likely to offer lower interest rates, longer payoff periods, and any number of other incentives that make every borrowed dollar a little bit cheaper in the long run. That savings is what’s going to make Juturna Springs the best it can be.

story:
What are Aribaro treats?

Aribaro treats are formulated with integrity, perfection, and vitality for pets. Our dehydrated and freeze-dried treats focus on three different proteins: locally sourced chicken gizzard, non-GMO, organic vegetables. 

For more info: https://aribaro.com

Our Aribaro Story 

Hey paw-friends!

I'm Minkyung Kim, Co-Founder & CEO of Aribaro. After years of trial and error in purchasing healthy pet treats, I literally gave up finding the most natural and healthy products for my pups. Inspired by Ari and Baro (my two lovely Boston-Terriers), I spent the past year sourcing ingredients, collaborating with nutritionists, researching, and developing a new line of healthy, non-GMO pet treats. Spending time with other pet owners made me realize that there was a need for a change in how we feed our pets and providing high-quality treats that are ethically sourced. 

Hey friends!

I'm Joelle Choe, Co-Founder & COO of Aribaro. When I heard this idea from my sister-in-business partner, Minkyung, I was on board to make a positive difference in the pet industry. I am passionate about making a good, ethical change in our pet community.

The Impact

Just like humans, less processed foods are ultimately healthier. Aribaro pet treats are high-quality, locally sourced, certified organic, non-GMO, and have no preservatives. We have formulated these pet treats with nutritionists and chefs that contain high levels of vitamins, minerals, and antioxidants.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge for Aribaro has always been our production costs. This includes the cost of our ingredients, packaging, and manufacturing costs.

For the past year, we have been able to fund the business using our savings in our home kitchen in New Jersey. With your help in our Indiegogo campaign, we are optimistic that we can work with our local manufacturer who shares our goals and values. Aribaro strives to be a positive reinforcement in the pet treat industry.

Other Ways You Can Help

In these unprecedented times, we understand that many people cannot help financially. You can check out, follow, and share our social media.

Instagram: http://instagram.com/aribarocompany 

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/aribaro.co

We hope you can participate at one of the three levels:

Please let all your loved ones know about our campaign word of mouth and/or social media. The Indiegogo share tools make this really easy.

Think about supporting even if you don't have a dog, and use the rewards as gifts and for your local shelter.

We would love to get your comments, questions, and feedback, no matter what!

Thanks for letting us share our dream with you...

Much love,

Minkyung & Joelle, Co-Founders of Aribaro

Hey paw-friends!
I'm Minkyung Kim, Co-Founder & CEO of Aribaro. After years of trial and error in purchasing healthy pet treats, I literally gave up finding the most natural and healthy products for my pups. Inspired by Ari and Baro (my two lovely Boston-Terriers), I spent the past year sourcing ingredients, collaborating with nutritionists, researching, and developing a new line of healthy, non-GMO pet treats. Spending time with other pet owners made me realize that there was a need for a change in how we feed our pets and providing high-quality treats that are ethically sourced. 
Hey friends!
I'm Joelle Choe, Co-Founder & COO of Aribaro. When I heard this idea from my sister-in-business partner, Minkyung, I was on board to make a positive difference in the pet industry. I am passionate about making a good, ethical change in our pet community.

The Impact
Just like humans, less processed foods are ultimately healthier. Aribaro pet treats are high-quality, locally sourced, certified organic, non-GMO, and have no preservatives. We have formulated these pet treats with nutritionists and chefs that contain high levels of vitamins, minerals, and antioxidants.

Risks & Challenges
The biggest challenge for Aribaro has always been our production costs. This includes the cost of our ingredients, packaging, and manufacturing costs.
For the past year, we have been able to fund the business using our savings in our home kitchen in New Jersey. With your help in our Indiegogo campaign, we are optimistic that we can work with our local manufacturer who shares our goals and values. Aribaro strives to be a positive reinforcement in the pet treat industry.

Other Ways You Can Help
In these unprecedented times, we understand that many people cannot help financially. You can check out, follow, and share our social media.
Instagram: http://instagram.com/aribarocompany 
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/aribaro.co
We hope you can participate at one of the three levels:
Please let all your loved ones know about our campaign word of mouth and/or social media. The Indiegogo share tools make this really easy.
Think about supporting even if you don't have a dog, and use the rewards as gifts and for your local shelter.
We would love to get your comments, questions, and feedback, no matter what!
Thanks for letting us share our dream with you...
Much love,
Minkyung & Joelle, Co-Founders of Aribaro

story:
Have you ever wanted to live in Italy for a little while?

By backing this project you can stay in a small bungalow in the beautiful region of Molise and experience an authentic and rural Italy. With the possibility to change your booking to a period of equal or lesser value according to availability within 5 years, you can adjust your plans to visit.

Nestled on a hilltop near the small town Montemitro in the beautiful region of Molise, I found the masseria (a type of farmhouse used when working out in the fields) that made me leave my life and work in Norway behind. The stunning panorama at the property, with views towards east, south and west, allows for you to see the sun rise in the morning and also set in the evening. 

Sunrise at Masseria Chicerro.

It is the perfect location for my project which has been in the brewing for many years. 

The vision for Masseria Chicerro is to establish a tranquil and inspiring work and living environment, where you will have enough time to integrate with the local community and truly experience the rich culture of this little known region.

Six attached bungalows are to be constructed at 570 m above sea level with panoramic views toward west and with the majestic Majella mountains as a backdrop. Here you will be able to enjoy the sunsets from your own private terrace. 

I myself live in the original masseria on the property, and I will do my best to help visitors get the best possible experience while staying here.

The building permission for the project has been granted, the contractor has been chosen, and the construction is to start this summer. The first two bungalows are scheduled to be completed by fall 2021.

 

The bungalows.

The bungalows are intended for those who want to stay for a longer period in Italy to see what it is like to live and work here. With a bachelor degree in Fine Art I had initially artists in mind, but Masseria Chicerro is also ideal for academics, writers, digital nomads and anyone really who is looking to experience the slow pace of rural living in Italy. Since the pandemic of the Corona virus and lockdowns world wide, the alternative of working online away from the office has been become more of an option for many.

¨

 

The living units are designed by Architect Johannes Sverdrup who has positioned the 3 modules on slightly different levels in the terrain so that the structure blends gently into the environment. He has also taken care to preserve the view from the original house and courtyard.  

Each bungalow measures 33 m2 and consists of a bedroom, bathroom and an open plan room with a small kitchen where you access the privat terrace. Considering the size of the living units they are best suited for 1 person or a couple.

 

The location of the bungalows is secluded but not too isolated as you can reach Montemitro on foot in 30 minutes, and the Adriatic sea with its never-ending beaches and coastal towns is only 20 min away by car.

 

The building project is divided into 3 steps. 1 module with 2 attached bungalows constructed in each step. The first part of the project has to be completed without any help from the bank and this is why this campaign is being launched. To help secure the capital needed to complete the first 2 bungalows you can back the project by purchasing a stay as a Perk.  

You can change the period of your Perk to one of equal or lesser value according to availability, within 5 years after the completion of the first 2 bungalows.  There will be new Perks added throughout the campaign.

It is also possible to transfer a prepaid stay to someone else, and so it could be the perfect gift for someone with a dream of Italy.

The minimum period to book is 4 weeks.  See the perk options for more details.

Note that the periods of March through May in 2022 and 2023 will not be made available as Perks, as these are needed for the construction of the next 2 modules. 

If you are interested in a particular period that is not to be found in the selection of Perks, you can contact me via the "Ask a question" link at the top of the page or send an e-mail to project.chicerro@gmail.com. 

 

Montemitro

Chicerro lies on the outskirts of the small town of Montemitro with less than 400 inhabitants. The town has a small but charming historic center with panoramic views towards the Adriatic sea.

Montemitro is one of three towns mainly populated by the ethnic minority referred to as Molise Croats. The community originates from refugees fleeing from the Ottoman conquests in the 15th and 16th centuries and they still speak an old Dalmatian dialect of the Croatian language alongside Italian.

It is a welcoming community where it is easy to be included. Montemitro has a bar/cafe, and small grocery shop. You can buy fresh bread from the local baker in the evenings. There is also a post office and a phamarcy.

The small town is situated overlooking the river Trigno which is the natural border between Abruzzo and Molise. This position makes it easy to reach and explore both regions. If you are not planning on renting a car for your stay, you can still get to the larger towns Campobasso, San Salvo, Vasto and Termoli by bus.

 

About Molise.

This is probably the most unknown and unexplored region in Italy, and it is the second smallest region with only two provinces; Campobasso and Isernia. The region is pristine in the sense that there is still no mass tourism to be found here, and the small villages scattered  around on the hill tops has a way of live pretty much unchanged for the last 50 years.  Many claim that coming to Molise is a bit like traveling back in time. You find an authenticity here that you no longer find in the more tourist crowded parts of Italy, and the pace and rhythm is slow and stress free.

Molise was listed by New York Times as on of the destinations to visit in 2020 if you are in search of untrammelled, traditional Italy. The newspaper mentions draws like the pristine coastline and mountains providing a wide network of slopes for skiers. You can find Roman settlements like Saepinum which is a complex of baths and a forum that rival those in Italy’s capital , but without the crowds. Hikers can explore the routes of “Transumanza”, the centuries-old tracks, along which sheep and oxen were herded. This network of tracks did also just recently win UNESCO status. New York Times also mention how festivals here are essential to the region’s culture, and throughout the year there is always a “festa” or a “sagra” to visit in Molise.

The region is mainly rural with many small villages with old stone houses clinging on to the mountain tops. 


 

Activities and Events

There is an abundance of scenic walks to be made in the surrounding area, and the Majellas and the Matese are within reach if you want to do some mountain hiking. There are organised trips offered for hiking, horse trekking, canoeing, biking and much more.

Also locally in Montemitro and the surrounding area it is possible to get guided tours. If you are planning on renting a car while you are here, you can explore as you please on your own and you will of course be provided with tips on where to go.

There is as mentioned before many events throughout the year in the form of "Festa" and "Sagre". There are too many to list them all here, but below is presented some examples. If you want to know more about what happens in a period you are interested in, you are welcome to contact me and I will do my best to provide you with more information.

March

  • The Tufara Carnival is a traditional festival on Shrove Tuesday also called "the Devil of Tufara" because it has the Devil as its protagonist. The traditional masks are six characters. The group of masks travels around the country in search of proselytes that the Devil and Death try to seduce by jumping and enticing the participants to go with them. The procession ends by entering the ancient Lombard castle where a puppet has been set up to represent the Carnival.

April

  • Festa di Capella is the highlight of events in Montemitro. It is a feast of the Chapel of Santa Lucia and an auction of sweets. Every year, on the Sunday following easter, the whole community gathers around 9 in the morning to make a pilgrimage to the small chapel of Santa Lucia, in the location of "Selo" not far from Masseria Chicerro. Once arrived at the country church, the holy mass is celebrated. After mass, the families have a picnic in the surrounding green area of the chapel, before attending the auction of cakes and sweets, carefully prepared by the skilled hand of the Montremitran ladies. The proceeds from the auction are used to cover the expenses of organising the party and maintenance of the chapel. This is a very enjoyable and informal event which is my personal favourite so far. It is also a great opportunity to meet all the locals of Montemitro.

May

  • Festa patronale di Santa Lucia. First and last Friday of May: It is said that the Croatians fleeing theTurkish invasion in the 16th century arrived in Montemitro on a Friday in May, bringing with them a wooden statue of Saint Lucia. On the first Friday of May the Saint is celebrated by carrying her in procession with a band. On the following Fridays there are processions and the last Friday of May there is a patronal festa, with fireworks, bands and celebrations throughout the evening.
  • La Carrese di Ururi. The boys compete with carts pulled by calves, and the adults with carts pulled by oxen. The event, a sporting event linked to religious traditions, takes place on May the 3rd, the day of the solemn patronal feast of the Most Holy Wood of the Cross. A blessing of the big floats starts the real race which starts 4 km from the center of Ururi, where the finish line is, in front of the church of Santa Maria Delle Grazie.

June

  • Processione dei Misteri-Campobasso. The Procession of the Mysteries is the most anticipated and important event in Campobasso. The event is a procession of thirteen large "living paintings", the Mysteries, which run through the streets of the city. These machines, also called geniuses, are carried on the shoulders of at least 12 young people for each Mystery, with a cadenced rhythm, marked by the " mystery " head. The Mysteries are made with metal structures to which both children and adults are anchored, and the upholstery with collared fabrics makes some characters seem to float in the air. The first Mystery machines were created in 1748 by Paolo Di Zinno, a famous artist from Campania. 

July

  • Festival della Zampogna. International event of the bagpipe in Scapoli. People from all over the world meet again, dance and sing through the streets of the town to the rhythm of not only bagpipes, but also of ciaramelle, tambourines and accordions. There will also be food and wine stands where you can taste and learn about typical local dishes prepared with care by the local residents for this important occasion.

August 

  • Multietnica. Flavours, cultures and colours from the world, all accompanied by ethno-folk sounds in the alleys of the historic center of Montemitro.  
  • Palio di San Rocco. San Rocco is the the co-patron of Montemitro, as well as Santa Lucia, and is celebrated with a rathe unique Palio: instead of horses, they race with donkeys. The four districts of the town, Castello, Piazza, Sant´Angelo and Tre Croci decorate the donkey in their neighbourhood with their respective colour. Once the race is over, everyone celebrates together, and for the occasion the community organises spaghetti with garlic and olive oil for everyone.
  • Torneo di Pljocke. Participate in a tournament of a rustic variation of the game Boules, where the players use rocks instead of balls. Note that the players bring their own rock!

September

  • Festa del Santo nome di Maria. In Campobasso on the 12th of September the patron Saint of the Mater Ecclesiae Church is celebrated: The Holy name of Mary. The celebration begins with the Holy Mass, immediately after there is the procession with the statue of the Madonna. During the afternoon, sporting and cultural events are organised and in the evening there are usually music and dance performances.

October

  • Olive harvest. The olive harvest normally starts end of October and continues into November and sometimes also December depending on the weather. There are about 180 olive trees on the property and you are welcome to participate in the harvest if it concur with your stay. If so, you can bring home some of the olive oil produced.

 

Why crowdfunding.

Because I am still a newcomer in Italy as a permanent resident, I am not yet eligible for a loan with the banks for the first step of the project . This is why I am looking to crowdfunding for some extra back up to complete the construction of the first module with two bungalows.  A successful crowdfunding campaign will also be very helpful when applying for a loan for the remaining bungalows.

This project is not just important to me personally. It will be a significant contribution to the community here. Like in many rural parts of Italy, they experience that people are leaving the villages for work in the cities, and this project will contribute to bringing new sustainable activity to the area, not just in the high season of summer.

As mentioned before, the pace in Italy can be slow sometimes and the bureaucracy can also be very challenging.  I have however tremendous support from the community and the Mayor of Montemitro.  I also work with a very competent business advisor/accountant, a Director of Engineering and a Director of Labour who assist me in overseeing the progress throughout the project. I have myself years of experience from project administration while working for a major consultant company in Norway. 

    Even if you are not in a position to back Masseria Chicerro, it will still be a great help if you share this campaign with people you believe would be interested in this project.

    Thank you for your support!

story:
From tinkering to rebuilding, we all have an inner DIY'er waiting to be unleashed.  So no matter how big or small your projects may be, we carry the best selection of industrial fasteners to power on your MacGyver alter ego.

What is Marafast?

Fasteners are used in over 1,000,000+ different applications.  Nearly every product, good or tool we own is held together in some way by fasteners.  Be they small or large, plastic or alloy steel, fasteners play a huge (if hidden) part of our lives.  And it's because of this, Marafast was created; to help bring fasteners (common and industrial) more easily to you so you can continue to build amazing things.

Where are we at?

Since we first opened our online store back in 2014, it's been our goal to make purchasing fasteners as easy as possible.  This means offering a 6,000+ sizes of quality fasteners (sourced from ISO/TS-16949 certified vendors & manufacturers) with unbeatable customer service.  While we're proud of what we've achieved so far, we're hungry and eager to move onto the next step.

Why we need your help.

We're amazed at how far we've gotten in the last 1-1/2 years but we still have 3 goals we're yet to acheive:

  • Creating free 3D SolidWorks & AutoCAD drawings of all our fasteners for download at any time.
  • Create a free mobile app that allows anyone to identify nuts, bolts or screws in seconds.
  • Further refinement of our website that makes searching, identifying and purchasing fasteners an extremely easy and low stress affair.
This Indiegogo campaign will help us get things back on track and allow us to create more content and features.  All of which, is to ultimately help you, our supporters, build amazing things.

Giving Back

Money doesn't grow on trees and we understand that earning a dollar takes hard work.  That's why we thought of some ways we can give something back in exchange for your support.


Grade 2 - $25 - We'll e-mail you a 15% off coupon on your next purchase on any fastener we carry.

Grade 5 - $50 - Get a bolt & nut gauge that measures both diameter and length (inch and metric) as well as a 20% off coupon on your next purchase.

Grade 8 - $100 - Get everything mentioned in the Grade 5 perk plus a 3.5 lb emergency fastener box (perfect when you need a spare screw/washer/nut, etc..)

Grade 9 - $300 - Our ultimate package: a bolt & nut gauge (inch and metric), a 3.5 lb emergency fastener box and a 30% off coupon with free shipping on your next purchase.



A special something for all you DIY's.

We're working on creating a page that showcases the amazing builds people have done, regardless if you use our fasteners or not.  So send us your DIY projects (cs@marafast.com) and every month, we'll pick the best one and the winner will get a prize.

To see more about the products we carry, visit us at www.marafast.com and as always, please share the link to our Indiegogo page on your Twitter, Facebook or Instagram.
story_txt:
From tinkering to rebuilding, we all have an inner DIY'er waiting to be unleashed.  So no matter how big or small your projects may be, we carry the best selection of industrial fasteners to power on your MacGyver alter ego.




What is Marafast?Fasteners are used in over 1,000,000+ different applications.  Nearly every product, good or tool we own is held together in some way by fasteners.  Be they small or large, plastic or alloy steel, fasteners play a huge (if hidden) part of our lives.  And it's because of this, Marafast was created; to help bring fasteners (common and industrial) more easily to you so you can continue to build amazing things.

Where are we at?Since we first opened our online store back in 2014, it's been our goal to make purchasing fasteners as easy as possible.  This means offering a 6,000+ sizes of quality fasteners (sourced from ISO/TS-16949 certified vendors & manufacturers) with unbeatable customer service.  While we're proud of what we've achieved so far, we're hungry and eager to move onto the next step.

  


Why we need your help.
 We're amazed at how far we've gotten in the last 1-1/2 years but we still have 3 goals we're yet to acheive:


Creating free 3D SolidWorks & AutoCAD drawings of all our fasteners for download at any time.
Create a free mobile app that allows anyone to identify nuts, bolts or screws in seconds.
Further refinement of our website that makes searching, identifying and purchasing fasteners an extremely easy and low stress affair.
This Indiegogo campaign will help us get things back on track and allow us to create more content and features.  All of which, is to ultimately help you, our supporters, build amazing things.

Giving Back
Money doesn't grow on trees and we understand that earning a dollar takes hard work.  That's why we thought of some ways we can give something back in exchange for your support.



Grade 2 - $25 - We'll e-mail you a 15% off coupon on your next purchase on any fastener we carry.
Grade 5 - $50 - Get a bolt & nut gauge that measures both diameter and length (inch and metric) as well as a 20% off coupon on your next purchase.
Grade 8 - $100 - Get everything mentioned in the Grade 5 perk plus a 3.5 lb emergency fastener box (perfect when you need a spare screw/washer/nut, etc..)
Grade 9 - $300 - Our ultimate package: a bolt & nut gauge (inch and metric), a 3.5 lb emergency fastener box and a 30% off coupon with free shipping on your next purchase.



    A special something for all you DIY's. We're working on creating a page that showcases the amazing builds people have done, regardless if you use our fasteners or not.  So send us your DIY projects (cs@marafast.com) and every month, we'll pick the best one and the winner will get a prize.
To see more about the products we carry, visit us at www.marafast.com and as always, please share the link to our Indiegogo page on your Twitter, Facebook or Instagram.

story:
Who we are

We are Phantom Racing Gear!  We specialize in custom screen printed and embroidered apparel. We are a family owned business that started as a dream and now has been in business for almost 3 years. In 2014 we got a huge contract to sell racing apparel with CRA (Championship Racing Association) a major short track asphalt racing series that puts on events throughout the Midwest from January to October.  We travel with them to every race.  Last year we rented a trailer every weekend and put up pop-up tents with tables to sell our shirts.   We had a very successful year with them and would like to improve our appearance and overall look to our customers with a more professional image. Having our own trailer is a big advantage in several ways.  We save on renting a trailer every week.  We also save on set up and break down time.  It also keeps our merchandise safer and out of the weather.  We saved up enough money to buy an apparel trailer, ordered it, and paid the deposit. It was almost finished when disaster struck with our printer. This very large specialized printer is how we print our artwork on films that transfer to the screens to screen-print our apparel.  Needless to say, it was a huge chunk of the money to fix it and down time of over two weeks waiting for the one repair guy in the Midwest to fit us in, but without our printer we can't produce shirts.  Unfortunately it has left us without the money to finish paying for our trailer which is READY TO BE PICKED UP! PLEASE HELP US raise the money for our long term investment. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need $6000 dollars to pick up our trailer and to be able buy and install the lighting. We did not have the trailer company do this because it would have added significantly to the cost and we are lucky to have the capability to be able to do it ourselves for less.
  • We want to do something for you. If you donate between $100 - $250 we will send you a custom printed t-shirt.  For donations of more than $250 we will send you a hooded sweatshirt.  Donations of more than $500.00 will receive both a t-shirt and a hoodie.  These will be shipped after the campaign has ended.
  • Even if we do not reach our entire goal (WE HOPE WE DO!) all monies raised will be put toward the pay off of the trailer.


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share on your Facebook and/or Twitter page by using the Indiegogo share tools
  • Tell your friends and family! 
  • To see our great designs, check out our web page http://www.phantomracinggear.com.

story:
Who we are:

I am Tharathip Soulisak the founder of Kohk & Sahk. Kohk & Sahk is a Laotian food company. Our goal is to have these amazing Laotian food products available for purchase at farmer’s market, festivals, fairs and online purchases. We hope that in the near future we will be the first Laotian food product available nationwide in retail stores. Kohk & Sahk will produce Laotian food products using authentic ingredients that are familiar and beloved. Be prepared for a nostalgic taste of home cooking. Currently Laotian food is not as easily accessible for those people who do not live amongst a Laotian community but is increasing in popularity and demand.

I have spent a great amount of time researching and trying to figure out what it will take to get the food from where it is now to where it needs to be. Due to budget constraints I have decided to start out small and test out the most popular items which are Laotian style beef jerky also known as “seen savan” which means heavenly beef. Within an hour of the jerky being put out it was gone with so many asking “who made this jerky” and commenting that it was the best Laotian jerky that they had ever tasted.

It’s only been a few months but since that day the request for Kohk & Sahk’s Laotian jerky has been growing every week with every batch selling out sometimes even before they can be made. As a result of this high demand, I realize that I needed to be able to have a large amount of supply handy. Due to the lack of funding and proper equipment, meeting the high demand became problematic. Ergo, I realize that in order to successful fulfill my dream of sustaining my company I needed funding.

Why:
Although we have been blessed with a growing fan base we have many obstacles to overcome which requires funding in order to solve it. Currently we are still in the testing phase where all production takes place at home and given to friends and family to try it. We know we have a good product but we need monetary assistance in order for us to get our company, Kohk & Sahk off its' feet. Help us bring the joy of Laotian cuisine into your home.

What will the money be used for:
In order for us to get our company off its' feet, we need to have the proper equipment such as meat slicers, dehydrators and staff. We also would like to keep cost down so that we can continue to provide quality food to everyone at a lower price with bigger quantity for the consumer which means being able to buy things in bulk. We are also working hard to meet the standards and compliance regulation so that we can start taking orders and making it available for everyone to buy which would require us to either look for an approved facility and partners that can get us there. Funds will also go towards development of an E-commerce website that will not only make it easy and convenient for anyone to order from anywhere. Also it will be a great resource vehicle about our company and all Laotian cuisine. Additional funding will also go towards the purchase of appropriate packaging for better quality control. In the next few months we also plan on launching a marketing plan as well as joining different food festivals and farmers market to share our product with everyone. Should there be enough available funding we will put it towards purchasing such items as tents, tables, banners, signage and handouts to ensure every event is a successful one.

Challenges:
-Regulations
When it comes to food safety, we have to meet USDA standards and regulations in order for our products to be deem safe for public consumption. Our goal is to be able to bring our tested and proven recipes to manufacturers who have experience in this arena. This requires money.

-Production
Our beef jerky will be made at an approved USDA facility. Your funds will be used to pay the facility who will produce our products. We are taking the time to carefully look through many production facilities that will help us safely produce quality products.

-Distribution
Shipping can be pricey. Therefore it is important that we find the most economical way to transport our products to you, our valued customer. We promise that we will do our best to keep the cost low.

Deadline goals:
It is our goal to to achieve everything we have listed for what we want to do with the money raised by this campaign by Laotian New Year of this year which is April 13, 2015 and we will do our best to make that happen. With your support and generosity we believe we will be able to make it there.



Flavors:
The texture, taste and flavor of Laotian jerky is uniquely different from any other jerky making it a whole different product that you just must taste. Currently with so many demands and request we are offering 3 different flavors of Laotian Jerky:

-Original
Thinly sliced beef, marinated overnight in sugar, spices and a delicious secret blend of flavoring sauces. The marinated beef is then slowly dehydrated, sprinkled with sesame seeds and given a quick flash fry to give it that unique taste of home.

-Spicy
The same as the original flavor but with added hot sauce, chili paste and dusted with chili powder for a generous and satisfying hot kick.

-Original pork
Much like the original beef but made of pork for all you pork lovers. It has an added flavor component that gives it a nice red hue and a hint of a char sui taste.

Testimonials:



Rewards:
To show you our appreciation for your contribution we have a list of exciting rewards for you. Should we meet our goal we will do a stretch goal with even more exciting rewards and freebies for those of you who have supported us. We know that getting your rewards is the most exciting part but because of increase demands please allow us some time before receiving your reward, we will do our best to keep you up to date. Perks and rewards include shipping for US residences only. If you live outside of the US you may have to pay for additional shipping to for your country.

Lao message video for my Laotian people

story:
What made me do it?

I didn't understand it. I capture really great photos so why would an extremely popular internet advertising company in the Bahamas tell me that they won't advertise my photo company because it was an internet company. An internet company turning down an internet company.Say what!? So I decided to create the next best thing. www.bizblast242.com

  • I'll never step on the tail of a lion. I'm not afraid of lions but I just don't want to get them angry or make them aware that lurking in the bushes. I am the courageous nerd nobody expected. Originally a graphic designer, my  expedition drifted onto the plains of videography, photography and web design. My name is Al but everybody calls me Al for short.
  • Inspired by Angie's List,  a whole lot of rejection and the victim of bad business service choices, I'm making my contribution to society by providing people with a super helpful, super easy to use tool  that can help  make better decisions as it relates to choosing business services.
  • Your pledge will help to disrupt a monopoly and provide more and better service options for Bahamians. It will greatly increase the likelihood of my dream of helping Bahamians become a reality while avoiding being eaten alive by a really, really huge, hungry, ferocious lion. 


What We Need & What You Get

  • The developers have been extremely helpful and patient and worked for a few tiny slices of cheese. However, all the cheese is vanishing before our eyes with the project, particularly the SMS communications module 35% completed. We need $15,000 to complete all modules and launch the very first public relations campaign on how BizBlast242.com can help Bahamians or the worldwide audience.
  • For your pledges and contributions, you gain exclusive access to the Bahamastock.com image library. Your level of exclusivity is based on your contribution. 
  • Whether this small goal is met or not, the project lives on because it will be of great value to Bahamians.


What's BizBlast242.com about?


BizBlast242 is an online hub dedicated to helping consumers find business locations, post helpful reviews and ratings for other consumers .Here is what your pledges and contributions will do. Once completed, any viewer can:

  • Find any business in the Bahamas fast. They can make informed decisions from helpful ratings and reviews and finally get much needed driving directions to difficult to locate locations. This will be a first.
  • See for yourself at www.bizblast242.com. . Just type pizza!


The Major Challenge

Breaking the preoccupation of business owners to get them to listen

  • I have assembled a team of volunteers through the Brand Ambassador initiative to help get the word out and get businesses listed before launch date

Other Ways You Can Help

Simply spread the word. It's as simple as that. Rate and review the businesses already listed that you have had some experience with.

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
I have met a number of great people over the years, but over the last year and change, I met one that has impacted me like no other. A man whose friendship is immense.  Someone that consistently mentored others, and tirelessly pushed them to be better people. With a larger than life persona that include a boisterous laugh, big muscles, and a confidence unparalleled, he could put anyone at ease. His demeanor and style of speaking are compelling and his words are filled with wisdom. While many think that his huge heart is a blessing in their lives, the truth is, it is largely reserved for one person - his daughter.

He speaks about her all the time, affectionately referring to her as his "Baby Girl". He seems to find her in everything. A song on the radio, a container of food, a picture of a car... Everything is either something that reminds him of his favorite things about her, something to share with her, or something to dream about doing with her. His Love for her is astounding, and inspiring.

As a father myself, I know that having a child can truly impact you as a person. It can change your perspective on everything. And she most certainly changed him. This strong, proud man could have his beliefs flipped upside down if she merely poses a simple question. I didn't know him before he had his daughter, but I am sure he was a great man then. And I know she made him a better one. 

Just over a week ago, this incredible man that I have the privilege of calling my friend, accidentally put his arm through a glass door that was shielding a fire hose. We hopped in an ambulance and went to the hospital where he was attended to and sent home. It was a freak accident, but the damage was so extensive that the hospital scheduled a day surgery to try to reconnect some of the tissues/nerves/tendons in his arm. He booked in, had the surgery, and I went to pick him up but they told me that he needed to stay overnight because he had a lot of sedative in his system. I visited with him briefly and saw my hulking friend relaxing, looking as cool as ever.  He made me laugh, as he always did and I told him we would catch up in the morning.  The following morning, just before being discharged, he passed away due to a pulmonary embolism.

My friend Loved his precious child deeply. I know that he wanted to be with her at every moment of the day. He wanted to support her dreams. He wanted to see her graduate. I'm asking you to help me honor his legacy by donating something towards her future. A good father is something to be celebrated, and I think the best way to do that, is to ensure that this child is not limited in her opportunities. I am hoping that this resonates for you because you want us all to take care of each other in these times of need. They say it takes a village to raise a child. Let's help her become an important member of the village so that she can take care of our children one day.

story:
Short Summary

About the project,

The idea of iStation was born in 2013 because we saw the need for such a device. It was strictly connected with sports and an active lifestyle. This social project was created out of passion to new technologies and our professional experience in advertisement and marketing. It is the first fully digital water station with pure drinkable water, free WiFi LTE  Internet access and enables the communication with mobile phone users by sending the push notification. 

To enrich the pro-social idea of the project we equipped iStation in a mobile app which the users can benefit from and without any additional activity support chosen charity. 

We haven’t forgotten about the handicapped; the iStation is fully adjusted to their needs as well. Mothers with children can drink water and use the free Internet access. Athletes, runners, cyclists, city officials. And at the end the businessmen can communicate with their employees if something is urgent or in an emergency.

The number of  benefits that iStation offers is countless. That is why it is so important to develop a network all over the world.

This project is a dream come true. A dream of innovation, which can change the world. Change the common day, common people. A dream to build and be able to leave behind something meaningful for the society. For humanity.


Why we need a support,

iStation is an innovative project. As each start-up it needs financing to expand it globally.

The goal of the IndieGoGo campaign is to gain the necessary means to develop the iStation network and introduce it all over the world. We want to reach every citizen in every city. We want to make you aware what iStation is and its magnitude for the society.

We also aim at gaining global partners who can significantly contribute to the expansion of this project.


What We Need & What You Get

About our goal,

Our aim is to acquire $7 000 000.

The costs of this project include building materials, technology, research, team of experts, production costs, expansion and development costs, costs of connection to infrastructure, legal services, expansion to new locations and other costs.


If we don't reach entire goal,

The project will be implemented/executed accordingly to the acquired financing.


The Impact

Why iStation project is valuable,

Participation is such a socially important project for business partners, marketers, biggest brands in the world gives you countless benefits, not only for brand exposure but also numerous benefits for your business.

There is no track record to be compared, as iStation is the first such pro-social, global project in the world.

This project is for CITYzens’ future all over the world. We just need your support.


Risks & Challenges

iStation means two models,

1. a pro-social project in which the city officials decide about its implementation in the city’s infrastructure

2. a business model

Model 1: in the last 2 years while preparing the iStation project  we had the chance to cooperate with the officials of the capital city of Warsaw, Poland. We have faced  many formal challenges which we have overcome. That is why, having gained so much experience and knowledge in execution and implementation of this project, we are sure of our success in developing iStation in other cities of the world.

Model 2: just order iStation and  you can use the free drinkable water, free Internet access and the possibility to communicate with the company’s employees via the push notification.


Other Ways You Can Help

We would really wish to reach the people so that we could present the iStation project to the world.

That is why we will be grateful for every small donation and for sharing our project on social media, such as Facebook, Twitter, etc.

We have adjusted all the tools both on IndieGoGo and on our website www.istationglobal.com to make sharing on social media possible.

We know, together we can change the world! What we need is your support!

For CITYzens’ FUTURE

Short SummaryAbout the project,The idea of iStation was born in 2013 because we saw the need for such a device. It was strictly connected with sports and an active lifestyle. This social project was created out of passion to new technologies and our professional experience in advertisement and marketing. It is the first fully digital water station with pure drinkable water, free WiFi LTE  Internet access and enables the communication with mobile phone users by sending the push notification. To enrich the pro-social idea of the project we equipped iStation in a mobile app which the users can benefit from and without any additional activity support chosen charity. We haven’t forgotten about the handicapped; the iStation is fully adjusted to their needs as well. Mothers with children can drink water and use the free Internet access. Athletes, runners, cyclists, city officials. And at the end the businessmen can communicate with their employees if something is urgent or in an emergency.The number of  benefits that iStation offers is countless. That is why it is so important to develop a network all over the world.This project is a dream come true. A dream of innovation, which can change the world. Change the common day, common people. A dream to build and be able to leave behind something meaningful for the society. For humanity.Why we need a support,iStation is an innovative project. As each start-up it needs financing to expand it globally.The goal of the IndieGoGo campaign is to gain the necessary means to develop the iStation network and introduce it all over the world. We want to reach every citizen in every city. We want to make you aware what iStation is and its magnitude for the society.We also aim at gaining global partners who can significantly contribute to the expansion of this project.
What We Need & What You Get
About our goal,
Our aim is to acquire $7 000 000.
The costs of this project include building materials, technology, research, team of experts, production costs, expansion and development costs, costs of connection to infrastructure, legal services, expansion to new locations and other costs.
If we don't reach entire goal,
The project will be implemented/executed accordingly to the acquired financing.


The Impact
Why iStation project is valuable,
Participation is such a socially important project for business partners, marketers, biggest brands in the world gives you countless benefits, not only for brand exposure but also numerous benefits for your business.
There is no track record to be compared, as iStation is the first such pro-social, global project in the world.
This project is for CITYzens’ future all over the world. We just need your support.

sharing on social media possible.

story:
Hi, My name is Bradley Townsend I'm a 14 year old athlete, hoping to further my rowing career. 

I started rowing in August 2014 with Murwillumbah Rowing Club, and have surprised everyone around me and myself, with my success, i train 6 days a week on the water and alternate afternoons and mornings for training on my erg and weight machine around my schooling.

I competed in my first regatta in January this year and won my first race, in both single  and doubles with my rowing Partner, i then competed in the NSW state championships in Sydney at the international regatta centre and made it to the semi finals.

On the 1st of march i competed in the Grafton/Iluka regatta and entered 4 races, winning them all, both single and doubles.

I am asking for donations to help buy my own boat, as many at the club are not suited to racing and my size, so this can be customised to my needs, I'm hoping to make it into the Northern Rivers Academy of Sport in July and then move on to the State championships and the national championships in 2016.

My main goal is to keep up my training and competing in as many regattas as i possibly can and ultimately make the olympic team.
