story:
You and me can help stranded refugees buy a place to stay.

In every EU country the rules for refugees all over the world are extremely strict. It is also proven that they have a traumatic experience for the 2end time in their life. On a daily base i can see these people suffer, and it really breaks my heart when i see them walking around with no proper place to stay, all i can say is: let us show them some love, by giving them a warm home and a place to stay.

In order to get to buy an old building, and turn it in a new home, i need your help and kindness to make it happen for these people. Nobody wants to be in a position of a refugee, think about it...

If we al prove the world wrong, by helping eachother, lets guarantee regugees a home, or place to stay, without the trauma.

I thank you in advance, we thank you

Sincerely,


Robbert Starke

story:
Summary

Since 1996 our local Habitat for Humanity affiliate, Lancaster/Northumberland Habitat for Humanity (LNHFH) has been giving deserving neighbors a hand up, not a handout by constructing affordable homes that those selected as Habitat’s partners purchase when completed. 

That’s right: Habitat homeowners purchase their homes – no outright gifts. We’re located in a rural area where affordable housing isn’t always available for many of our neighbors. Still, we have built sixteen homes and are now completing #17, and for twenty years we’ve been able to keep costs to homeowners low. 

How is that possible? Two ways: 

1.   Volunteer labor keeps construction costs low, so the total cost of a mortgage is quite affordable.

2.   No-interest Mortgages allow homeowners to repay only the costs LNHFH incurs for materials and some professional services.

But let’s face it: Providing affordable homes and no-interest mortgages isn’t easy. So—LNHFH needs funds to purchase building materials and pay for services like water and sewer hookups and specialized services. 

What We Need & What You Get

For LNHFH to carry out its mission of constructing affordable housing, we need cash donations. Today the costs for building a two- or three-bedroom home of approximately 1,500 square feet in a community in Virginia’s Northern Neck runs to $100,000 or more, depending on expenses for site preparation, permits and other associated costs.

We build each home on a pay-as-you-go basis: We collect funds from friends and neighbors who believe in the work we do. Donations of any size are welcome. As we receive donations we purchase materials to begin and complete construction. The faster we achieve our goal of $100,000 for each home, the sooner we can complete construction and move on to the next one.

House #17 is already framed and under roof.  We are confident we'll complete it in time, but your contribution today will help us put in the foundation for our next home (#18) and make it easier to attract additional funding for house #18 once we can show other funders that the work is underway.

The Impact

There’s nothing more rewarding than seeing the smiles of new homeowners at the dedication ceremony for homes they help construct. That’s right – all Habitat homeowners put in 300 hours of “sweat equity” constructing the homes they’ll live in. In an area where affordable housing is scarce and nearly half the population lives dangerously close to the poverty line, Habitat homes are making a real difference.

We have the land and we have the people.  We just need to increase the flow of funds.  Please help change the lives of our families and help their future generations lead a better life through the pride of homeownership.   Help us change lives and our community for the better.

story:
Hi. I’m David Kirby and this is my store; Parker Street Market. 


            

We are a small grocery store in Detroit, Michigan that carries an array of locally made food and drink. From heirloom ketchup and potato chips to cookie dough and salsa, Detroit’s food producers are a passionate, creative, ever expanding group. We opened in West Village in April 2014 with 10 locally-made items on our shelves. One year later we have over 300 items, a beer & wine license, and are physically running out of space to take on new vendors. Help us fund our expansion!

We have an open door policy here at Parker Street: If you are a local Michigan-made food producer, no matter how small your business, you can find shelf space here. The model has worked! Almost daily, community members with both fledgling and well-established businesses alike come to Parker Street where we happily and proudly carry their products. Parker Street offers small food businesses an intro into the world of wholesale that larger markets cannot accommodate. Word has gotten out about the market, and less than a year after opening, we are out of shelf space! Our solution is to expand into the adjacent storefront next door -- we’ve already begun renovating for our expansion and with your help, we will be able to more than double our capacity and continue our goal of having every single food business based here in Detroit on our shelves.

Well, we always appreciate you coming by and shopping in our store, but if you’re unable to make it to Detroit, or just want to help us along a little bit more you can donate to our IndieGOGO campaign.

We’re asking for $27,000 in order to complete the construction for our expansion. Reinvesting all of our capital into active inventory has made it challenging to save for new opportunities.  Our plan is to expand our 700 sq ft storefront (1814 Parker) by adjoining the adjacent 700 sq ft (1816 Parker) storefront and doubling out inventory. A breakdown of necessary expenses and larger capital expenditures are as follows:   

Parker Street has enormous potential! We opened April 1st, 2014 with 10 items. We haze zero debt and reinvest all of our money back into our business. In less than a year we’ve exponentially increased our offerings and have become a viable, sustaining small business. So why do we need your help if we’re already a success? Because it’s been a long year, slowly reinvesting our profits in order to buy new products and add new equipment like freezers and refrigerators has not left us with enough to continue our expansion into the space next door. If we continue this re-investment model of growth it will take at least another year, probably longer to fully realize our goal for Parker Street Market. We know this model works but having limited capital is holding us back from the real growth that we want to experience. This money will revolutionize Parker Street. We’ve already done so much with so little, your donation will give us an opportunity for growth we’ve never had before.

The impact of your donation is real and substantial. By donating to this campaign, you’re not only helping Parker Street, but you’re also helping every single vendor here that has quit their job, started a business and rely on us and our customers for their livelihoods. We are pursuing our dream of creating something positive for our community and having the creative and financial independence that comes with owning your own business. There are everyday challenges and risks that we all face in doing so but your donation will go a long long way by helping all of us.

In return we have a few items that you can receive and show off to everyone that you’ve supported not just one but dozens of small businesses in Detroit.  Check out the perks to the right to see a variety of donation options!

If you can’t contribute, please stop in anytime, Tuesday through Sunday and come say hi. Our address is 1814 Parker St. Detroit MI, 48214.


You can also help us by sharing this video or sending the IndieGoGo link to your friends and family. Thank you for your consideration and support!
story_txt:
Hi. I’m David Kirby and this is my store; Parker Street Market. 

            We are a small grocery store in Detroit, Michigan that carries an array of locally made food and drink. From heirloom ketchup and potato chips to cookie dough and salsa, Detroit’s food producers are a passionate, creative, ever expanding group. We opened in West Village in April 2014 with 10 locally-made items on our shelves. One year later we have over 300 items, a beer & wine license, and are physically running out of space to take on new vendors. Help us fund our expansion!We have an open door policy here at Parker Street: If you are a local Michigan-made food producer, no matter how small your business, you can find shelf space here. The model has worked! Almost daily, community members with both fledgling and well-established businesses alike come to Parker Street where we happily and proudly carry their products. Parker Street offers small food businesses an intro into the world of wholesale that larger markets cannot accommodate. Word has gotten out about the market, and less than a year after opening, we are out of shelf space! Our solution is to expand into the adjacent storefront next door -- we’ve already begun renovating for our expansion and with your help, we will be able to more than double our capacity and continue our goal of having every single food business based here in Detroit on our shelves.
Well, we always appreciate you coming by and shopping in our store, but if you’re unable to make it to Detroit, or just want to help us along a little bit more you can donate to our IndieGOGO campaign.We’re asking for $27,000 in order to complete the construction for our expansion. Reinvesting all of our capital into active inventory has made it challenging to save for new opportunities.  Our plan is to expand our 700 sq ft storefront (1814 Parker) by adjoining the adjacent 700 sq ft (1816 Parker) storefront and doubling out inventory. A breakdown of necessary expenses and larger capital expenditures are as follows:   Parker Street has enormous potential! We opened April 1st, 2014 with 10 items. story:
Appreciation Rewards:

To appreciate your support and generous donation, I would like to offer you my organic bath and body products at a discounted rate and free shipping within  the lower 48 US states.

I hope you'll join me and be part of the Sunsara Story...

Other Ways You Can Help

I  truly  appreciate  any  donation  that  you can contribute! But those who are unable to give anything  monetarily, I would  genuinely  appreciate  your  support  in whatever way you can. 

Like us on Facebook or follow us on Twitter and by all means tell your friends, family and coworkers.

story:
How The Creation Shop Started

My son started this idea two years ago when he was in fifth grade.  He did a business project for school and got us excited about starting The Creation Shop.   Our dream is to have our business in a wonderful building.  

Our Family  

I have three children.  They are ages 12, 10, and 9.  My children already have been helping with the business.  My 10 year old daughter loves to design jewelry and make other crafts.  They are excited to help at our store so they can make money of their own.  The Creation Shop will also help them learn responsibility and how to run a business.

What The Creation Shop Will Offer

We are going to be selling crafts, Bibles, Bible covers, Christian music, and other Christian items.  There will be art, voice, and music lessons for children and adults.  We are looking forward to having craft classes, parties for kids, family days, art camp for children, scrap booking classes, and card making classes.

How Your Money Will Help

Your money will help us to buy instruments and art supplies for needy children.  We will use the money to pay the rent for a wonderful building in Sharpsville, PA, all of the basic retail equipment, store displays, paint,  utilities, internet, computer, register, phone service, signs, craft supplies, Christian inventory, licenses, professional fees, insurance, security cameras, taxes, and, advertising.

Please help us fulfill our dreams and help our community.

story:
For the past thirteen years, my staff, my family and I have been blessed with the honor of being local independent booksellers in southeast Minnesota. The beautiful Mississippi River town of Winona, Minnesota is the home of Winona State University and St. Mary's University of Minnesota.  A regional cultural and arts center, Winona hosts several annual events, including The Great River Shakespeare Festival, The Minnesota Beethoven Festival, Midwest Music Fest, Boats and Bluegrass, and more.  We are, however, at risk of losing our independent bookstore.

     Do you love books and independent bookstores?  Would you like an opportunity to help one keep its doors open?  Through this IndieGoGo Campaign, you can!

     Funds raised through this campaign will be used to reduce operating debt,

refresh inventories, and expand our beloved children's department, which already boasts a castle the kids can climb inside and relax with a book.

     How can you help?  By donating and selecting one of the perks, you will receive hand selected books throughout the year...books that you might not find, without a passionate bookseller to guide you.

story:
SpotMe Mobile

Hello Indiegogo-ian's, my name is Jax, a 10+ year graphic designer/UX/UI Designer and motivated Entrepreneur. I started SpotMe Mobile several months ago from an idea that why can't we make money transferring between our peers more socially interactive. With the current mobile social boom going on, our goal is to bring you a mobile app that refines how we deal with money between our peers. Giving people a more related and convenient experience of peer to peer money transferring in our daily lives.

As mobile money transactions are slowly becoming the norm, this app will be the starting point for us to incorporate more features in the future such as a digital wallet. Yes, there is currently a lot of great money transferring mobile apps available on the market. But as a designer, I always strive to improve something and fill in the missing pieces.

 

SpotMe Mobile Needs Your Help!

After months of designing and refining the layout to create a prototype that we believe gives you a more social user experience. Now SpotMe Mobile needs your help to get to development and bring this concept to life.

Our ultimate goal here is to raise 50k and all proceeds will go to the development, testing, and the live launch on App store and Google play. If the 50k is not fully met, we will still be able to get our app into development. Because we have a great team that has the same passion for SpotMe to succeed, any remaining cost necessary to bring SpotMe Mobile to development will be funded. So the term anything helps definitely applies and will be much appreciated. 

 

What You Get In Return

To show how much passion and confidence we have in SpotMe Mobile, in return for your contribution you will receive a SpotMe Mobile t-shirt (one shirt per contribution). Which, we will use as a promotional item in the future for our backers, so hang on to those shirts.

Contributions $1-$49 = A Grateful Thank You

Contributions $50-$99 = Caledon Color T-Shirt with White Logo

Contributions $100+ = Caledon Color T-Shirt with Gold Logo

**Note: The "GET THIS PERK" button only allows $50 or $100 contribution for a t-shirt. If your contribution is within the parameters and you use the "BACK IT "button, I will request for your shipping address by email.**

story:
Liberty Guns is a small, family-owned business that believes in upholding the Constitution and helping law-abiding citizens exercise their 2nd amendment rights.

We pride ourselves on providing superior service, consultations, and helping our community through classes and one-on-one instruction. Our goal from the time we opened our doors in January 2014 was to have a safe place where people of all experience levels could learn and find the products that best fit their personal and home defense needs. We have worked tirelessly in our efforts to share our passion.

Unfortunately our passion and livelihood was attacked on April 3rd at 3:58am by a faceless thug.  You can read the full story here: Bandit steals dozens of pistols from gun shop

We have been overwhelmed by the amount of support received from our community and other local businesses. The ATF and local Sheriff's office are close to nabbing the perpetrator. We are repairing, updating and picking ourselves up off the ground. We thought this act of cruelty and its repercussions would be short lived and we could move forward quickly. That was until we discovered that due to a “technicality” our insurance company is refusing to cover our losses, putting us in a $25,000+ hole.

This is a last resort for the Liberty Guns family. We humbly ask for your support in any way possible. The $25,000 goal will help cover some of the costs of restocking our shelves, covering repairs, and keeping our doors open from the days of lost business. This tragic and violating event shows just how important exercising our 2nd Amendment rights remain, and we feel it is our duty to provide a means to do so in our local and online communities.

We not only ask for your monetary support, but we also ask that you help us bring this perpetrator to justice. Any help in identifying the perpetrator will be greatly appreciated and will help bring closure to this tragedy. 
If you have any information, please immediately contact: 
Detective Mark Dykes with the Paulding County Sheriff’s Department at (770)-443-3015.

We are offering a $500 reward for any information leading to the arrest of this thug.
A list of the stolen inventory is posted below. If anyone attempts to sell a make and model of these types, please check the Serial Number to ensure it is not stolen property.

story:
Helping people who are helping people

Hello dear present and future friends. Some of you seeing this campaign might already know me but for those of you who don't my name is Mynah Marie and I'm a 34-years old musician who's been on the road for over 12 years and lived in 6 different countries. 

In November 2014, I visited Kathmandu, Nepal. At the time I was living in India and my trip to Nepal was nothing more than a formality in order to get my Indian visa renewal. The day after my arrival, I found myself blessed by life and through a series of coincidences I met one of the most beautiful communities of people I'd ever seen. 

In the little neighbourhood of Swayambhu, in the outskirts of Kathmandu, there is a group of people who work hard every day to improve the life of the people in their community. 

  • They host the Swayambhu Community School , where children go after their classes to receive not only help for their homework but also learn about Art, meditation and how to take care of the environment. Meditation classes are given to the children by Amir Lama and the Art program "Colourful Hands", aiming to teach children to free their creativity, is given by the contemporary and traditional thangka artist Krishna Thing.
  • The children of the school also participate in weekly cleaning campaigns held every Saturday. By including them in the responsibility of having a clean environment, Krishna and Amir hope to pass on the their students some important human values, such as the respect of the environment and of others, by encouraging them to action.

  • They have created and put into place the "True Citizens Campaign" as an initiative of a group of young-spirited people from around the globe. They have chosen to take responsibility for sensitizing others to the value of all aspects of human life by offering their knowledge, artistic expression and experience to the benefit of the community. 
  • They have created foundations (AANGAN Foundation , Studio MANDALA) to support the projects and initiatives of the community and of the people involved in the True Citizens Campaign. Some of the initiatives of these foundations include: a four days free health camp in Sindhupalchock district where they served around 800 patients with a health check up along with necessary health counselling and free medicine distribution, provided scholarships to high school students in Lalitpur from 2009 to 2011, built gender friendly toilets in public schools of Kathmandu in 2010, implemented an ECD (Early Child Development) school in Banskharka to secure children’s Right to Education, started agricultural projects in Lisankhu to empower women to genarate income, conducted various trainings in agriculture and animal husbandry for women in Lamatar of Lalitpur, conducted awareness campaigns and workshops to the high school students in Lisankhu to utilize the right to information for the development of their community and held several exhibitions in different parts of UK for charity and selling Nepali handicrafts to raise funds for future projects.
  • Some of them are also artists and musicians dedicated to protect, spread and educate people around the globe about the traditional Art, music and culture of Nepal. Member of the True Citizen Campaign, Krishna Thing was born in 1979 in the East of Nepal. He started his artistic career 20 years ago in Kathmandu. After studying with thangka masters and working as an apprentice for many years, Krishna earned his living from thangka painting for 7 years before deciding on changing his artistic direction by adding contemporary elements. Below is a picture of one of his paintings called "OUR VISION".
  • In other projects, Krishna teams up with artists from all over the World to use Art to sensitize people on social or environmental issues. By transforming waste materials into beautiful and compelling pieces of art work, Krishna Thing and other like minded artists hope to pass on a strong message to sensitize people from around the globe to certain realities of their country and culture. In collaboration with the organization Da Mind Tree , Krishna and a group of people travel every year to the Mount Everest to collect whatever pieces of garbage they can find. In the year of 2013, they collected over a tone and a half of waste on the mountain. With the waste that was collected, Krishna and the other members created the sculptures that were to be exposed in the Visual Art Symposium, not only in Nepal but also in France, Sweden and India. See Krishna Thing with the Mount Everest Project  

  • In addition of being active on so many levels in their community, they also provide a safe haven for foreigners like me, travellers from abroad that sometimes have lost their way in a culture that can be so different. They welcome everybody with opens arms and so much patience to explain and to help in whatever way is needed. 

From them I've gained so much inspiration and strength. Because of them, I will always carry Nepal in my heart as a place to come back to, where it feels like home.

Now disaster has struck. The news from the ground in Nepal, coming directly from people who are living the disaster, is that much help is needed. Houses are destroyed. They live on the ground. Many families are homeless and have no food or drinking water. Sickness is settling in. Still, this group of people is there everyday, helping the community and trying to provide what is needed to as many people as possible.

This crowdfunding campaign is an attempt for me to try and give back. I am reaching out to you, dear friends, to help me support a community of people that truly deserves it, in a huge time of need.

What They Need & What They Will Do

  • Any money donation, even if very small, will be greatly appreciated. Your 5$ might seem insignificant in your reality but it can actually mean food for a family for a day or two. 5$ makes a difference, it really does.
  • The funds collected will go straight to Amir Lama, president of the Aangan Foundation. With the support of the foundation, Amir Lama and the close members of the community will take the responsibility to distribute the funds through appropriate organizations working on the ground in Kathmandu and they will personally help the children of the community and their families by providing medicine packs, food, water and help in any way possible or needed. 
After the earthquake  I personally sent money to Amir Lama and this is the message he wrote back to me : "Thank you Mynah, for your rewarding role to support children effected by earthquake in Nepal. Just to confirm I have received the money from your family. We have distributed emergency relief family packs including rice, lentil, cooking oil, salt, sugar, biscuits and noodles, for the pregnant women and child under 3 years, viva and lactogen, water purification liquid and mosquito net, around Swayambhu and Nuwakot. I will share you our activities photos with more details in next message, when I will have proper access to internet. With lots of love and respect". 
The Impact
By supporting this campaign, you are supporting a group of people who work hard everyday to fulfill the mission to help and give to their community and to the World in general. Please go to this link to read a direct written testimonial from Amir Lama and read about what they have already accomplished: Amir Lama - The Story of a social activist working in the shadows

Other Ways You Can Help

If you think there are people in your personal network that might be interested to help, please share this campaign. The louder the voices, the further they can be heard.  You can use the Indiegogo share tools to share this on your social media profiles. 

Thank you so much, all of you, for caring enough and taking the time to read through this campaign. I hope that some of the stories, facts and intentions expressed above managed to reach your hearts. I truly believe that in these times we live in, it's important to inspire ourselves with examples of people who are truly trying to make a difference in this World in the most open-minded and compassionate way. To me, the Swayambhu community: Amir, Krishna, Parin, Angel, Baba, and the others are my inspiration. Through them, I learn how to become a better person and I find the motivation in my heart, everyday, to try and give something back.  I hope you will join me in this journey.

Much love and blessings to all,

Mynah Marie

In the little neighbourhood of Swayambhu, in the outskirts of Kathmandu, there is a group of people who work hard every day to improve the life of the people in their community. 



They host the Swayambhu Community School , where children go after their classes to receive not only help for their homework but also learn about Art, meditation and how to take care of the environment. Meditation classes are given to the children by Amir Lama and the Art program "Colourful Hands", aiming to teach children to free their creativity, is given by the contemporary and traditional thangka artist Krishna Thing.

The children of the school also participate in weekly cleaning campaigns held every Saturday. By including them in the responsibility of having a clean environment, Krishna and Amir hope to pass on the their students some important human values, such as the respect of the environment and of others, by encouraging them to action.
They have created and put into place the "True Citizens Campaign" as an initiative of a group of young-spirited people from around the globe. They have chosen to take responsibility for sensitizing others to the value of all aspects of human life by offering their knowledge, artistic expression and experience to the benefit of the community. 

They have created foundations (AANGAN Foundation , Studio MANDALA) to support the projects and initiatives of the community and of the people involved in the True Citizens Campaign. Some of the initiatives of these foundations include: a four days free health camp in Sindhupalchock district where they served around 800 patients with a health check up along with necessary health counselling and free medicine distribution, provided scholarships to high school students in Lalitpur from 2009 to 2011, built gender friendly toilets in public schools of Kathmandu in 2010, implemented an ECD (Early Child Development) school in Banskharka to secure children’s Right to Education, started agricultural projects in Lisankhu to empower women to genarate income, conducted various trainings in agriculture and animal husbandry for women in Lamatar of Lalitpur, conducted awareness campaigns and workshops to the high school students in Lisankhu to utilize the right to information for the development of their community and held several exhibitions in different parts of UK for charity and selling Nepali handicrafts to raise funds for future projects.


Some of them are also artists and musicians dedicated to protect, spread and educate people around the globe about the traditional Art, music and culture of Nepal. Member of the True Citizen Campaign, Krishna Thing was born in 1979 in the East of Nepal. He started his artistic career 20 years ago in Kathmandu. After studying with thangka masters and working as an apprentice for many years, Krishna earned his living from thangka painting for 7 years before deciding on changing his artistic direction by adding contemporary elements. Below is a picture of one of his paintings called "OUR VISION".

In other projects, Krishna teams up with artists from all over the World to use Art to sensitize people on social or environmental issues. By transforming waste materials into beautiful and compelling pieces of art work, Krishna Thing and other like minded artists hope to pass on a strong message to sensitize people from around the globe to certain realities of their country and culture. In collaboration with the organization Da Mind Tree , Krishna and a group of people travel every year to the Mount Everest to collect whatever pieces of garbage they can find. In the year of 2013, they collected over a tone and a half of waste on the mountain. With the waste that was collected, Krishna and the other members created the sculptures that were to be exposed in the Visual Art Symposium, not only in Nepal but also in France, Sweden and India. See Krishna Thing with the Mount Everest Project  
In addition of being active on so many levels in their community, they also provide a safe haven for foreigners like me, travellers from abroad that sometimes have lost their way in a culture that can be so different. They welcome everybody with opens arms and so much patience to explain and to help in whatever way is needed. 

From them I've gained so much inspiration and strength. Because of them, I will always carry Nepal in my heart as a place to come back to, where it feels like home.
Now disaster has struck. The news from the ground in Nepal, coming directly from people who are living the disaster, is that much help is needed. Houses are destroyed. They live on the ground. Many families are homeless and have no food or drinking water. Sickness is settling in. Still, this group of people is there everyday, helping the community and trying to provide what is needed to as many people as possible.
This crowdfunding campaign is an attempt for me to try and give back. I am reaching out to you, dear friends, to help me support a community of people that truly deserves it, in a huge time of need.
What They Need & What They Will Do


Any money donation, even if very small, will be greatly appreciated. Your 5$ might seem insignificant in your reality but it can actually mean food for a family for a day or two. 5$ makes a difference, it really does.

The funds collected will go straight to Amir Lama, president of the Aangan Foundation. With the support of the foundation, Amir Lama and the close members of the community will take the responsibility to distribute the funds through appropriate organizations working on the ground in Kathmandu and they will personally help the children of the community and their families by providing medicine packs, food, water and help in any way possible or needed. 

After the earthquake  I personally sent money to Amir Lama and this is the message he wrote back to me : "Thank you Mynah, for your rewarding role to support children effected by earthquake in Nepal. Just to confirm I have received the money from your family. We have distributed emergency relief family packs including rice, lentil, cooking oil, salt, sugar, biscuits and noodles, for the pregnant women and child under 3 years, viva and lactogen, water purification liquid and mosquito net, around Swayambhu and Nuwakot. I will share you our activities photos with more details in next message, when I will have proper access to internet. With lots of love and respect". 
 
The Impact



By supporting this campaign, you are supporting a group of people who work hard everyday to fulfill the mission to help and give to their community and to the World in general. Please go to this link to read a direct written testimonial from Amir Lama and read about what they have already accomplished: Amir Lama - The Story of a social activist working in the shadows

    Other Ways You Can Help If you think there are people in your personal network that might be interested to help, please share this campaign. The louder the voices, the further they can be heard.  You can use the Indiegogo share tools to share this on your social media profiles. 
Thank you so much, all of you, for caring enough and taking the time to read through this campaign. I hope that some of the stories, facts and intentions expressed above managed to reach your hearts. I truly believe that in these times we live in, it's important to inspire ourselves with examples of people who are truly trying to make a difference in this World in the most open-minded and compassionate way. To me, the Swayambhu community: Amir, Krishna, Parin, Angel, Baba, and the others are my inspiration. Through them, I learn how to become a better person and I find the motivation in my heart, everyday, to try and give something back.  I hope you will join me in this journey.
Much love and blessings to all,
Mynah Marie

story:
When we first learned about acai fruit and its powerful health benefits, we wanted to learn more. After years of research, Constance and Johannes took it to the kitchen and hand-crafted  a fantastic recipe called Acai Soda.
Come enjoy Acai Soda with us; join our cause by contributing to our campaign and drinking our amazing Acai Soda! 

Our goal is to invigorate a refreshing lifestyle by revolutionizing soda into something that has a positive impact on society while also representing beneficial effects. We also have an Acai Brand Co. book which is focused on educating consumers about the research, science, and empirical evidence relating to Acai. The goal of our book is to have a legitimate source of information for everyone to understand more about acai fruit. It's our goal to share important information relating to acai and how it can improve people's daily lives.

Acai Brand's Vision:

  • Acai Brand values viability and great quality, so we developed Acai Soda the worlds most innovative beverage.
  • Acai Soda is a hand-crafted soda beverage that's been designed to inspire everyone...
  • Acai Brand is interested in crafting great tasting, all-natural Acai Soda.
  •  Learn more @www.AcaiBrand.com

We are currently taking contributions through the form of pre-orders. Please take the time to get your shipment now. 

We chose to partner with Indiegogo by releasing our first ever crowd funding campaign! By fulfilling the purchase order requirements you are essentially helping to expand this amazing brand .
With help from contributors like you, we look forward to expanding Acai Soda and turning it into a company that's built to last.
This funding campaign provides you with an opportunity to join the "Acai Brand movement" and to help expand Acai Soda throughout the world. 


The bulk of the funding we raise for this project will provide us with the capital we need to produce the FIFO inventory required for Acai Soda in order to bring a great beverage to the market. We look forward to setting up your pre-order now. Help us to expand our brand, hire a great sales force, and surpass our fundraising goal of $47,500. If you like to learn more about our business and our plans for future projects visit Acaisoda.com or contact us at 1-855-817-0771. These opportunities will be listed below. 


Along with our soda, Acai Brand Co. has many other growth opportunities planned for the future. Multiple sub-products are in the works on various platforms. Some of these objectives include: books, smartphone applications, merchandise, and scientific research. Our primary focus is to promote awareness of Acai to consumers and elaborate on the many benefits it naturally provides. Majority of our products are centered around Acai and it is our mission to shed light on its importance to the world. 


In appreciation of the contributions we receive, we are offering perks for those who support our goal. We believe our perks are items that you’d love to purchase for yourself or for someone else. Your pre-order and contribution will earn you additional rewards and benefits. Each level of donation will receive various items including: stickers, books, Acai Soda and more. 


Acai Brand Co. would like to thank everyone for backing this project. We realize that our dreams can come true with the support of people like you who care to make a difference. We greatly appreciate everyone’s help and we look forward to turning our goals into reality. Thanks again. 

 

We would not have been able to make this all possible without the help of some of our awesome champions. Thank you all for your support:

We want to thank some of our original contributors Pam Smith, Roger Wright, Sergio Chavez, Elizabeth Chavez, and everyone that has helped to make this dream possible.


When can I expect to receive my perk items? 

After reaching our goal of of $47,500 in September of 2015, we will begin producing perk items immediately. All orders will be fulfilled by no later than November 30th, 2015.  If you like to learn more about Acai Soda please visit Acaisoda.com or contact us at 1-855-817-0771.

Can I get a return on perk items?

Unfortunately, our perk items are nonrefundable and no refunds will be made. It is our goal to ensure that we raise enough funding through this campaign and from our sales channels to deliver each order of Acai Soda by November 30, 2015...  Join the movement today and contribute through one of the pre-order options now!

story:
Short Summary

If you could change the world by just being you, would you? If you could help cure diseases, house the homeless, teach a child by simply clicking a button, would you?  ...Go ahead, click the button, start changing your world today.

Imagine being able to support your favorite charity or cause by simply being counted, without having to donate any more money, by simply living your live on purpose. The Purpose United Project (PUP) social network was created to do just that. Now you can support your youth sports team, your faith, wounded vets, find a cure for cancer, and countless other worthy causes by just downloading the free Purpose United Project mobile app and selecting your favorite Causes. Your simple vote earns your favorite cause a sustainable monthly funding stream from local business sponsors. You never are asked to give money, just try and shop on purpose by patronizing the local supportive businesses that are supporting the Causes you hold dear.  As a thank you for using the Purpose United Project mobile apps and online directories our sponsoring businesses in every city post incredible deals on just about anything you may ever want.  Join the PUP unified community of Great Causes, Caring People and Supportive Businesses. Together we spread awareness of our community's needs and build a sustainable funding stream for the Great Causes that are meeting these many needs.  


PUP Overview

The Purpose United Project (PUP) is a social entrepreneurial venture that concentrates its efforts on a double bottom line: 1) Profitable returns for its stakeholders, and 2) Positive Community Impact. We accomplish these objectives through the creation of a sustainable businesses model based on high- margin, localized digital advertising services. A percentage of the proceeds from advertising sales in each city creates a monthly funding pool that is shared with our member-selected Charity organizations in each city we operate in. As social entrepreneurs, PUP believes that all businesses should make community development a major part of their business model. Rather than hording profits, the social entrepreneur invests retained earnings back into the communities they are doing business in. Beyond the cash flow needed to ensure our sustainable business model, all funds will go back into the communities through monthly financial support of the Charities our members have voted for. It is our ultimate goal to have up to 75% of all advertising revenue go back into supporting our communities through great paying local jobs and Charity support. Could you imagine if other social networks, such as Facebook, did the same... instead of making a few people incredibly rich they took those billions in profits and gave it back to the community. The Purpose United Project will be doing just that. With your help, we will lead the way in leveraging a social network for doing good, for supporting our member's chosen causes, for making our world a better place. 


PUP Business Model

Purpose United Project creates a social movement of Great Causes, Caring People, and Supportive Businesses that unite for the purpose of driving greater awareness of their community's needs, and creating sustainable funding streams to help meet those needs. This Purpose United Project social network facilitates the mutually beneficial relationships between these three parties. Great Causes are able realize the untapped value in the size of their current supporter network by simply asking them to become part of the PUP social movement on their behalf. Cause organizations use their current channels of communication to ask their supporters to download the free Purpose United Project mobile app and vote for them. That's it! Every month the Cause will receive a check for their portion of their city's PUP funding pool.  The more people that vote for them, the greater their portion of the monthly funding pool. In this way, charities are able to leverage their social collateral like never before. Caring People are able to support their chosen causes by simply downloading the free PUP mobile app, voting for their favorite Causes, and finding local Cause-supporting businesses that offer incredible PUP member-only deals. No purchase is ever necessary, as Causes are funded through the sponsorship of local caring businesses. By patronizing PUP-supporting businesses, members ensure that these businesses will keep supporting our member’s Causes through continued advertising. By sharing PUP with friends and family, supporters help spread the PUP movement of caring people. Supportive Businesses enjoy unparalleled digital advertising results, as their ads and daily deals are shared with the loyal and motivated network of PUP supporters through the PUP mobile app, online business directory, and targeted opt-in email distributions.  A loyal, mutually beneficial relationship is formed as PUP members support the businesses that are supporting the Causes they care about, and these businesses respond with incredible PUP member-only deals. Now businesses can enjoy building their customer base while supporting their community's charities with their advertising sponsorship on the PUP network. PUP creates a truly beneficial relationship between all parties involved.


Why PUP Works:

By creating a unique value proposition for each of these three groups, the Purpose United Project creates high user engagement resulting in a loyal network of participants that viral spread the growth of PUP to their friends and family. Every party benefits from PUP. Charities receive sustainable funding. Members get great deals on countless products and services. Businesses enjoy truly effective Cause-related marketing for one low monthly fee. As the PUP member base grows in each city it creates an attractive advertising channel that results in the sustainable business model needed to meet our profit and community development goals and mandates.

The PUP business model is monetized along the lines of other social media organizations. The growing population of engaged members attracts the advertising revenue. The higher the population of engaged users, the more valuable this advertising channel becomes. Our integrated digital marketing platforms have a very low cost of service. The low cost of service combined with the recurring monthly revenue stream create a highly profitable business model. This model can afford to provide sustainable funding for charities as a result of the charities being the mechanism by which the member population is acquired. The Purpose United Project has virtually no customer acquisition costs and very low product production and delivery costs. These cost savings are the basis for creating high paying local jobs in each community while providing millions of dollars of monthly financial support for our member’s chosen Causes. Unlike other social media platforms, we distribute the majority of profits back into the community rather than hording it. 


Roll out Strategy:

Phase One:  The initial roll out market of Rochester, NY will be performed by the PUP sales team. During this 3-6 month test market phase, we will be standardizing the collateral and sales techniques needed for the nationwide rollout. 

Phase Two:  Once the Rochester, NY market has been effectively launched and procedures cemented, we will then concentrate on multi-city roll outs via licensed re-sellers. These re-sellers will be comprised of established local media, advertising and sales organizations. Through the use of these strategic channel partners, the PUP organization will transform from an advertising sales organization into the technology and operations support hub for a nation of strategic re-sellers. 

Once we transition from advertising sales to a support hub, our concentration will be focused in four main areas: 1) Re-seller recruitment and support, 2) Charity recruitment and support, 3) Product innovation and development, 4) Nationwide branding and marketing. By concentrating our efforts on recruiting and supporting local re-sellers in each city market, we will foster expedited market penetration with the much lower capital requirements of this "franchise" model. In addition to the financial benefits of a "franchise" model, there are exceptional benefits realized from the embedded market presence each media and advertising organization already enjoys in their "home markets". Their current sales relationships with local businesses in each city will ensure expedited roll out of PUP in each new market. 

The ultimate PUP corporate goals of driving awareness of each community's needs, creating sustainable funding streams for the Cause organizations that meet these many needs, and the creation of a sustainable, profitable business model for all PUP stakeholders will be realized through the collaborative effort of PUP corporate supporting our locally licensed re-sellers who work hand-in-hand with local Great Causes, Caring People, and Supportive Businesses in each city. 


Check out our mobile apps by clicking on the links below. 



The Impact

Purpose United Project is part of an emerging class of businesses that are founded for the purpose of being a sound investment for its stakeholders by building a survivable business model around community development. This special class of social entrepreneurial businesses understand that a business that solely concentrates on making the highest profit possible is usually a plight on society. But, the business that distributes its earnings back into the communities it serves is always a benefit for society. 

The Purpose United Project Team thanks you for your consideration. Help us build a business that makes the world a better place. Your generous support will pay dividends for generations to come. By helping us launch PUP you will be creating the next step in community development. You will be bringing together, for the first time,  charities, people and businesses in a collaborative network that makes the world a better place. You will be helping the launch a truly paradigm shifting business model. You will be helping to make your world a better place. 
Your generous contribution will help launch the next great social entrepreneurial company. 


Risks & Challenges

Currently based in the high tech business incubator at the Rochester Institute of Technology (RIT), the Purpose United Project is fully functional and operational. Its founders have created a robust web search directory (www.purposeunited.com), an informational website (www.purposeunitedproject.com), and have published the Purpose United Project live mobile apps on the Google Play Store and the Apple iStore. Its current server infrastructure is robust enough to handle the initial roll out of several cities. However, we will need to expand our serve assets before our nationwide rollout. We are fully functional at this time and 100% ready for a sales team to launch our initial city.

Although PUP is a start-up venture, we are fully 100% functional and ready for launch. PUP has fully self-funded the creation of its digital assets and server infrastructure. We are now in the launch phase of creating revenue in our initial market of Rochester, NY. Initial business surveys and Cause participation suggest that, upon funding and sales launch, PUP will enjoy quick user and sales revenue growth. 

We believe that investing in our company at this pre-revenue stage is minimally risky, as the founders have fully funded the complete creation of the product, supporting technology infrastructure, and initial market analysis. PUP is currently debt free and has interest from several investment organizations pending test market launch results. Funding secured at this test market stage will entirely be allocated to revenue generation.

Immediate Needs: 
PUP is looking to partially fund the test market roll out with crowd funding. Funds secured will be strictly used for:

* Sales management 
* Subsidize cash flow needed for startup sales team draws 
*Produce sales collateral 
*Marketing expenditures

All funds raised in access of the original goal of this crowd funding effort ($50,000) will be allocated towards increasing our server infrastructure, software enhancements, and ultimately multi-city roll out, as we aim to go nationwide as soon as possible through a licensed re-seller network of media and advertising organizations.


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you cannot financially support us you can still help. Help make your world a better place. Download the free Purpose United Project mobile app today and start supporting a Great Cause with your vote. Share with your friends. Then treat yourself to something you want or need by using the mobile app to search for incredible deals from local businesses on just about anything you may ever want. Although we are currently only in the Rochester, NY test market, we plan on expanding across the USA and then worldwide asap. All members will be notified as we luanch their cities. 

Additionally, we are currently interviewing potential licensed re-sellers, charities and businesses in many cities, as we prepare for the pending nationwide rollout. Please contact us if you would like to refer someone, or some organization that would like to become part of our team, or if you would like to personally get involved in the launch of PUP in your city.

Finally, please share the Purpose United Project with your friends. 


Thank you for your consideration, 

Russell Militello, founder, CEO

(585)444-8500 x117

Russ@iConnectedGlobal.com

Through the use of these strategic channel partners, the PUP organization will transform from an advertising sales organization into the technology and operations support hub for a nation of strategic re-sellers. 
Once we transition from advertising sales to a support hub, our concentration will be focused in four main areas: 1) Re-seller recruitment and support, 2) Charity recruitment and support, 3) Product innovation and development, 4) Nationwide branding and marketing. By concentrating our efforts on recruiting and supporting local re-sellers in each city market, we will foster expedited market penetration with the much lower capital requirements of this "franchise" model. In addition to the financial benefits of a "franchise" model, there are exceptional benefits realized from the embedded market presence each media and advertising organization already enjoys in their "home markets". Their current sales relationships with local businesses in each city will ensure expedited roll out of PUP in each new market. 
The ultimate PUP corporate goals of driving awareness of each community's needs, creating sustainable funding streams for the Cause organizations that meet these many needs, and the creation of a sustainable, profitable business model for all PUP stakeholders will be realized through the collaborative effort of PUP corporate supporting our locally licensed re-sellers who work hand-in-hand with local Great Causes, Caring People, and Supportive Businesses in each city. 

Check out our mobile apps by clicking on the links below. 

Check out app on Google Play Store

Check out app on Apple iStore



The Impact
Purpose United Project is part of an emerging class of businesses that are founded for the purpose of being a sound investment for its stakeholders by building a survivable business model around community development. This special class of social entrepreneurial businesses understand that a business that solely concentrates on making the highest profit possible is usually a plight on society. But, the business that distributes its earnings back into the communities it serves is always a benefit for society. 
 The Purpose United Project Team thanks you for your consideration. Help us build a business that makes the world a better place. Your generous support will pay dividends for generations to come. By helping us launch PUP you will be creating the next step in community development. You will be bringing together, for the first time,  charities, people and businesses in a collaborative network that makes the world a better place. You will be helping the launch a truly paradigm shifting business model. You will be helping to make your world a better place. 
Your generous contribution will help launch the next great social entrepreneurial company. 
  
Risks & Challenges  

Currently based in the high tech business incubator at the Rochester Institute of Technology (RIT), the Purpose United Project is fully functional and operational. Its founders have created a robust web search directory (www.purposeunited.com), an informational website (www.purposeunitedproject.com), and have published the Purpose United Project live mobile apps on the Google Play Store and the Apple iStore. Its current server infrastructure is robust enough to handle the initial roll out of several cities. However, we will need to expand our serve assets before our nationwide rollout. We are fully functional at this time and 100% ready for a sales team to launch our initial city.

Although PUP is a start-up venture, we are fully 100% functional and ready for launch. PUP has fully self-funded the creation of its digital assets and server infrastructure. We are now in the launch phase of creating revenue in our initial market of Rochester, NY. Initial business surveys and Cause participation suggest that, upon funding and sales launch, PUP will enjoy quick user and sales revenue growth. 
We believe that investing in our company at this pre-revenue stage is minimally risky, as the founders have fully funded the complete creation of the product, supporting technology infrastructure, and initial market analysis. PUP is currently debt free and has interest from several investment organizations pending test market launch results. Funding secured at this test market stage will entirely be allocated to revenue generation.
Immediate Needs: PUP is looking to partially fund the test market roll out with crowd funding. Funds secured will be strictly used for:
* Sales management * Subsidize cash flow needed for startup sales team draws *Produce sales collateral *Marketing expenditures
All funds raised in access of the original goal of this crowd funding effort ($50,000) will be allocated towards increasing our server infrastructure, software enhancements, and ultimately multi-city roll out, as we aim to go nationwide as soon as possible through a licensed re-seller network of media and advertising organizations.
   Other Ways You Can Help 
Even if you cannot financially support us you can still help. Help make your world a better place. Download the free Purpose United Project mobile app today and start supporting a Great Cause with your vote. Share with your friends. Then treat yourself to something you want or need by using the mobile app to search for incredible deals from local businesses on just about anything you may ever want. Although we are currently only in the Rochester, NY test market, we plan on expanding across the USA and then worldwide asap. All members will be notified as we luanch their cities. 
Additionally, we are currently interviewing potential licensed re-sellers, charities and businesses in many cities, as we prepare for the pending nationwide rollout. Please contact us if you would like to refer someone, or some organization that would like to become part of our team, or if you would like to personally get involved in the launch of PUP in your city.
Finally, please share the Purpose United Project with your friends. 
Thank you for your consideration, Russell Militello, founder, CEO
(585)444-8500 x117
Russ@iConnectedGlobal.com

story:
What is Rotaract?

Rotaract is a Rotary-sponsored service club for young men and women ages 18 to 30.  Rotaract clubs are usually community-based or university-based and are sponsored by a local Rotary club making them true “partners in service” and key members of the Rotary family.

Through the Rotaract program, young adults not only augment their knowledge and skills, but they also address the physical and social needs of their communities while promoting international understanding and peace through a framework of friendship and service.

All Rotaract efforts begin at the local grassroots level and all Rotaract clubs have access to the many resources of Rotary International and The Rotary Foundation. As one of the most significant and fastest-growing programs of Rotary service, with more than 8,400 clubs in about 170 countries and geographical areas, Rotaract has become a worldwide phenomenon.

What is APRRC?

Asia Pacific Regional Rotaract Conference (APRRC) is one of the large-scale Rotaract events, organized every year and engages Rotaractors from the Asia Pacific region. It was initiated in 2004 by Rotaractors from Rotary International District 3450 and the first Conference was held in Hong Kong. The Conference has subsequently been held in Taiwan, the Philippines, Malaysia, Indonesia, Singapore, Australia and Thailand.

Participating Rotaractors can enjoy wide-ranging activities throughout the 4-day-3-night conference, which offers a wonderful platform for fellowship, idea and cultural exchange. During the Conference, participants are encouraged to discuss and share views and ideas on the issues affecting the Rotaract Clubs across the region. With a view to providing a platform for cultural and friendship exchange, the APRRC includes Rotaract Festival and Cultural Night, in which Rotaractors can demonstrate their country spirits and exchange gifts with fellow Rotaractors from other countries. The ultimate goal is to develop young future leaders who are committed to put into action Rotaract’s slogan “Fellowship Through Service”

APRRC Indonesia

The 12th Asia Pacific Regional Rotaract Conference will be held at the Sheraton Mustika Resort & Spa Yogyakarta on August 8th-11th, 2015.

The Rotaract Club of Timog, QC

It was on the sunny day of April 18, 2005, that the concept of "Service Above Self" was passed on by the Rotary Club of Timog, QC to its sons and daughters. During the Medical Mission in Coron, Palawan, they had a great time helping the indigents and it inspired them to follow the footsteps of their fathers.

The Rotaract Club of Timog, QC was finally organized on August 21, 2005, with six children of some Rotarians attending the District Assembly. With 25 members thereafter, the First Induction was held on the 22nd of October that same year.

Choosing Club Service as our first endeavor, we continued recruiting dynamic members while having regular meetings and fellowship, arranging activities such as Team Building, occasional Parties, Speed Dating and attending various District 3780 gatherings.

The Rotaract Club of Timog, QC is part of Rotary International District 3780. The Charter President of RC Cosmopolitan Timog, QC, Margret Robyn Montellano, was a Past President of this Club and the first representation of the club as District Rotaract Representative. The second is Global President Gillian Nicole Alamani. Its members are part of a variety of classifications such as Marketing, Law, Diplomacy, Information Technology, Aviation and Entertainment. Notable GSE team members from the club are Past Presidents, they are: Maria Theresa Atanacio-Curry, Abigail Carreon-Songco, Kristine Felix, and Jonalyn Villasante. Currently at the helm of its leadership is Marjorie Liwag.  First Class President Gemma Louise Alamani is currently a District Secretary and a member of the RID 3780 Rotaract Committee.

Campaigning for APRRC 2015

The members of the Rotaract Club of Timog, QC are either University Students or Young Professionals.  International Events such as the Asia Pacific Regional Rotaract Conference provides an avenue for Rotaractors to expand their knowledge as well as train themselves to become empowered servant leaders.  In turn, all the information and practices gathered through the conference is applied in a more local setting.

The registration fee for each delegate is $350.00. This does not include airfare, transportation and communication expenses that may incur.

We would appreciate your help to help us raise funds so that we can send 5 Rotaractors to Yogyakarta, Indonesia to attend the 12th Asia Pacific Regional Conference.

They are Gillian Nicole Alamani, Gemma Louise Alamani, Marjorie Liwag, Vanessa Pagaduan and Paul Dennis Tangangco.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you've reached this far, we thank you for taking time to read all the information we have provided.

Kindly share our campaign with your friends and family as we need all the help we can get to make this happen!

If you have further questions on this campaign, feel free to drop an email at gillian(dot)nicole(at)gmail(dot)com or give us a call at +63917 515 0804.

story:
Short Summary

  Now there’s a way to make our communities a little brighter, our neighbourhoods a little better, get all those annoying odd-jobs and things you’ve been putting off done, or make a little money doing them for others yourself!

  Bobblejob - www.bobblejob.com – is named after the old practice of “Bob-a-job”, a small coin reward for a small job done. It is a community-based odd-job introduction website that lets people post up their work that needs doing and lets others in their neighbourhood arrange to come and do it.

  What makes Bobblejob different is that we turn the usual way for getting odd-jobs done or hunting for work on its head. Rather than having to chase down a number of handymen then contact them all and ask for quotes, you just post your job and let people come to you. If you’re looking for work it can be hard to get noticed without a marketing budget, and Bobblejob is a convenient place to come and find jobs to do.

  On top of that, Bobblejob doesn’t divide our users into job posters and job seekers. You can be bidding on one job even when you’re posting one of your own.

https://www.facebook.com/Bobblejob.UnitedKingdom
https://twitter.com/Bobblejob_GB

About Bobblejob, and What We Want

  We want people to get to know their neighbours and their wider community better, by revolutionising the way people find help to do their odd jobs, and allowing people with skills and time to spare to earn extra cash.

Just got back from holiday with two suitcases of washing? Let someone else iron!

  What do you do if you need someone to help you with any of the kinds of chores or problems that happen to us all?  For example:

  • do a solid spring clean
  • help set up your wireless LAN
  • rake up and burn an autumn’s worth of fallen leaves
  • putting together a flat-pack bookshelf
  Or perhaps you have a more obscure job, or something very small that isn't worth a professional for a day, such as:
  • compose a poem for your wedding day
  • help you carry a sofa down the stairs
  • DJ at a birthday party
  • teach you how to make best use of your new mobile phone

… or any other odd-job task you might want done but don’t have either the time, the skill or the desire to do yourself.

            

  Everyone can do with a little extra cash, and for some of us it can make all the difference - single parents, students, those on low incomes and semi-retired and retired people. People have free time or unused skills, and often want to do something worthwhile with them. You might just want to convert unused time to bonus cash, for example a stay-at-home parent who has several hours a day free while the kids are at school and could easily bake cupcakes or do some gardening.

  Doing odd jobs often comes to the convenience of everyone.  Someone can be on their way home on the bus after work and pick up a job, to build a bookshelf for example, and earn £20 in the process. This is especially true if you’re planning to do the occasional paid job rather than make a career out of being an odd-job person.

www.bobblejob.com


Maybe find someone local to get your dog walked while you're away on holiday?

  We think of Bobblejob as a “good-cause business”. In the long run we plan to be a profitable operation supporting ourselves through a variety of income-generating schemes. However, the base mission won’t change, we'll always be community focussed.

  We need more Bobblejob members, and to spread the word about how Bobblejob can help. That means we need some operating capital and some money for advertising and social media. We’re pretty efficient as far as things like server hosting are concerned, but advertising is expensive. We are asking you to become a part of this and to help spread ourselves into a new area or two and pick up enough members to become self-sustaining.


Need someone to fix a seam or repair a rip? Perhaps make a costume?


  We’re asking for £40,000 to give us between six months and a year of growth. The money will mostly be spent on additional functionality, advertising and community events. A smaller proportion will be spent on unavoidable ancillary expenses such as accountancy.
www.bobblejob.com


What we're offering

We're currently (as in the next few months) implementing a new accounts system. Bobblejob will have three layers of service.

Free Accounts

 Free Accounts are exactly that. There's no subscription charge and no need for a fee to post a job (a small commission must be given, but this is taken from the job seeker when final payment is made). It's a good way to see if anyone is interested in the area to do your job, or to browse to see what kind of work is around you. However as you won't be as clearly verified as well as a Silver account holder, there will be a short delay between you posting a job and it appearing on the site. This allows us to manually vet the job before it is visible to all.

Free accounts don't allow internal messaging until a bid is accepted, at which point you can arrange fine details.

Free accounts must place a small deposit on a job, of which a fee will be deducted as a commission from the seeker's payment, thus making it effectively free to post the job.

Silver Accounts

 Silver Accounts provide an extra layer of service, for a small subscription (we're estimating about £2 per month). For this the account holder gets the following benefits:

  • As you'll have effectively verified yourself by providing subscription details the delay between posting a job and having it go live will no longer be needed. 
  • Silver accounts allow in-app messaging, so you can ask and answer questions about bids and separately arrange prices and offers without public bidding.
  • Silver accounts also push any jobs you post up the search rankings so they are easier to see - we regard a Silver account holder as having proved that they're serious about getting their job done. Jobs posted by Silver members are marked as such for anyone to see that they come from a regular job poster.
  • You'll also get 5 jobs per month where you don't have to put in a deposit.
  • Silver accounts are suitable for everyone, but especially for job posters.

Gold Accounts

 Gold Accounts are for those who do more regular handyman work or want to use Bobblejob more seriously. For ten pounds a month the following benefits are given:

  • Instant messages and notifications - for example of a new job posting locally.
  • Searchable in reverse - one can look for anyone who does grass cutting work within three miles, for example.
  • Can receive nudges to be invited to bid on a job.
  • Can always be messaged, even by free account holders.
  • All deposits and commissions are waived.
  • Jobs and profiles are promoted and have increased search rankings
  • No on-site advertising
  • Gold accounts receive their own mini-site, where they can display their own profile, skills list, certifications and certificates, job history and CV that they can distribute as they will to advertise themselves. This site will be fully search engine optimised for Google and the like.


The Impact

  We expect there to be three levels of impact.

  The first is the obvious one of getting those odd-jobs done that you’ve been too busy to do, avoiding or don’t have the required skill to do.

  The second is earning some money by using your spare time or skills. We’ve had someone earn hundreds of pounds from painting a huge pool wall, and we’ve had another earn a plate of cupcakes by helping someone set up and learn to use their mobile phone.

  The third and in some ways the most important impact is what Bobblejob can do for the local community. We believe Bobblejob will foster a community spirit and a sense of people in the neighbourhood helping each other to get things done. This is especially true for schools, churches or local charities. We also have the ability to handle charity and unpaid work - for example, a school could post a job looking for a dozen people to help with the school fair, or a charity could recruit people to act as marshals for a sponsored event. In addition, we have a innovative schools system coming shortly, in which older students looking for work experience can be part of a group together with the school parents, staff and administrators. For security, those students use reduced authority accounts which only allows them to see jobs posted by the school community once they log in. The school admins have the ability to oversee everything.

  A student with a record of two dozen jobs done and an average four-and-a-half star rating has a better chance of being accepted for any application, whether university or their first job, than someone with no work background at all.  This is basically a mini-Bobblejob setup, a micro-site. We have planned to add a “graduation” display or printable “CV” of jobs done, rewards earned and ratings given for students who leave the school. Parents, of course, have full Bobblejob accounts and can see or post jobs outside the school environment if they wish.

  A similar, but less restrictive university system should go live during this Indiegogo campaign, if it hasn’t already when you read this. We’ll expand it to a general groups system later, so anyone could set up their own private groups (e.g. babysitting groups) if they wish.


Not everyone likes flat-pack furniture assembly instructions...

Risks & Challenges

  Making Bobblejob a success is not a trivial task. We’re convinced that we’ve got a good concept, but for it to become a self-sustaining operation we need to have plenty of members posting plenty of jobs so others locally in their communities can bid on them and do them. If the nearest jobs are a hundred miles away then it’s too far to get involved. In some ways we’re like an early version of ebay or any other auction site – you have to have enough content to bring people in to see what’s there, and enough people coming in and bidding to make it worth putting content on. We're like a car that needs its engine to “turn over” enough to fire – once we’re running then we believe that we can continue to thrive.


The Future

  Further developments to the site should include:

  Enhanced School, University and Group accounts (as mentioned)
  Phone apps

  Enhanced accounts. Bobblejob is free to use, but there will be two levels of subscription based enhanced accounts. The silver accounts will provide in-app messaging and the ability to pay each other electronically (via Paypal), and they’ll have priority in searches. This will be a minimal monthly cost. The gold accounts will cost slightly more and are intended for more serious handymen – they’ll be provided a minisite of their own to advertise their skills and work history, plus post up any document scans of certifications or qualifications such as safety certificates or background checks, plus they’ll be searchable by work type and area.


And, of course, there's the old favourite of cutting the grass...


Other Ways You Can Help

  This is an Indiegogo project request, so of course we’re asking for money – but money isn’t really all we’re asking for. We’re after people who will join us in working to make our communities brighter and cleaner, to repair what’s broken and look after those who need help. We’re after people who will help charities in their work. We’re after those who have work they need done and projects they want help with.

  In short, we’re after members. We’re after people who will sign up and use Bobblejob the way it’s meant to be used; people who will convince their friends, their families and their clients and suppliers to sign up too. After all, communities aren’t built by a few dedicated giants towering over the others – they’re built by continual efforts by many, many decent and hardworking people.

  So please take a few minutes to check us out at www.bobblejob.com and pop in your details. It’ll only take a few seconds, and it’ll let you see what’s happening as jobs start appearing in your area. Then post up a job or two, and volunteer or bid on anything that takes your fancy.

  Oh, and there’s a good chance that you’ll be able to clear up some of those odd-jobs that have been sitting around for ages along the way – and that you’ll make a little money to stick in your pocket.
Please like and share our facebook page -

https://www.facebook.com/Bobblejob.UnitedKingdom

Take a look at Twitter too -

https://twitter.com/Bobblejob_GB

and, as always, use the Indiegogo share tools as well! And if you like the idea, let others know about it!





Some Questions and Answers

All the following questions are answered in much more detail at

http://www.bobblejob.com/en-gb/help . Check there if you want to know more,


Q: Does Bobblejob include the facility for ratings, messaging, reviews and so on?
A: Yes, Bobblejob has a full suite of extra support services. The full suite of services will be settled out better once we introduce the additional account heirachies.

Q: I'm worried about my privacy. Is my information safe on Bobblejob?

A: First and foremost, we can assure you that your address and contact details are only ever shared when you request a friend to verify your details. They are never shared as a part of the job posting or bidding process. Only an approximate distance and town are given on a job.  We do not sell nor rent data to anyone.


Q: Do I have to accept the lowest bidder for a job? What if they have a bad rating?
A: No, you don’t. You get to check through the bids, check the profiles of the bidders, their reviews, the number of verifications they have and who has verified them, and so on. You can ask additional questions, and then, when you’re happy with a particular offer you get to choose that one.

Q: Can I accept more than one bid for a bigger job?
A: Absolutely! You are free to accept as many bids as you would like for each job.

Q: Is Bobblejob UK only, or do you operate in other countries?
A: Bobblejob is built to work internationally - the tech is all in place. It's only that we currently lack the resources necessary to make sure that we operate legally elsewhere. Who knows, if we manage to attract enough funding, maybe we'll hire an international representative and open Bobblejob in a different country sooner than expected!

Q: What if there’s a problem? What if the work isn’t done well enough or the job poster doesn’t pay?
A: We weren’t there. We don’t know what really happened. The best we can do is give both sides the chance to tell their sides of the story. If you go to the job page, you will find the option to raise a dispute.

Q: I'm uncertain about letting a stranger into my house, or going somewhere else to work. What assurances can you give me?
A: The vast majority of people are decent, and if you accept a bid from someone with a decent work history and rating then you can be fairly sure that they will at least do their best - just as you can be fairly sure that someone with a good ebay rating is unlikely to take your money and not supply you with your goods. Any time you let anyone work for you, whether an odd-jobber or a registered plumber then there is, of course, the risk that they aren't who they claim to be - it only takes hours these days with cheap printing companies, scanners, online copies of certifications and all the rest to set yourself up as a false tradesman - which is why sites like check-a-trade exist for professional builders.
  We have a verification system where people can ask people they know to confirm that they have a genuine address and email registered. We'll be introducing a confirmation-by-mobile system that would, if there was trouble, allow tracing of the culprit by law enforcement authorities, and we'll be making it clear which users had confirmed their identity in this way in their profiles. We also have a recommended practice at http://www.bobblejob.com/en-gb/help as well - it's mostly common sense, things like making sure that someone else you know knows that someone is coming round or where you're going for a job and so on. Read through and feel free to ask any other questions if you're worried.
