might want done but don’t have either the time, the skill or the desire to do
yourself.

             



  Everyone can do with a little extra cash, and for some of us
it can make all the difference - single parents, students, those on low incomes
and semi-retired and retired people. People have free time or unused skills,
and often want to do something worthwhile with them. You might just want to
convert unused time to bonus cash, for example a stay-at-home parent who has
several hours a day free while the kids are at school and could easily bake
cupcakes or do some gardening.  Doing
odd jobs often comes to the convenience of everyone.  Someone can be on their way home on the bus
after work and pick up a job, to build a bookshelf for example, and earn £20 in
the process. This is especially true if you’re planning to do the occasional
paid job rather than make a career out of being an odd-job person.www.bobblejob.comMaybe find someone local to get your dog walked while you're away on holiday?
  We think of Bobblejob as a “good-cause business”. In the
long run we plan to be a profitable operation supporting ourselves through a
variety of income-generating schemes. However, the base mission won’t change, we'll always be community focussed.
  We need more Bobblejob members, and to spread the word about how Bobblejob can help. That means we need some operating capital
and some money for advertising and social media. We’re pretty efficient as far
as things like server hosting are concerned, but advertising is expensive. We
are asking you to become a part of this and to help
spread ourselves into a new area or two and pick up enough members to become
self-sustaining.Need someone to fix a seam or repair a rip? Perhaps make a costume?  We’re asking for £40,000 to give us between six months and a
year of growth. The money will mostly be spent on additional functionality, advertising
and community events. A smaller proportion will be spent on unavoidable ancillary
expenses such as accountancy. www.bobblejob.comWhat we're offeringWe're currently (as in the next few months) implementing a new accounts system. Bobblejob will have three layers of service.Free Accounts Free Accounts are exactly that. There's no subscription charge and no need for a fee to post a job (a small commission must be given, but this is taken from the job seeker when final payment is made). It's a good way to see if anyone is interested in the area to do your job, or to browse to see what kind of work is around you. However as you won't be as clearly verified as well as a Silver account holder, there will be a short delay between you posting a job and it appearing on the site. This allows us to manually vet the job before it is visible to all.Free accounts don't allow internal messaging until a bid is accepted, at which point you can arrange fine details. Free accounts must place a small deposit on a job, of which a fee will be deducted as a commission from the seeker's payment, thus making it effectively free to post the job.Silver Accounts Silver Accounts provide an extra layer of service, for a small subscription (we're estimating about £2 per month). For this the account holder gets the following benefits:
As you'll have effectively verified yourself by providing subscription details the delay between posting a job and having it go live will no longer be needed. 
Silver accounts allow in-app messaging, so you can ask and answer questions about bids and separately arrange prices and offers without public bidding. 
Silver accounts also push any jobs you post up the search rankings so they are easier to see - we regard a Silver account holder as having proved that they're serious about getting their job done. Jobs posted by Silver members are marked as such for anyone to see that they come from a regular job poster.
You'll also get 5 jobs per month where you don't have to put in a deposit.
Silver accounts are suitable for everyone, but especially for job posters. 
Gold Accounts Gold Accounts are for those who do more regular handyman work or want to use Bobblejob more seriously. For ten pounds a month the following benefits are given:
Instant messages and notifications - for example of a new job posting locally.
Searchable in reverse - one can look for anyone who does grass cutting work within three miles, for example. 
Can receive nudges to be invited to bid on a job.
Can always be messaged, even by free account holders.
All deposits and commissions are waived.
Jobs and profiles are promoted and have increased search rankings
No on-site advertising
Gold accounts receive their own mini-site, where they can display their own profile, skills list, certifications and certificates, job history and CV that they can distribute as they will to advertise themselves. This site will be fully search engine optimised for Google and the like.
   The Impact 
  We expect there to be three levels of impact.
  The first is the obvious one of getting those odd-jobs done
that you’ve been too busy to do, avoiding
or don’t have the required skill to do. 
  The second is earning some money by using your spare time or
skills. We’ve had someone earn hundreds of pounds from painting a huge pool
wall, and we’ve had another earn a plate of cupcakes by helping someone set up
and learn to use their mobile phone. 
  The third and in some ways the most important impact is what Bobblejob can
do for the local community. We
believe Bobblejob will foster a community spirit and a sense of people in the
neighbourhood helping each other to get things done. This is especially true for schools,
churches or local charities. We also have the ability to handle charity and
unpaid work - for example, a school could post a job looking for a dozen people
to help with the school fair, or a charity could recruit people to act as
marshals for a sponsored event. In addition, we have a innovative schools system
coming shortly, in which older students looking for work experience can be part
of a group together with the school parents, staff and administrators. For
security, those students use reduced authority accounts which only allows them
to see jobs posted by the school community once they log in. The school
admins have the ability to oversee everything.  A student with a record of two
dozen jobs done and an average four-and-a-half star rating has a better
chance of being accepted for any application, whether university or their
first job, than someone with no work background at all.  This is basically a mini-Bobblejob setup, a
micro-site. We have
planned to add a “graduation” display or printable
“CV” of jobs done, rewards earned and ratings given for students who leave the
school. Parents, of course, have full Bobblejob accounts and
can see or post jobs outside the school environment if they wish.   A similar, but less restrictive university system should go live
during this Indiegogo campaign, if it hasn’t already when you read this. We’ll expand it to a
general groups system later, so anyone could set up their own private groups
(e.g. babysitting groups) if they wish.
Not everyone likes flat-pack furniture assembly instructions...    Risks & Challenges  
  Making Bobblejob a success is not a trivial task. We’re
convinced that we’ve got a good concept, but for it to become a self-sustaining
operation we need to have plenty of members posting plenty of jobs so others
locally in their communities can bid on them and do them. If the nearest jobs
are a hundred miles away then it’s too far to get involved. In some ways we’re
like an early version of ebay or any other auction site – you have to have
enough content to bring people in to see what’s there, and enough people coming
in and bidding to make it worth putting content on. We're like a car that needs its engine
to “turn over” enough to fire – once we’re running then we believe that we can
continue to thrive.
The Future
  Further developments to the site should include:
  Enhanced School, University and Group accounts (as
mentioned)
  Phone apps  Enhanced accounts. Bobblejob is free to use, but there will be two levels of
subscription based enhanced accounts. The silver accounts will provide in-app
messaging and the ability to pay each other electronically (via Paypal), and
they’ll have priority in searches. This will be a minimal monthly cost. The
gold accounts will cost slightly more and are intended for more serious
handymen – they’ll be provided a minisite of their own to advertise their
skills and work history, plus post up any document scans of certifications or
qualifications such as safety certificates or background checks, plus they’ll
be searchable by work type and area.



And, of course, there's the old favourite of cutting the grass...

   Other Ways You Can Help 

  This is an Indiegogo project request, so of course we’re
asking for money – but money isn’t really all we’re asking for. We’re after
people who will join us in working to make our communities brighter and
cleaner, to repair what’s broken and look after those who need help. We’re
after people who will help charities in their work. We’re after those who have
work they need done and projects they want help with.
  In short, we’re after members.
We’re after people who will sign up and use Bobblejob the way it’s meant to be
used; people who will convince their friends, their families and their clients
and suppliers to sign up too. After all, communities aren’t built by a few
dedicated giants towering over the others – they’re built by continual efforts
by many, many decent and hardworking people.
  So please take a few minutes to check us out at www.bobblejob.com and pop in your details.
It’ll only take a few seconds, and it’ll let you see what’s happening
as jobs start appearing in your area. Then post up a job or two, and volunteer
or bid on anything that takes your fancy.

  Oh, and there’s a good chance that you’ll be
able to clear up some of those odd-jobs that have been sitting around for ages
along the way – and that you’ll make a little money to stick in your pocket. Please like and share our facebook page - https://www.facebook.com/Bobblejob.UnitedKingdom
Take a look at Twitter too -https://twitter.com/Bobblejob_GBand, as always, use the Indiegogo share tools as well! And if you like the idea, let others know about it!
Some Questions and Answers
All the following questions are answered in much more detail at http://www.bobblejob.com/en-gb/help . Check there if you want to know more,


Q: Does Bobblejob include the facility for ratings, messaging, reviews and so on?A: Yes, Bobblejob has a full suite of extra support services. The full suite of services will be settled out better once we introduce the additional account heirachies.Q: I'm worried about my privacy.  Is my information safe on Bobblejob?A: First
and foremost, we can assure you that your address and contact details are only
ever shared when you request a friend to verify your details. They are never
shared as a part of the job posting or bidding process. Only an approximate
distance and town are given on a job.  We
do not sell nor rent data to anyone.
Q: Do I have to accept the lowest bidder for a job? What if they have a bad rating?A: No, you don’t. You get to check through the bids, check the profiles of the bidders, their reviews, the number of verifications they have and who has verified them, and so on. You can ask additional questions, and then, when you’re happy with a particular offer you get to choose that one.
Q: Can I accept more than one bid for a bigger job?A: Absolutely! You are free to accept as many bids as you would like for each job.
Q: Is Bobblejob UK only, or do you operate in other countries?A: Bobblejob is built to work internationally - the tech is all in place. It's only that we currently lack the resources necessary to make sure that we operate legally elsewhere. Who knows, if we manage to attract enough funding, maybe we'll hire an international representative and open Bobblejob in a different country sooner than expected!
Q: What if there’s a problem? What if the work isn’t done well enough or the job poster doesn’t pay?A: We weren’t there. We don’t know what really happened. The best we can do is give both sides the chance to tell their sides of the story. If you go to the job page, you will find the option to raise a dispute.
Q: I'm uncertain about letting a stranger into my house, or going somewhere else to work. What assurances can you give me?A: The vast majority of people are decent, and if you accept a bid from someone with a decent work history and rating then you can be fairly sure that they will at least do their best - just as you can be fairly sure that someone with a good ebay rating is unlikely to take your money and not supply you with your goods. Any time you let anyone work for you, whether an odd-jobber or a registered plumber then there is, of course, the risk that they aren't who they claim to be - it only takes hours these days with cheap printing companies, scanners, online copies of certifications and all the rest to set yourself up as a false tradesman - which is why sites like check-a-trade exist for professional builders.   We have a verification system where people can ask people they know to confirm that they have a genuine address and email registered. We'll be introducing a confirmation-by-mobile system that would, if there was trouble, allow tracing of the culprit by law enforcement authorities, and we'll be making it clear which users had confirmed their identity in this way in their profiles. We also have a recommended practice at http://www.bobblejob.com/en-gb/help as well - it's mostly common sense, things like making sure that someone else you know knows that someone is coming round or where you're going for a job and so on. Read through and feel free to ask any other questions if you're worried.

story:
Bee Understanding: Job Swap & Documentary Short-films 


Honey bee health and agriculture are intrinsically linked. One in three bites of food you put in your mouth and over $15 billion in American agriculture relies on pollination. But modern agriculture is a highly specialized system. Gaps can open up between specialists and into one of the gaps has fallen the little honey bee. Improving honey bee health and safeguarding the food supply will take intensive cooperation across the food value chain. That’s why we’ve created The Bee Understanding Project, an incubated project of the Honey Bee Health Coalition.


Through Bee Understanding, farmers and beekeepers, crop advisors and entomologists, pest control applicators and regulators will switch jobs for a day and walk a mile in the other guys’ boots to see this problem from the ground level and develop solutions together. And we want to give you a front row seat. In addition to swapping jobs, we’re capturing everything in a series of documentary short films that we will make available to you and work to embed in continuing education programs throughout the food chain.

   


Meet our First Job Swappers!



What You Can Do

We need your help. Our first job swap will take place in April. Beekeepers, entomologists, and crop advisors will trade places with a corn grower and plant corn on his production farm in North Dakota. That same group will then go to Texas and be beekeepers for a day working on a large commercial beekeeping operation. We need to raise an additional $160,000 to take this show on the road and bring job swaps to soybean farmers, almond growers, and other vegetable and fruit growers. We also need to involve beekeepers from California, Idaho, Florida, and all around the country, not to mention more entomologists, conservationists, regulators, and even members of the general public like you.

This Indiegogo campaign is our first step towards achieving that goal. Proceeds of this campaign will go to the Pollinator Stewardship Council for the specific purpose of creating job swaps and the corresponding series of short documentary films. Please make your deductible donation today and help accelerate cooperation on improving the health of the honey bee!



About Us

The Partners


                            
      

Bee Understanding is an incubated project of the Honey Bee Health Coalition       

The mission of the Honey Bee Health Coalition is to collaboratively implement solutions that will help to achieve a healthy population of honey bees while also supporting healthy populations of native and managed pollinators in the context of productive agricultural systems and thriving ecosystems.

Learn more about the Honey Bee Health Coalition!


The Pollinator Stewardship Council is Our Non-Profit Funding Partner

The mission of the Pollinator Stewardship Council is to defend managed and native pollinators vital to a sustainable and affordable food supply from the adverse impact of pesticides.

Learn more about the Pollinator Stewardship Council!


Film Producers


                                                      

CollaborateUp

CollaborateUp advises businesses, governments, and non-profits on how to work together to solve big problems. On behalf of our clients, we make strategic introductions, translate the needs of businesses to NGOs and vice-versa, and structure outcome-oriented partnerships that amplify impact and get results faster at lower cost.

CollaborateUp team members working on Bee Understanding:

   Richard Crespin, CEO 

 Emily Olsen-Harbich, Project Manager

Learn more about CollaborateUp!


Our Filmmakers:


Citygate Films is an award-winning nonfiction film company with offices in NY and DC. They produce independent feature films about humanitarian, social justice, healthcare, and spiritual topics. They are true believers in their motto, "Good stories spark change." Citygate channels their story-telling skills to create short films for a variety of clients with compelling missions or brand stories. 
Check out their website and see some of the great work they have done!


A special thanks to our donors:

Jessica Miller, Honeybee Dinner 

Mark & Cathy Lee, Queen Bee

James Laird, Worker Bee

Lisa Laird, Worker Bee

Michael Romano, Worker Bee

moniclarelee, Worker Bee


Stay tuned for further information on the job swappers, memorable quotes, and other updates. You can also check our Facebook page and follow us on Twitter to stay in the loop as this project develops!




The Bee Understanding Project is an incubated project of the Honey Bee Health Coalition, with project partners CollaborateUp and Pollinator Stewardship Council. Our project is not to be confused with BeeUnderstanding.org.

story:
Eazyer.com - Making life Eazyer

Eazyer.Com is a directory listing, review, local offers and promotions website that connects local businesses with new and existing customers.  

Eazyer.com provides complete merchant information (i.e. address, phone, hours, reviews, pictures, etc.) as well as local deals which encourage customers to try products and services at a discounted rate - helping to boost local economies by helping businesses to expand their client base.

Consumers can save money on everyday products and services with the added incentive of a points program, exciting giveaways (like our $5,000 Quarterly Cruise Giveaway) and so much more.

All of this is driven through an easy to use web portal that’s fast and friendly giving both merchants and consumers access to whatever they want – whenever they want it.

This Crowdfunding campaign has been put together to raise the required funds to complete the development of the Eazyer.com website. We have received funding from investors and the team behind the project has also invested a huge amount of their own money, and now to finalize the portal and go live we need your help.

Eazyer.com will provide an unbeatable array of products and service locally for every consumer at a price that makes sense. With your help and support we can deliver these savings to you. 

So support us in anyway you can and sign up for your special offers, discounts and special savings with Eazyer.com.

Everyone loves a discount! It's the best feeling when you purchase a great product on sale or receive a discount on a much needed service. Unfortunately these savings only happen seasonally or occasionally or are not available when you want/need them.

How would you like to receive:

  • Daily or Weekly Offers? 
  • Regular Discounts?  
  • Exclusive Savings?
  • Points For ALL Activity?
  • Faster Rewards Good For Businesses You Want?
  • Weekly, Monthly, Quarterly and Annual Giveaways?

Eazyer.com provides all of the above, daily, weekly and monthly, all on the products and services that are valuable to you!

Following extensive consumer research we have looked into what people really want and where savings can make a real difference, and they are the offers we provide for our members.

Our retail partners offer savings and discounts on:

   

  • Restaurant Deals
  • Haircuts, Nail and Spa Services
  • Family and Group Activities
  • Home, Auto and Medical Services
  • Vacations, Getaways, Online Goods and SO MUCH MORE

Eazyer.com provides membership rewards, points and prize draws so that your membership goes further than any similar sites.

What makes Eazyer.com stand out from the crowd?

Whether you’re looking for information or reviews on a local business, money saving offers on goods and services you need every day or looking for a getaway - Eazyer.com makes that easy to find. 

All Eazyer.com members will receive a daily or weekly (Members choice) email with highlighted offers and discounts from many of their favorite local businesses. The member then simply downloads or prints the 'deal' and redeems it online or in store. In addition:

     

  • We provide points and credits for every purchase and ALL activity
  • We allow you to cash in your credits for VISA® Debit Cards
  • We offer weekly, monthly, quarterly and annual giveaways
  • We allow you to use points to increase your chances of winning
  • We give back to your local communities every month

How Do Merchants Benefit?

Merchants who partner with Eazyer.com will have access to a set of tools that allow them to provide Members with:

  • Offers 
  • Promotions 
  • Rewards 
  • Special Events 
  • Loyalty Points 
  • Exclusive Savings 

Eazyer.com saves business owners time and money

Eazyer.com reduces marketing and advertising budgets to near zero 

Eazyer.com increases customer patronage and foot traffic

After extensive market research and countless hours of development we feel we’ve come up with an ideal solution for local businesses and customers who shop every day.

We need to raise $15,000 in order to achieve our goal and get Eazyer.com live so you can start helping consumers save at their favorite businesses and provide those businesses with a more affordable and functional way to market their businesses as soon as possible. 

Where Will This Money Go?

  • Functionality Enhancements

  -We want to offer a more streamlined signup/registration process

  -Functionality where Members can have the ability to decide exactly what days they want to receive email updates from us. Ex. If you only want emails from us on Monday, Wednesday and Friday…you can set that preference.

  • Publicist

  We have a formed a valuable relationship with an incredible Publicist that will assist us in launching Eazyer.com nationwide. She will help us get exposure in all relevant platforms such as TV, Radio, Newspaper, Magazines and Web.

• Marketing & Advertising

   We have planned to break our launch of eazyer.com into 4 phases. Each phase will consist of cities/towns across the entire US. We will be launching in Canada in phase 3.

  • 20% From Every Contribution Donated To Charity

  We are taking 20% from EVERY contribution and will be donating those funds to the following National Non-Profit Organizations:


We know that not everyone can contribute financially, however we still want you to support us by:

  • Sharing our campaign on Social media
  • Tell all of your friends and family about Eazyer.com
  • Signing up in advance for your membership

Please feel free to post your ideas in the comment section.

We promise to provide updates on a regular basis and will do our very best to answer all questions quickly.

Thanks for taking the time to check out our campaign!

Please feel free to contact us directly at 920-205-3076 or support@eazyer.com if you have any questions or concerns.

the ability to decide exactly what days they want to receive email updates from
us. Ex. If you only want emails from us on Monday, Wednesday and Friday…you can
set that preference.
  •
Publicist
 
We have a
formed a valuable relationship with an incredible Publicist that
will assist us in launching Eazyer.com nationwide. She will help us get
exposure in all relevant platforms such as TV, Radio, Newspaper, Magazines and
Web.• Marketing & Advertising   We have planned to break our launch of eazyer.com into 4 phases. Each phase will consist of cities/towns across the entire US. We will be launching in Canada in phase 3.
  •
20% From Every Contribution Donated To Charity
 
We are taking
20% from EVERY contribution and will be donating those funds to the following
National Non-Profit Organizations:We know that not everyone can contribute
financially, however we still want you to support us by:

Sharing our campaign on Social
     media
Tell all of your friends and family
     about Eazyer.com
Signing up in advance for your
     membership

Please feel
free to post your ideas in the comment section.
We promise to
provide updates on a regular basis and will do our very best to answer all
questions quickly.
Thanks for
taking the time to check out our campaign!
Please feel free to contact us directly
at 920-205-3076 or support@eazyer.com if you have any questions or concerns.

story:
CAN-AM-SPYDER-TOURS S.L.

Target: to open on Gran Canaria and Lanzarote new locations.




Investment required each location € 200,000.00.

CAN-AM-SPYDER-TOURS S.L. offers guided tours.

Can Am Spyder driving the way is the destination.

Tapas and Tasting of typical food, small breaks in the sunshine included in the program.


Around your face, blowing a warm wind. While the CAN-AM SPYDER-fly on the well asphalted road,  from curve to curve.


Die sanften Hügel der Inselberge lassen immer wieder den Blick auf den tiefblauen Atlantik frei - manchmal zum Greifen nahe, dann wieder, wie ein Flimmern in der Ferne.

Milde Frühlingsluft um Vulkanhügel, schlängelnde Serpentinen, all das sind gute Gründe, um einen entspannten Urlaub auf einer der wunderschönen Inseln zu verbringen.




Necessary conditions:

a few days of vacation, flight, accommodation - License to Drive Spyder. (Driving license)

Accommodation -CAN AM SPYDER can

info@canamspydertours.com

are requested and booked.


Gäste der CAN-AM-SPYDER-TOUREN waren begeistert und nach kurzer Zeit mit dem CAN-AM-SPYDER - Virus infiziert und haben versprochen wiederzukommen und uns an ihre Freunde weiterzuempfehlen.

Guests of the CAN-AM SPYDER-TOURS loved it and after a short time they are infected  with the CAN-AM SPYDER-virus and have promised to come back and recommend us to their friends.


Beteiligung an einem Standort ( Gran Canaria oder Lanzarote)

als stiller Teilhaber 5 % Verzinsung garantiert

Rückzahlung nach drei Jahren

( from € 8.500 - € 35.000,00 )

Participation in one location (Gran Canaria or Lanzarote)

guarantees a silent partner 5% interest

Repayment after three years


Unsere Erfahrung und Kontakte, die wir in  zwei Jahren

auf Fuerteventura gesammelt haben ermöglichen uns einen schnellen und unkomplizierten Start auf Gran Canaria und Lanzarote.

Our experience and contacts, we are in two years

collected in Fuerteventura allow us a quick and easy start on Gran Canaria and Lanzarote.



About the Can Am Spyder

The Can-Am Spyder isn’t a trike, in the traditional sense, as it sports two wheels in front and a single rear. Unlike some 2-1 three-wheelers, however, the Spyder does not lean. The Spyder’s mix-mash hybrid of motorcycle and ATV technology is perhaps most evident in the Can-Am Spyder chassis - dual A-arms complementing a single rear shock. The Can-Am Spyder frame is a Y-shaped cradle surrounding the Spyder’s 990cc V-Twin – the liquid-cooled engine built by Austria’s Rotax and a variation of the Twins powering Aprilia sportbikes. Features like stability and traction control, as well as power steering keep the Spyder manageable on the road.
“I really feel we are building an industry which will become bigger and bigger and bigger,” said BRP CEO Jose Boisjoli while addressing journalists gathered for the press launch of the 2013 Can-Am Spyder.

Boisjoli’s statement is supported by the release of a new model this year, a sport-touring version called the 2013 Can-Am Spyder ST. The new addition expands the Spyder range to three base models with “R” and “Limited” variations of those base models offered as well, demonstrating the importance of the Spyder to Can-Am’s road vehicle aspirations, the unique three-wheeled Roadster hitting the scene in 2008. And after seeing over 30% growth in sales in its first four years in existence, there is no resting on laurels in this industry, a factor which helped drive changes to the chassis and suspension on this year’s Spyder as the vehicle continues to evolve.

Can-Am is good at keeping a secret. In the days of intentional leaks, supposed spy shots, and viral campaigns that trickle out information one spec at a time, Can-Am surprised the group of journalists gathered for the press launch of the 2014 Spyder when it announced it had built a new Inline Triple engine to power its 2014 RT models. This is even more impressive considering the 1330cc Inline three-cylinder has been three years in the making. Made by the same company that builds its 998cc V-Twin, the engine is dubbed the Rotax 1330 ACE (Advanced Combustion Efficiency), and a variation of the ACE was first launched by parent company BRP in a snowmobile. The Rotax 1330 ACE was built exclusively for the Spyder though, and there it was before us, sitting low and forward in a stripped-down Spyder frame for all to see at the launch, transversally mounted and mated to a new six-speed gearbox to boot. Yep, these Can-Am guys are full of secrets.

Fahrbericht von DIE WELT

Manche Vehikel haben mit Vorurteilen zu kämpfen. Zum Beispiel motorisierte Dreiräder. Je nach Hersteller haben sie zwei Räder an Vorder- oder Hinterachse und sind somit ein Mittelding aus Auto und Bike. Der kanadische Bombardier-Konzern, hervorgegangen 1942 aus dem Bau von Schneemobilen, setzt seit 2008 auf die ganz eigene Dreirad-Dynamik. Seine Can-Am Spyder haben dank breiter Vorderachse jede Menge Grip, hinten treibt ein 225er Autoreifen das Dreirad an. Nach betont sportlichen und reisetauglichen Modellen soll ab sofort der Can-Am Spyder F3 die Freunde von Cruisern bedienen. Die entspannte Sitzposition mit leicht nach vorne gebeugtem Oberkörper und fast ausgestreckten Armen und Beinen lässt sich vielfach auf unterschiedliche Körpergrößen einstellen.

Cruiser-Fans soll der F3 mit hoher Fahrdynamik und Sicherheit überzeugen, die
Rechts ein Gasgriff am Lenker, links die Tasten einer Halbautomatik zum Rauf- und Runterschalten. An der linken Fußraste nichts, rechts ein Bremspedal. So bedient man die Mischung aus leistungsstarkem Roadster á la Porsche Boxster und hyperagilem Supermoto-Zweirad. Der Pilot eines Can-Am Spyder F3 hängt mit ganzem Körper im Fahrtwind, freut sich dank breiter Vorderachse über reichlich Grip vorn und berechenbare Drifts mit leicht durchdrehendem Antriebsrad hinten – jedoch immer nur so weit, wie es die Sicherheitssysteme von Bosch zulassen. Das Stabilitätskontrollsystem SCS arbeitet wie ESP beim Auto, das Traktionskontrollsystem TCS verhindert Leistungseinsatz oberhalb der übertragbaren Antriebskräfte, ABS beugt Bremsblockaden vor. Das Fenster bis zum Einsatz der Systeme erlaubt leichte Driftwinkel, die die möglichen hohen Kurventempi mit einem großen Schuss Fahrspaß würzen.


Wer keinen Motorrad-Führerschein hat, oder sich nicht mehr auf die Schräglagen eines Zweirads einlassen möchte, kann sich durchaus auf eine Testfahrt mit einem Motor-Dreirad wie den Can-Am Spyder einlassen. Zum Fahren genügt in Deutschland ein Autoführerschein von vor dem 19. Januar 2013. Ein überzeugter Biker wird hier immer die Schräglage eines Motorrads vermissen, ebenso die Möglichkeit des Schlängelns durch Engstellen oder des problemlosen Parkens. Aber: Die extreme Fahrdynamik macht Spaß, die Sicherheitsreserven sind groß, Stauraum ist auch vorhanden. Und Beifahrer findet man fürs kippsichere Dreirad leichter, als für so manchen heißen Ofen mit nur zwei Rädern.


Für flotten Vortrieb sorgt beim Spyder F3 der 1,3-Liter-Dreizylinder von Bombardiers Konzerntochter Rotax. Der Reihen-Triple verwöhnt mit dem kräftigen Durchzug von immerhin 130 Nm Drehmoment, 86 kW/115 PS Leistung und dem charakteristischen Dreizylinder-Sound, den Fans zum Beispiel auch an einer Triumph Speed Triple schätzen. In nur 4,8 s katapultiert der Rotax-Antrieb das trocken 386 kg schwere Dreirad auf hundert km/h – das ist zwar um gut eineinhalb Sekunden langsamer als besagtes Triumph-Zweirad, aber immerhin exakt so schnell wie ein aktueller Porsche 911 Carrera.


Die Auswahl zwischen sechs Gängen erfolgt wahlweise manuell oder halbautomatisch. Gerade beim Cruiser F3 empfiehlt sich die Semi-Automatik, die beim Wechseln in niedrigere Gänge von selbst Zwischengas gibt und beim Hochschalten unter Last keine wesentliche Zugkraftunterbrechung spüren lässt. Fürs Fahrverhalten seines neuen F3 hat Can-Am die Erfahrungen mit seinen bisherigen Spyder-Modellen RS (Sportler), RT (Tourer) und ST (Tourensportler) einfließen lassen. Das Chassis ist um 40 Prozent steifer geworden, und dank der neuen Sitzposition mit nahezu gestreckten Beinen kann der Pilot stärker als bisher mit den Oberschenkeln lenken und so die Arme entlasten. Die müssen wegen der hohen Kurventempi und trotz dynamischer Servolenkung ganz schön Kraft aufwenden. Die Fahrtechnik mit ausgestrecktem kurvenäußerem Arm erleichtert mit der Zeit den heißen Kurvenritt mit dem Spyder F3, wie unsere ersten Testfahrten auf Mallorca gezeigt haben – unter anderem auf der extrem kurvigen Passstraße Coll de Sóller.


Drei Ausstattungspakete sollen unterschiedliche Fahrertypen bedienen. Dank des sogenannten UFIT-Systems lassen sich die Dreirad-Cruiser auf Körpergrößen zwischen 1,56 und 1,86 m optimal einstellen. Und selbst mit zwei Metern Länge hat man bequem Platz auf dem rasanten Spyder F3. Den Coolness-Faktor möchte Can-Am noch mit Kleidungs-Kollektionen unterstützen, was im Hinblick auf die meist männliche, über 40jährige Kundschaft auch gelingen kann – zumindest im Falle von nicht-Bikern.

Steckbrief Can-Am Spyder F3
Motor: Wassergekühlter Dreizylinder-Viertakt-Reihenmotor, Hubraum 1.330 ccm, Leistung 86 kW/115 PS, Drehmoment 130 Nm, Sechsganggetriebe (manuell oder halbautomatisch), Riemenantrieb.
Fahrwerk: Rohrrahmen, vorne doppelter Dreieckslenker mit Stabilisator, hinten Schwingarm mit Zentralfederbein; fußbetätigtes, hydraulisches Dreischeiben-Bremssystem, vorn Doppelscheibenbremse 270 mm, hinten Einscheibenbremse 270 mm, elektromechanische Feststellbremse, ABS serienmäßig.
Maße und Gewichte: Gesamtlänge 2,64 m, Sitzhöhe 67,5 cm, Stauraum 24,4 Liter, Trockengewicht 386 kg, Tankinhalt 27 Liter.
Messwerte: Höchstgeschwindigkeit 180 km/h, Beschleunigung 0 – 100 km/h: 4,8 sek, Verbrauch: 6,6 l/100 km, Reichweite: 406 km.

story:
Short Summary

 After restoring  PBR 6927, a Vietnam War era US Navy River Patrol Boat,


several years ago and having used it in various historical, educational and veteran appreciation functions, we'd like to fulfill a dream of many of the veterans that we have interacted with. As these boats generally operated in two boat patrols, it has been a desire of many former crew members to experience a pair of these boats operating in tandem once again. Both myself and Dennis Ambruso, owner of PBR 721

have worked together to help crew each other's boats for functions that honor service and educate the public about these little known branches of the US Navy and US Army in Vietnam.  In spite of our best efforts, we have never achieved the goal of fulfilling that two boat patrol dream. Distance and financial constraints have always held us back. PBR 6927 is located in eastern Ohio, and PBR 721 is located in north eastern North Carolina.
 After Dennis relocated to the Elizabeth City North Carolina area, at the prodding of former Vietnam Riverine Sailor Clarence "Coop" Cooper, 

Coop receives his Bronze Star
Dennis and I became involved with the local Chapter of The Gamewardens of Vietnam of which Coop was President. This was the name given to the US Navy's Task Force 116, which was tasked with patrolling the vast inland waterways of Vietnam, to deny the enemy the use of waterborne transportation of men and materials.
We are now both also involved with the 458th Sea Tigers(PBR), a US Army Vietnam PBR group. Through these groups, we have provided our boats for reunions, current US Navy ceremonies, and other functions that support the stated mission of these veterans' organizations, to keep their history and memory alive for future generations. 
  Unfortunately Coop passed away shortly after PBR 721's move to the area; he never got to see his vision come to fruition. He did manage to plant the seeds of his vision, laid the groundwork and established connections with the local US Navy assets in order to create an atmosphere of cooperation between the boat owners, active military and military veteran's groups. This was Coop's dream. For these reasons and through Coop's work, Dennis and I are attempting to make Coop's  dream  a reality - in his memory and spirit. 
 This is an epitaph describing who Coop was " We have lost the glue that held members of the Gamewardens Association Vietnam to present, Mid-Atlantic Chapter, together.  QMCS (SS) Clarence "Coop" Cooper was and is a loyal American Citizen, submarine sailor, war veteran and combat hero that many have and always will keep in their heart.  A man like him only comes around once in a while.  Not only have we lost a dear friend to all, but lost our ambassador to many United States Navy units past and present."
 We recently became aware of real estate opportunity in the Elizabeth City area that would make the two boat patrol an ongoing living history reality. We have been presented with a property the consists of canal front acreage, a small boat basin with several docks, and a large boathouse.  This could very well be the glue that Coop was in search of.
 Our immediate goal is to raise funding for the purchase of this property and develop a facsimile of a Vietnam era Small Boat Support Base. We would name this Base to honor Coop and all who served and would promote it as a central gathering place and focal point for Riverine veterans, current Riverine service members and families. Once ownership is established, both PBRs would be docked and operated from here and be made available for visiting veterans, local functions and other historic educational opportunities. 
 The current US Navy Riverine Forces are schooled in the doctrine of their Vietnam predecessors and always show a genuine interest in their history. The Gamewardens maintain a close working and social relationship with the current commands of the Small Boat and Riverine forces in the Norfolk VA area. It is through this relationship that our PBRs have been invited to participate in Command Change and retirement ceremonies, as well as family days and Capabilities Excercises. Establishing this local base of operations will allow greater opportunities to be involved in similar events and will honor those that have served as well as link the past history with the current cadre of Riverine forces.


What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for enough funding to make a reasonable offer towards the property as well as execute some up front infrastructure additions and repairs. Donations of any size can be made by Credit Card or Paypal.

The asking price for the property is $199,000. After meeting with the realtor and doing some local research on utilities and former use, we feel that we can get a reasonable offer on the table and along with our own contributions, to make this dream a reality. 

The establishment of this Riverine Base has been discussed with our friends in the various veteran's organizations. They are passionate about having a place that will be a focal point for meetings and family gatherings. They are looking at this as an opportunity to show their families what they did in their former military days and present a unique setting in which to share, explore and heal with their families and brethren.

In addition to veteran use and participation the setting would be available for public visits and local educational trips. We often have veterans interact with the public when we display our boats. These veterans often give a hands on, living history account of life in a PBR unit during the Vietnam War.

Our goal is to make this all happen in one fell swoop. If we fall short of our goal, any available funding will go towards the operation of both boats into the future. Due to a commitment of both boats being available for a joint Army/Navy PBR reunion in Hampton Virginia in Sept 2015, this will be the first historic event that both boats participate in. Your contributions will help make this, and other functions, a reality.


The Impact

As we are entering the decade of the 50 year plus anniversary of our involvement in Vietnam, we feel that this decade will be that which brings the awareness of the Vietnam Veteran's sacrifice and service to the forefront. Over the past several years, we have had the honor and privilege of reuniting individuals and crew with their past service. On many occasions, this has been a bonding and healing experience for those men and their families. It's difficult to think of these past individual instances and impacts without getting emotional. 

It's no mystery that these veterans were not well received upon their return to the US. Although I was a junior in high school when Saigon fell, being a student of military history, I was deeply impacted by the images of helicopters evacuating the US Embassy

 

and of countless "procured" helicopters being flown to US warships in the South China Sea, only to be pushed empty off the decks to make room for more fleeing refugees

As I've always held a special place in my heart due to the disservice that my fellow citizens provided to these vets upon their return, it may explain my desire in restoring this PBR as a means of honoring their sacrifice and history.

I found it particularly appropriate and somewhat of an omen this morning, on my way to do grocery shopping, to hear on Satellite Radio, sounds and recorded newscasts of the US final evacuation of Vietnam. I had planned to work on this proposal on this very day, which turned out to be the 40th anniversary of the fall of Saigon.  The memories of those newscasts and images came flooding back to the point that I had to pull over and collect my thoughts.


Challenges and Qualifications

Although we feel that this is a worthy goal for a worthwhile cause, we hope that you will also share our dream in achieving this milestone. The Vietnam veterans that I have interacted with are a private lot, they weren't shown much support upon their return and don't expect much. They are a quiet group that doesn't ask for much. Most would rather put forth efforts to insure that future generations of returning veterans are given their due honor. Help us to give them the welcome home that they deserve by providing this Living History honorarium for them and current and future Riverine Sailors. 

Collectively David Pizzoferrato and Dennis Ambruso have over 80 years of military vehicle restoration and preservation experience. Dennis has many years of experience and contacts within the military museum circles. He is also a founding member of The Military Museum of Southern New England in Danbury CT. David is a co-owner operator of a military vehicle restoration canvas business and has had prior experience in various team oriented management capacities in heavy and building construction trades in both public and private sector settings. The balance of our team and advisers will consist of passionate veterans with valuable hands on input.

Our team is uniquely qualified and shares a burning passion for seeing this project through.

In order to more fully appreciate and understand the challenges faced by those who manned and maintained these boats on a daily basis, here is an informative video that details the history of the Brown Water, Small Boat Navy in Vietnam



Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word and share this solicitation with friends, family, and everyone you think might be like minded. Here are the websites for PBR 6927 and PBR 721 

As this develops, we may offer some perks such as naming rights for hootches, Quonset Huts, etc. We'll address the suggested contribution and attributed structure in future updates.

 Be sure to check our gallery for other videos showing these boats in action supporting various venues.
story_txt:
Short Summary
 After restoring  PBR 6927, a Vietnam War era US Navy River Patrol Boat,
several years ago and having used it in various historical, educational and veteran appreciation functions, we'd like to fulfill a dream of many of the veterans that we have interacted with. As these boats generally operated in two boat patrols, it has been a desire of many former crew members to experience a pair of these boats operating in tandem once again. Both myself and Dennis Ambruso, owner of PBR 721have worked together to help crew each other's boats for functions that honor service and educate the public about these little known branches of the US Navy and US Army in Vietnam.  In spite of our best efforts, we have never achieved the goal of fulfilling that two boat patrol dream. Distance and financial constraints have always held us back. PBR 6927 is located in eastern Ohio, and PBR 721 is located in north eastern North Carolina.
 After Dennis relocated to the Elizabeth City North Carolina area, at the prodding of former Vietnam Riverine Sailor Clarence "Coop" Cooper, 
Coop receives his Bronze Star

Dennis and I became involved with the local Chapter of The Gamewardens of Vietnam of which Coop was President. This was the name given to the US Navy's Task Force 116, which was tasked with patrolling the vast inland waterways of Vietnam, to deny the enemy the use of waterborne transportation of men and materials. 
We are now both also involved with the 458th Sea Tigers(PBR), a US Army Vietnam PBR group. Through these groups, we have provided our boats for reunions, current US Navy ceremonies, and other functions that support the stated mission of these veterans' organizations, to keep their history and memory alive for future generations. 
  Unfortunately Coop passed away shortly after PBR 721's move to the area; he never got to see his vision come to fruition. He did manage to plant the seeds of his vision, laid the groundwork and established connections with the local US Navy assets in order to create an atmosphere of cooperation between the boat owners, active military and military veteran's groups. This was Coop's dream. For these reasons and through Coop's work, Dennis and I are attempting to make Coop's  dream  a reality - in his memory and spirit. 
 This is an epitaph describing who Coop was " We have lost the glue that held members of the Gamewardens Association Vietnam to present, Mid-Atlantic Chapter, together.  QMCS (SS) Clarence "Coop" Cooper was and is a loyal American Citizen, submarine sailor, war veteran and combat hero that many have and always will keep in their heart.  A man like him only comes around once in a while.  Not only have we lost a dear friend to all, but lost our ambassador to many United States Navy units past and present."
 We recently became aware of real estate opportunity in the Elizabeth City area that would make the two boat patrol an ongoing living history reality. We have been presented with a property the consists of canal front acreage, a small boat basin with several docks, and a large boathouse.  This could very well be the glue that Coop was in search of.

 Our immediate goal is to raise funding for the purchase of this property and develop a facsimile of a Vietnam era Small Boat Support Base. We would name this Base to honor Coop and all who served and would promote it as a central gathering place and focal point for Riverine veterans, current Riverine service members and families. Once ownership is established, both PBRs would be docked and operated from here and be made available for visiting veterans, local functions and other historic educational opportunities. 
 The current US Navy Riverine Forces are schooled in the doctrine of their Vietnam predecessors and always show a genuine interest in their history. The Gamewardens maintain a close working and social relationship with the current commands of the Small Boat and Riverine forces in the Norfolk VA area. It is through this relationship that our PBRs have been invited to participate in Command Change and retirement ceremonies, as well as family days and Capabilities Excercises. Establishing this local base of operations will allow greater opportunities to be involved in similar events and will honor those that have served as well as link the past history with the current cadre of Riverine forces.
    What We Need & What You Get We are asking for enough funding to make a reasonable offer towards the property as well as execute some up front infrastructure additions and repairs. Donations of any size can be made by Credit Card or Paypal.
The asking price for the property is $199,000. After meeting with the realtor and doing some local research on utilities and former use, we feel that we can get a reasonable offer on the table and along with our own contributions, to make this dream a reality. 
The establishment of this Riverine Base has been discussed with our friends in the various veteran's organizations. They are passionate about having a place that will be a focal point for meetings and family gatherings. They are looking at this as an opportunity to show their families what they did in their former military days and present a unique setting in which to share, explore and heal with their families and brethren.
In addition to veteran use and participation the setting would be available for public visits and local educational trips. We often have veterans interact with the public when we display our boats. These veterans often give a hands on, living history account of life in a PBR unit during the Vietnam War.
Our goal is to make this all happen in one fell swoop. If we fall short of our goal, any available funding will go towards the operation of both boats into the future. Due to a commitment of both boats being available for a joint Army/Navy PBR reunion in Hampton Virginia in Sept 2015, this will be the first historic event that both boats participate in. Your contributions will help make this, and other functions, a reality.

    The Impact As we are entering the decade of the 50 year plus anniversary of our involvement in Vietnam, we feel that this decade will be that which brings the awareness of the Vietnam Veteran's sacrifice and service to the forefront. Over the past several years, we have had the honor and privilege of reuniting individuals and crew with their past service. On many occasions, this has been a bonding and healing experience for those men and their families. It's difficult to think of these past individual instances and impacts without getting emotional. 
It's no mystery that these veterans were not well received upon their return to the US. Although I was a junior in high school when Saigon fell, being a student of military history, I was deeply impacted by the images of helicopters evacuating the US Embassy 
and of countless "procured" helicopters being flown to US warships in the South China Sea, only to be pushed empty off the decks to make room for more fleeing refugees
As I've always held a special place in my heart due to the disservice that my fellow citizens provided to these vets upon their return, it may explain my desire in restoring this PBR as a means of honoring their sacrifice and history.
I found it particularly appropriate and somewhat of an omen this morning, on my way to do grocery shopping, to hear on Satellite Radio, sounds and recorded newscasts of the US final evacuation of Vietnam. I had planned to work on this proposal on this very day, which turned out to be the 40th anniversary of the fall of Saigon.  The memories of those newscasts and images came flooding back to the point that I had to pull over and collect my thoughts.

    Challenges and Qualifications Although we feel that this is a worthy goal for a worthwhile cause, we hope that you will also share our dream in achieving this milestone. The Vietnam veterans that I have interacted with are a private lot, they weren't shown much support upon their return and don't expect much. They are a quiet group that doesn't ask for much. Most would rather put forth efforts to insure that future generations of returning veterans are given their due honor. Help us to give them the welcome home that they deserve by providing this Living History honorarium for them and current and future Riverine Sailors. 
Collectively David Pizzoferrato and Dennis Ambruso have over 80 years of military vehicle restoration and preservation experience. Dennis has many years of experience and contacts within the military museum circles. He is also a founding member of The Military Museum of Southern New England in Danbury CT. David is a co-owner operator of a military vehicle restoration canvas business and has had prior experience in various team oriented management capacities in heavy and building construction trades in both public and private sector settings. The balance of our team and advisers will consist of passionate veterans with valuable hands on input.
Our team is uniquely qualified and shares a burning passion for seeing this project through.
In order to more fully appreciate and understand the challenges faced by those who manned and maintained these boats on a daily basis, here is an informative video that details the history of the Brown Water, Small Boat Navy in Vietnam

As this develops, we may offer some perks such as naming rights for hootches, Quonset Huts, etc. We'll address the suggested contribution and attributed structure in future updates.

story:
Short Summary

Making Waves is all about service beyond your city limits, because we're all members of one global community.

Especially focused on women's and children's rights, education and marine conservation, my goal is to visit every United Nations country, volunteering and raising awareness of both the beauty in the world and the issues that are being posed to people everywhere. This will be done through both global action and local fundraising initiatives, all while documenting the entire journey through a YouTube video series.

Through partnering with elementary and middle school classrooms, I also hope to motivate the next generation of Wavemakers: dreamers, doers and leaders, to make a difference both locally and globally. 

And even though I'll definitely have fun while doing this, please know you are not just crowd funding a vacation!

The first part of this journey will take place in New Zealand and Australia, where I'll be showing the world the beauty that there is to be found on the Great Barrier Reef, as well as the lesser-known Ningaloo Reef. After that, I'll go to parts of Asia, Africa and Europe while attending university, and after graduation I plan to visit the rest of the United Nations countries before turning 30!

My ultimate goal is to find already-established programs and start new volunteer/sustainable tour programs in countries which aren't on the radar in order to help youth to reach out to the global community. My ultimate goal is to provide scholarships for youth to go out into the world and make a difference, and 20 percent of all contributions will go directly to this scholarship fund!


What We Need 

Here's where your money is going!
  • 10% to visas
  • 10% to food
  • 40% to plane tickets 
  • 20% to accommodations and volunteer fees
  • 20% to the scholarship fund
  • Please know that whether the $6000 goal is reached or not, 20% of any and all funds raised will go to the Wavemaker scholarship fund.

The Impact

Making Waves isn't just about me getting to every United Nation. It's about creating a ripple effect (no pun intended!), inspiring and enabling the next generation of leaders to take a more globally conscious view of the world.

  • By working directly with students via video call sessions and through speaking at assemblies, Making Waves will be able to directly address the questions that youth have
  • The Making Waves YouTube series will serve as a vehicle to show the general public both the lesser-known beauty of the world and the issues faced by citizens of countries that aren't always on the radar
  • And finally, by contributing to Making Waves, you're enabling us to send middle or high school students out into the world to volunteer and learn in the areas of marine conservation, education and/or women's and children's rights.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, there's so much you can do to help!

  • Please spread the word so I can share the world :)
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Part 2 of our Indiegogo Campaign will build upon funds received in round one that fell well below our goal. Thanks to everyone that contributed in that round that helped raise just over five-thousand dollars. https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/santana-hous...

This campaign/project of love to build a safe home for Lakota children is extremely important. Never has a need been greater as this Reservation has been hit hard by suicides. "TEN" in as little as five months! With more than 244 attempts and continually rising.  We have started a Grassroots Suicide Prevention Network called the Santana House group on Facebook on an interim to reach out to our youth that are at risk. https://www.facebook.com/groups/santanahouse/ Since we started this group we have helped curb these statistics through positive interventions of many wonderful members linked together here for the cause of lifting the hearts and spirits of many youth. Through the group

members invaluable assistance, caring, love and sharing with our beautiful Lakota children and hope we have made an impact. 
        But we're not out of the woods yet. Many of our young have stressed the need for a safe place to go to escape the day to day struggles that come from many sources where they live. Our continuing dream is to establish such a place where young people can go when they need that extra attention, care, guidance, and unconditional love from an extended support family. The Santana House once constructed will serve that purpose. Please take the time to contribute and share this link with friends and other social media sites. Most importantly, continue to remember the many friends and families whose children are pictured here in your prayers.

http://www.kotatv.com/news/south-dakota-news/Su...

With your support the  "Santana House" can make an even greater difference in the lives of many isolated families and their children. . Together, we can all share in a part of this vitally important task to save Lakota Children's lives.

At a conference held on the reservation March 2-4 our community came together to discuss ways to help curb and eliminate this problem. The need for safe places like the Santana House was one of several actions that came out of the conference.

But we cannot do this alone without your generous contribution.The Santana House will serve as a extended family for children that need that additional support, unconditional love and guidance. The facility will also serve as a culturally appropriate community-based tribal resource and invaluable addition to our child-safety-net where this type of resource is lacking..

story:
Where It All Began! 

Our story starts in the Niagara countryside. A vast landscape of farmland and vineyards, speckled with lush trees and nourished by lazy rivers. 

In 2009, we packed our bags and headed to Toronto, Canada. The hope was to someday create a space in the city where we could share our love for farm-to-table philosophy, encouraging others to be mindful of the products they use on their bodies by promoting the use of handcrafted, small batch skincare, and supporting local vendors, farmers, artisans and crafters like ourselves.

In addition to hosting artisans from across Ontario, We specialize in offering our own product line of handcrafted, holistic wellness and skincare products, made in small batches using the purest herbs, extracts, oils, and butters. Each product is thoughtfully and simply formulated with the healing power of botanicals to be equally nourishing and effective. Free of preservatives, synthetic fragrances, parabens and sulphates. 

Our passion is bringing focus to the benefits of living simply - using ethically sourced products, developing relationships with local farmers, vendors, and artisans and reducing our overall global footprint by encouraging others to shop locally.

ROWAN was born from our passion to live simply, support our community, and source and create products handmade with care, using the best ingredients available! 

What We Need, What You Get & The Impact

In addition to the funds that we've worked tediously to save ourselves, we are seeking help from family members, friends, and from the general public. The $12,000 that we are looking for will help us to build longterm relationships with local artisans and farmers and ensure that they are properly paid for their goods at fair-trade prices. The funds will also allow us to pay for and host sustainable living classes in our community. If we are fortunate enough to meet our goal, we will be able to provide free shelf space for budding organic entrepreneurs and artisans, and promote weekly feature vendors and demonstrations.

For our generous supporters, we promise to offer a wonderful hand-crafted product, among other treats! You’ll get to try anything from raw local honey, to ethically gathered wool, artisan preserves, and holistic skincare – and you’ll be supporting local artisans! Hurray!

We will also be donating a portion of our storefront proceeds to local charities and organizations that support ethical farming and sustainable living. 

Challenges

Having been raised by a family of entrepreneurs, we know that the struggle can be great to gain exposure for small businesses. However, we are so passionate about our concept and feel confident that we can gain momentum. We have created wonderful relationships with our local community over the years that we have been participating in Toronto’s farmers market circuit. We love our city and are committed to offering support to local vendors, and an authentic experience to our patrons. We plan to continue our active participation in the city`s markets, and will work diligently to spread the good word about what we are doing.



Other Ways You Can Help

If you`re are unable to offer monetary support, don`t feel badly! We appreciate any efforts to share this crowdfunding page, and thank you tremendously for taking the time to read our proposal! 

We look forward to welcoming you soon!

ROWAN

story:
Who We Are

    We are hard workers, artists, fans and entrepreneurs. The success of the first annual Jekyll Comic Con was better than expected, however, it was mainly funded out of personal finances. To make it even bigger and better and to bring you a more epic experience, we need your help! It's important to us to have an outlet for fandoms to meet and explore again. It's a perfect place to nerd out with your friends while winning prizes, meeting your idols, stars, favorite comic artists, as well as some local master minds or your own. So with your help, we can do this!

What We Need & What You Get

The money we raise will help to cover the cost of guest appearances, prizes, con merchandise, location and food options. When you donate, you will receive the unique perks listed for that level. Not only that, but...

Donations Help Save Artist Tommy Castillo's Eyes!

10% of funds raised are IMMEDIATELY donated to help our friend and renowned artist Tommy Castillo, a phenomenal artist who created Dark Side of Oz and worked on Toetags with George Romero, Tales from the Crypt and so much more. He recently fought a battle with Diabetes that almost took his life but he still has so much more to give the world. Without surgery Tommy will go blind within a year- maybe less.  Each surgery is $ 4,000 per eye. The doctor noted that he will need AT LEAST two treatments in each eye plus prescriptions and recovery time. Your pledge will support two causes - our event, and more importantly, Tommy's sight.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can donate, but that doesn't mean you can't help.

Just by sharing this page means a lot. If you love conventions in general, just share it and pass it on.

FOLLOW US ON FACEBOOK!

FOLLOW US ON INSTAGRAM!

FOLLOW US ON TWITTER!

story:
Wales is rightly famous for its green hillsides covered in sheep. But would you believe it has a surprising shortage of yarn shops? Some of us look at those fields of sheep and wonder where all that wool goes...

We are Ruth and Jenny, the founders of Ammonite yarns, a new shop selling knitting and crochet yarns and accessories in Pontyclun, South Wales. Knitting is our passion and any knitter knows that you can't knit without a stash, so at Ammonite Yarns, our stated aim is to bring more choice to knitters and crocheters in our part of South Wales.

The money we raise through this campaign will be used to purchase extra yarns to give our customers the widest possible choice.


We plan to showcase yarns that are usually easily available only on the internet, and to focus on natural fibres and British yarns.  For our big name suppliers we are planning to stock Drops Designs from Norway and TB Ramsdens (Wendy, Robin, Peter Pan) from Yorkshire. We also want to have yarns from smaller producers like West Yorkshire Spinners, Woolly Knits, Milla Mia, Fybrespates and Rooster Yarns to name but a few of our fantastic British producers.  Together these yarns will satisfy a broad spectrum knitting and crochet needs, so that every yarn addict will enjoy visiting us.

We will run knitgroups and workshops from the shop so that we can share skills and techniques as well as publish patterns to go with the yarns.  

The premises and basic stock for the shop we can fund ourselves but we would like your help to raise another £5,000 to really make this a shop of delights.

The Perks!!

Our perks range from discount codes valid for two years on all yarn purchases to toys and garments handknitted for you.  These may be a cuddly ammonite or a fine lace scarf or a unique hand-knitted jumper -- it all depends on how much you contribute. 


Your contributions will make a huge difference to the range of yarns we will have in our shop. We will be able to stock more of the less well-known brands, particularly the specialist British wool ones. Customers who visit our shop – in person or on-line – will be able to explore yarns they don't often see elsewhere. The extended choice in yarns and colours will all be down to you!

Even if you can't contribute money, you can help us by sharing this campaign, our Facebook page and website to your friends. The more support we have, the better the shop will be. You can do this by using the share tools on this website: http://www.ammoniteyarns.moonfruit.com
story_txt:
Wales is rightly famous for its green hillsides covered in sheep. But would you believe it has a surprising shortage of yarn shops? Some of us look at those fields of sheep and wonder where all that wool goes...
We are Ruth and Jenny, the founders of Ammonite yarns, a new shop selling knitting and crochet yarns and accessories in Pontyclun, South Wales. Knitting is our passion and any knitter knows that you can't knit without a stash, so at Ammonite Yarns, our stated aim is to bring more choice to knitters and crocheters in our part of South Wales.The money we raise through this campaign will be used to purchase extra yarns to give our customers the widest possible choice.




We
plan to showcase yarns that are usually easily available only on
the internet, and to focus on natural fibres and British yarns. 
For our big name suppliers we are planning to stock Drops Designs
from Norway and TB Ramsdens (Wendy, Robin, Peter Pan) from Yorkshire.
We also want to have yarns from smaller producers like West Yorkshire
Spinners, Woolly Knits, Milla Mia, Fybrespates and Rooster Yarns to
name but a few of our fantastic British producers.  Together
these yarns will satisfy a broad spectrum knitting and
crochet needs, so that every yarn addict will enjoy
visiting us. 

We will run knitgroups and workshops from the shop so that we can share skills and techniques as well as publish patterns to go with the yarns.  
The premises and basic stock for the shop we can fund ourselves but we would like your help to raise another £5,000 to really make this a shop of delights.
The Perks!!
Our perks range from discount codes valid for two years on all yarn purchases to toys and garments handknitted for you.  These may be a cuddly ammonite or a fine lace scarf or a unique hand-knitted jumper -- it all depends on how much you contribute. 




Your contributions will make a huge
difference to the range of yarns we will have in our shop. We will be
able to stock more of the less well-known brands, particularly the
specialist British wool ones. Customers who visit our shop – in
person or on-line – will be able to explore yarns they don't often
see elsewhere. The extended choice in yarns and colours will all be
down to you!


Even if you can't contribute money, you
can help us by sharing this campaign, our Facebook page and website
to your friends. The more support we have, the better the shop will
be. You can do this by using the share tools on this website:
http://www.ammoniteyarns.moonfruit.com

story:
Finally, a 21st century bread box that is simple and looks great and keeps your bread, fruit, and other perishables fresher longer! If your fresh obsessed - you've come to the right place! 

Enjoy fresh food every single day! For the cooking enthusiasts who love simplicity and design. Complete your kitchen today!

Vigore Bread Box keeps food fresh and saves you money

Vigore Bread Box is a fully-automated and sustainable kitchen system that keeps food fresh for up to 5 times longer and bread of all types stays fresh up to 3 times longer with an innovative patented vacuum system. Not only is the Vigore Bread Box an intelligent food storing system, it's also an award winning home decor appliance. 

Vigore, the only vacuum system with "Easy Access Storage" that looks great in any kitchen!

Start saving food in your kitchen

Did you know that by storing your food correctly you can save hundreds of dollars a year and reduce your impact on the environment at the same time? Not to mention have your food taste better.

Wouldn't you like your bread and other food items to taste great 3 times longer? Don't you hate it when your bread doesn't taste the same the very next day you buy it?

Why wait any longer to get a system that keeps your bread and other food items fresh and looks great in your kitchen? 


How it Works

The electric air pump removes the air from the device and creates a vacuum. 
The vacuum slows down the harmful effects aerobic microbes (e.g. moulds) that are present in foods and stops their reproduction as well as the aging process.
In a vacuum the speed of oxidation (rancidification) decreases and the flavour changing process slows down keeping the products fresh up to five times longer and bread up to three times longer.


For Your Daily Food

No more unsustainable packaging, aluminium foils or ugly plastic storage containers. You simply put your remaining food in the Vigore, close it , and the Vigore does the rest. It is that simple.


Why Choose Vigore Bread Box?

A survey among potential users proves that the Vigore Bread Box is much more effective than similar products available. It's practical, simple to use, looks great in any kitchen and is convenient in today's fast paced world.

The Vigore Bread Box not only extends the life of your bread products and fruits and vegetables, it saves you money as well. 

A totally unique international product with a European Patent (EP) and United States Patent (USA) there is nothing else like it!

Available Colors:

Get any color you want to match your style and kitchen!
  • Caviar Black 
  • Forest Brown
  • Royal Red

Choose a color of your Vigore Bread Box that will match your kitchen decor. The Vigore Bread Box can also be used to bring a different accent color to the kitchen. After pledging through Indiegogo you will receive an email to ask which colors you prefer.



Without margin of retail

For now temporarily available at Indiegogo:

The Vigore comes in three colors and won the design of the year in Europe in 2010. The touchscreen control panel of the Vigore is built into the cover and lights up when touched.

Obviously the contributors at Indiegogo get a nice reward for their contribution. Not only will they be the first to have this wonderful kitchen innovation but they also get a discount on the Vigore Bread Box. The pricing list below illustates these discounts:


Vigore, an ideal present

You will be sure to have an unique gift this year. During the Indiegogo introduction you can give away a Vigore for friends or family. 


VIGORE FRESH TIP:

Fast Marinating: Make every BBQ and Dinner a Fast Success!

Forgot to marinate your steak or chicken the day before? No worries, within no time the vacuum will help you marinate your food within minutes and your food will taste just as good without the timely preparation.

REWARDS:

F A Q  - ORDERS & DELIVERY

When can I expect my delivery?

On Indiegogo you’ll find our expected delivery month. In the meantime we will keep you posted about our production process. That way you’ll know when to expect the Vigore. At time of transportation we will send a track and trace code for your package.

How can I make clear what colors and size I order?

After you ordered a Vigore product through Indiegogo we will send you an email. In this email you have the options to select the desired colors and you can change delivery addresses. When you buy a Vigore product as a gift, it is also possible to leave a personal note to the lucky receiver of this one of a kind gift.

How Can I order additional Vigore products?

During the Indiegogo period you can order additional products, at a discount if you are a Indiegogo contributor. We will deliver them at the same time as your first order, with no extra costs. Any additional orders after the Indiegogo period will be handled once all deliveries have been made to  the Indiegogo contributors. Therefore, these orders can take more time. It is also possible we will not be able to send packages to certain areas after the Indiegogo period has ended until  we expand to that region - if this happens we will refund your money.

Other questions about sales, price and delivery?

Send a mail to support@vigore.ca

 F A Q  - TECHNICAL ASPECTS

Is the system noisy, when in use?

No, we developed the system keeping in mind that noise is prohibited. We know there are systems in the market that make a lot of noise and most of the time you just don’t want this in your kitchen or living room.

Does the system use a lot of energy?

Not at all. The system works with 110V in North America and 220V in Europe and only uses 1.5 watt/hour. When the vacuum pressure is sufficient the system doesn’t use energy. Having to throw out your good food is the real energy waste because it costs a lot of energy to produce and ship food.

What is the lifetime of the Vigore?

We aim for a durable system that lasts for 25 years at minimum. Which is why we offer a Lifetime warranty with the Vigore. Of course we don’t have user experience yet, but we know which existing parts we use and they have already been tested. 

Is the system dishwasher proof?

The Vigore cover itself contains electrical parts and therefore isn’t dishwasher proof. We recommend cleaning the Vigore with a soft cloth and some non aggressive soap. 

Is there a power cord attached to the system?

Yes, the system comes with a power cord. Because the plug of the cord can be visible, we use a design plug suitable for the United States and European countries.

Other questions about manual issues?

Send a mail to: support@vigore.ca

What still needs to be done

So far we have invested $700,000 in perfecting the Vigore Bread Box which was used in research, patents, manufacturing tools and completing the first prototype. Contributors of Indiegogo are very important to us to get our business started and produce the Vigore Bread Box at scale to help familes and people all over the world enjoy the freshness of their food for up to 5x longer. 

Vigore Team

Zsolt Koloredi, President and Co-Founder

Csaba Szeivolt,  CEO and Co-Founder and Campaign Manager

Keszei Balazs, CEO and Co-Founder of Europe

Michael H. Brunet, Online Marketing Manager
