story:
MEET US

We are a hybrid social entrepreneurship incubator (think of people who start companies and programs to help social causes) and research institute focused on helping develop social enterprises and connecting the fields of youth development, inter-generational development, youth development hubs, and economic development.  

We are committed to helping addressing the social and economic issues coming from a lack of access to social and monetary capital, leadership in crucial roles for young adults, lack of connections between business, educational, and social institutions in communities, and economic development.  We are a sustainable social center that serves as the central hub in a network of programs, initiatives, and research focusing on youth, community, and economic development.  

Our main work and expertise focuses on: 

  • Program Evaluation: We perform all types of evaluation, including full evidence based evaluations utilizing analytical tools such as surveys, focus groups, rapid assessment procedures, etc.

  • Social Enterprise Incubator: Our signature program helps programs grow their way from an initial start up to full evidence based practice.  To date we have already partnered with Pittsburgh and Detroit to develop this model by serving as the social incubator providing technical support, research, and evaluation to help these programs grow. 

  • Research, Policy, and Trend Analysis: Researching and disseminating new information on growing global needs and trends in human capital and economic development, such as the connection between India’s youth bulge and the Japanese need for human resources

WHY WE NEED YOU

Our colleague Research Associate Will Greenaway was recently admitted into the summer program at the London School of Economics-- one of the premier institutions for economics in the world.  The school only has a 7.2 percent acceptance rate. 

We use economic analysis daily to ensure our Youth Development Hubs have a positive economic impact on the communities we work with.  We will use Will's training to assess the economic impact of our program partner, Youth CAST, in McKeesport, Pennsylvania.  

You can help by contributing.  


ABOUT WILL



William Greenaway holds a BA in Japanese and Anthropology and a Masters in Developmental Psychology and Education from the University of Pittsburgh.  He is a certified youth worker, avid outdoorsman, and travels around the globe to conduct research and help build programs that connect youth, community, and economic development.

His main research interests are youth, community, and economic development in a globalized world.  Following with this mission Will travels to a different country every few months to conduct qualitative research on the issues connecting youth, community, and economic development.  Recently, this work took him to Spain to document the issues facing the Spanish economy and its relationship to the high rates of unemployment for people in Spain under the age of 26.  As an additional part of this research, he conducted interviews with youth living in the Catalan region of Spain to understand the link between human capital, economics, and the political agenda for the movement for independence in Catalonia.

Versed in both quantitative and qualitative methods of research and evaluation, Will is currently spearheading a multi-year developmental evaluation study of the Youth Communities and Schools Together (Youth C.A.S.T.) program in McKeesport Pennsylvania.  The research will be used to focus on the development of the Youth Development Hub Model in McKeesport Pennsylvania.  The end result will be an evidence-based model for youth development that will be the focal point for youth development in the Pittsburgh and Monongahela Valley region of Pennsylvania.

He is currently serving as a representative to the International Federation of Educative Communities (FICE), an international group devoted to youth development around the globe.

Read more about Will here 


OUR PROJECTS


Social Enterprise Incubator: Youth, Communities, and Schools Together (Youth CAST), McKeesport, PA

Youth CAST is a youth development hub located in McKeesport, Pennsylvania dedicated to civic youth leadership development, community service learning, and family engagement.  Using a core group of youth leaders the program is designed by and implemented by the community to revitalize itself via community service projects designed, planned, and implemented by the youth leaders.  

Our Role

As the chief evaluator we are providing our signature pathways to evidence based evaluation.  Utilizing the latest qualitative and quantitative assessments we are helping Youth CAST custom tailor their evaluation strategy to allow for systematic improvement in their program.  Each phase of evaluation is a piece in the overall end result-- a fully evidence based program that grows with the program as it develops.  The program is now in Phase II of its development and third year of operation and is growing to be a sustainable, replicated model for bringing together youth, community, and economic development for the entire Monongahela Valley Region of Pennsylvania.

Our Partners

The Heinz Endowments

The City of McKeesport

The YMCA

Boys and Girls Club 

McKeesport Area School District

Saturday Light Brigade

Pittsburgh C.A.R.E.S.

Urban Achievement

Aristotle Education Emporium

Carnegie Library of McKeesport

Bethlehem Baptist Church of McKeesport


HOW YOUR MONEY WILL BE USED

  • Every dollar you pledge will go towards sending Will to the London School of Economics and help us get the skills in economics that we need.  

Any additional money will be used in three primary areas:

  • Helping communities to be successful – the success of the communities rest with our ability to constantly test, tweak, and retest our model. Your contribution will help create an environment for this to happen, including infrastructure, education, development resources, and more.

  • Creating a global community – we are creating a global community at the Protean Institute to solve our world's greatest challenges.

    Your money will NOT be used for:

  • The prizes.

  • Fundraising activities and events.

*If you have any further questions about how the money is spent, or any other questions, feel free to ask by leaving a comment.


PRESS 

Check out the articles about our programs. 
McKeesport 

http://triblive.com/neighborhoods/yourmckeesport/yourmckeesportmore/4859855-74/youth-cast-detroit#axzz3RGFwJPuW

http://triblive.com/neighborhoods/yourmckeesport/yourmckeesportmore/4177644-74/community-mckeesport-committee#axzz3RGFwJPuW

http://triblive.com/neighborhoods/yourmckeesport/yourmckeesportmore/4563002-74/mckeesport-program-voices#axzz3RGFwJPuW

QUESTIONS?

What is Youth Development?

It is called many things, after school programs, boy scouts and girl scouts, summer learning programs, sports leagues.  What's consistent is they all acknowledge that learning doesn't end when the school bell rings or summer begins.  Young people need to visit recreation centers, libraries, play soccer, have great tutors.

Why are you doing this?

We believe that healthy economies, societies, and democracies are the result of well developed people.  Well developed people grow from healthy youth development.  Great tutors, sports programs, schools, and local buisnesses all teach skills such as perseverance, social skills, and employment skills.  All of these are needed for a healthy society and economy. 

How do we know the Protean Institute will be successful?

First and foremost we have submitted our findings and research to rigorous academic reviews and documented our process of work.  You can view the article here. 

Why the $10,000 figure?

The two classes in econometrics costs £4,250, roughly $6,500 after accounting for dollar to pound exchange rates.  We built in some cushion in case the rates fluctuate even more and to account for any fees.

Why all the service offers for perks?

Often you see material perks offered more often than not.  Since we believe that each person should be able to access self help and apply life hacks as needed, we decided to offer actual services you could get from big name research firms.  All this provided at a fraction of what you would normally pay.  It's our way of saying "keep up the good work!"

Can I donate from outside the USA?

Of course!

I am a celebrity or public figure and would like to get involved or help out. How do I get in touch with you?

Please email Dr. Munoz, our Senior Director, who can discuss this further with you.

http://triblive.com/neighborhoods/yourmckeesport/yourmckeesportmore/4563002-74/mckeesport-program-voices#axzz3RGFwJPuW
QUESTIONS? What is Youth Development?It is called many things, after school programs, boy scouts and girl scouts, summer learning programs, sports leagues.  What's consistent is they all acknowledge that learning doesn't end when the school bell rings or summer begins.  Young people need to visit recreation centers, libraries, play soccer, have great tutors.Why are you doing this?We believe that healthy economies, societies, and democracies are the result of well developed people.  Well developed people grow from healthy youth development.  Great tutors, sports programs, schools, and local buisnesses all teach skills such as perseverance, social skills, and employment skills.  All of these are needed for a healthy society and economy. How do we know the Protean Institute will be successful?First and foremost we have submitted our findings and research to rigorous academic reviews and documented our process of work.  You can view the article here. Why the $10,000 figure?The two classes in econometrics costs £4,250, roughly $6,500 after accounting for dollar to pound exchange rates.  We built in some cushion in case the rates fluctuate even more and to account for any fees.Why all the service offers for perks?Often you see material perks offered more often than not.  Since we believe that each person should be able to access self help and apply life hacks as needed, we decided to offer actual services you could get from big name research firms.  All this provided at a fraction of what you would normally pay.  It's our way of saying "keep up the good work!"Can I donate from outside the USA?Of course!I am a celebrity or public figure and would like to get involved or help out. How do I get in touch with you?Please email Dr. Munoz, our Senior Director, who can discuss this further with you.

story:
Introducing The Car-Li Bagg, the patent-pending car litter bag with a twist!   I'm excited to share my version of a car trash bag designed with adjustable, side seat attachment for front and back seat passenger accessibility and an interior deodorizer pocket to keep the bag fresh. 

Professionally, I'm a financial service’s customer service problem solver.  Personally, I enjoy DIY projects.  I get to create and improve my personal space the way I like it.  Last year, I combined my problem solving skills with my passion for DIY and created the Car-Li Bagg.

I came up with the idea after I got fed up with my teen aged son (who suffers from allergies) constantly littering my car with soiled tissues, food wrappers, partially eaten food, and other trash.  I started using a grocery bag attached to the gearshift.  When it filled up, it was unsightly, uncomfortable for my front seat passenger and became an unsafe obstacle on my gearshift. This is literally the way my son kept the car.

Totally frustrated, I thought,  I'll just buy a car trash bag.  Easier said than done.  The ones I found were not designed for front seat occupants.  Others weren't designed to hold enough car litter to make it useful to me.  Still others were made of fabric that absorbed stains and odor.  To solve my problem, I set out to make my own car trash bag.

First, I wanted it to be conveniently accessible to both front AND back seat occupants.  Second, I wanted comfort.  The side strap fits around the front passenger seat and molds comfortably into the seat as the passenger reclines.  Then I designed the pouch to be big enough  (9" L x 5" w x 8.5" deep) to hold a fair amount of litter, yet small enough not to get in the way. Interior vinyl lining was added for spills.  And, since the bag is shoulder level, I wanted pouch freshness, so I attached an interior pocket for a scented insert.  The pleasant scent can linger outside the pouch as well.  It's the car litter bag that makes SCents!

Simple.  Thoughtful.  And it works!

A by-product of using The Car-Li Bagg  - it helps us be more environmentally conscious.  With the convenience of The Car-Li Bagg in the car,  the normal tendency will be to use the bag, instead of discarding litter out the window. 

Your T-Shirt promotes an environmental message. It will bear a "small " oval image  depicting The Bagg nestled among lush greenery with the caption:

BE KIND TO YOUR ENVIRONMENT

Put  litter in its place with THE CAR-LI BAGG   




The Car-Li Bagg is great for parents with small children, for those who use their car as an office, and for those who just want a clutter free car.  And  for those of you who have been using that cereal box for car litter (and you know who you are), you can start using The Car-Li Bagg instead!



The car trash bag category is a sleeping GIANT within the $216 Billion auto accessories industry.  I believe I can bring  awareness and fill a need in this space at this critical time.  The Car-Li Bagg,  making life a little less cluttered for the car driving public with a uniquely comfortable, convenient, and economical way to deal with nuisance car litter.   

I've journeyed several months balancing  my other "Life" with this  vision .  With your help, I can get a solid start on getting proof of concept sales, branding The Car-Li Bagg name and making it a household name in the auto accessories space. 

When you invest in me, you're investing in my background as a professional who understands  the value of good customer service and doing what I say I'm going to do.   I'm committed to finalizing my patent process, continuing to improve my product and taking The Car-Li Bagg to the next level.  No contribution is too small.  Thank you for your help!

Next Steps: 

1)Trademark  The Car-Li Bagg name

2)Purchase raw material, supplies, and labor for perk fulfillment and proof of concept of sales [of which I already have several  pending purchase orders].

3)Create and Optimize a dedicated website for consumer awareness.

RISKS AND CHALLENGES:

I have a wonderful and accomplished seamstress (Judy Hardister) working with me on the product.   If fabric goes out of stock, we may ask to substitute an order.  However, I always try to avail myself of fabrics that are “re-orderable” which is part of my customer service strategy.

Scaling the product depends on the outcome of my campaign and ultimate demand as marketing ramps up.


SEE GALLERY PHOTOS FOR  CAR-LI BAGG STYLE OPTIONS THAT ARE CURRENTLY AVAILABLE

story:
The Deal

HAIRPARTY was born into the world just under a year ago, a labor of love to bring body-positive, queer-and-weirdo-centric, all-party-all-the-time hairmagic to the beloved citizens of Portland, Oregon and beyond.

A one-unicorn ship, with Hair Wizard Nancy Dear at the helm, we have set out to make the world a better place, one head at a time. Our journey is about bodily agency, awesome hairs, and partying all the ways all the time.

Nancy Dear is a licensed hairdresser that has been making hairmagic in Portland for the last 5 years.

And now, in 2015, she has the opportunity to take on new digs and transform them into a sparkling den of wizardry! But she needs your help!

The List

Up to this point, workspace has been shared with a fellow hairdresser who has provided most of the basics, as she moves on, there are many (expensive) things that need to happen to keep our journey going.

Here's what we need:

  • Licensure updates: Paperwork must be filed, and fees paid, with the State of Oregon, asserting responsibility for your well-being in the space. ($200)
  • Rent/Deposit: Dues need to be paid while transition is taking place and time to provide hairwizardry is limited. ($3650)
  • Furniture and Appliances: Waiting area seating. Shock-absorbing mats to protect a precious unicorn at work. Curtains and a way for you to hang your hat! ($550)
  • Backbar: A fully-stocked backbar will let us provide color services at-will, instead of always with prior consult. ($500)
  • Scheduling Robot: Fees to our beloved Robot Receptionist to continue having clients schedule online. ($250)
  • Tools: Clipper blades need replacing, shears need sharpening, color brushes only last a while, and all of them make your hair party harder! ($25-sky's the limit!)
  • Even if we don't make it all the way to the big money, every little bit helps. First priorities are Licensure and Rent to keep the doors open while we work towards the rest!


Perks for You!

In exchange for your support, besides the warm fuzzies you get from helping a unicorn live her dream, you also get presents!
  • Endless adoration and affections!
  • 1" buttons!
  • HAIRPARTY totes!
  • HAIRPARTY tees!


STREET TEAM 4EVER

Even if you can't throw in dollars, sharing helps!!!

  • Tell everybody you know! Does your mom love small business and dreams? Tell her! Your grocer really into cats and sparklemagic? Tell them too!
  • Indiegogo share tools will let you share in all your social media platforms!

THANK YOU THANK YOU THANK YOU!!!!!!!!!!

story:
Our voice matters! 


The Young Leaders Caucus is a group of young people, mostly young women who have had the privilege of attending the NGO Forum Beijing +20 ECE Regional Review. Some of us were not even born at the time of the Beijing Platform for Action in 1995, which set in motion an international movement for women's rights. 

Right now there are more young people on the planet than ever before with 1.8 billion of us, aged between 10-24 years old. Young people matter as we are the future shapers and leaders. Future goals and recommendations will impact our generations the most! 

While young people have become the object of an increasing number of programmes and initiatives, they are rarely regarded and included as key stakeholders and active agents of change in the world of politics, private sector, civil society and international organisations. 

However, as the next generation of leaders our voices matter and our concerns are real. 

We appreciate that we stand on the shoulders of giants and pay great respect to the women who have laid the ground work for us to ensure our human rights and greater access to education, health, employment and the labour market. But as young people, particularly as young women, we still face many challenges: from street harassment to restricted reproductive rights; from domestic violence to political underrepresentation. 

We thus aspire for a world free of violence; a  world  of  peace,  where  democracy  thrives  and  women can  enjoy  and  exercise their  full  rights  as  citizens; a world  of  accountability  for  all  and  by  all.   


Help us go to New York!


The United Nations headquarters in New York will be hosting the 59th session of the Commission on the Status of Women from 9 to 20 March 2015. This international gathering is crucial. Representatives of Member States, UN entities, and accredited non-governmental organizations from all regions of the world will be in attendance. It is an incredible opportunity for the Young Leaders Caucus to ensure that young people are recognized as active agents of change and that our voices are heard. 
The Young Leaders Caucus wants to send 7 representatives to CSW59. With your donation, we will be able to:
- Travel to New York: many of us do not reside in the United States and our representatives will have to buy airline tickets for international flights. 
- Pay for accommodation: CSW59 will be held over the course of 11 days and we need to ensure that our representatives will stay warm at night! 

Don't forget to check out the perks section! The Young Leaders Caucus seeks to raise awareness about, and promote the inclusion of youth in the women's rights movement. So let us thank you for your donation and give back in every way we can! 

Why should you support us?


As young women we are one of the most powerful driving forces to improve lives and transform communities: we are more than a statistic, we are a valuable asset to nations and a critical population group.
Thanks to your support, the Young Leaders Caucus will ensure that:
-  Meaningful participation of young women is central to the Beijing +20;
- Concerns of young generations are heard and their recommendations for solutions are implemented;
- Young people, more particularly young women, are included as active participants in all decision making platforms within political, economic and social spheres. 


Spread the word!


If you want to help us even more, or if you cannot make a donation but would like to support us, spread the word! You can:
- share our campaign on social networks
- tell organizations that you think could be interested in our campaign about us.

Thank you!

We appreciate your support so much, there is no way we can do it without you. By supporting us, you are supporting the movement for women's rights and gender equality.

story:
In Malawi 1 in 15 children die before they reach the age of 5, and 1 in 250 women die during pregnancy and childbirth.


You can help mothers help themselves, their children and their communities in rural Malawi.


“I have a healthy child who is growing well because of this project” 

A mother who lost six children before this project started working in her village


What we do:

MaiMwana means “mother and child" in the local Malawian language and our project is a research and development organisation based in the rural district of Mchinji in Malawi.

We work directly with mothers and communities to help them help themselves and their children. Our methods work. They've led to: 

  • a 70% reduction in deaths amongst mothers during pregnancy and birth
  • a 40% reduction in death amongst newborns


How do we do it?

We work with local communities to help them help themselves. We do this in a range of ways: 

We help women get the training to produce radio programmes to educate themselves. We help them lobby for bicycle ambulances so that women in labour can get to a health centre in time. We support communities in setting up group funds and small businesses so they have money to prepare for new children. We facilitate communities and health workers in understanding why mothers and children have died, so they can implement sustainable solutions (and we featured on the BBC for this work!). 

Our women’s groups identify problems and act together to solve them. Peer counselling, using mobile phones to gather and spread information, and finding out why people are dying, all lead to reductions in deaths and improvements in health.

We plan to improve and expand our community work, by involving men, working on family planning, improving nutrition, and improving child health. 

To see how we do it, watch this video:


"It's not a drug. It's not a vaccine. It's not a device. It's women, working together, solving problems, saving lives." Richard Horton, Editor of The Lancet 


Why support us:

Securing funding for our on-going support of communities is a challenge. Your donation will allow us to continue working hand in hand with the local health team, reaching the most isolated and vulnerable communities, and helping women save lives.


The Team:

The MaiMwana team is made up of 80 incredibly dedicated staff, including over 50 field workers, data officers, nurses and midwives, PhD students and young Malawian researchers, as well as over 2,000 volunteers across the district. 

The team is led by the project manager Tambosi Phiri, a nurse by background, who has spent the last 10 years working with the local health management team. We also have partners at University College London, and the project's wonderful directors (Peter and Charles, both pediatricians), all dedicated to improving the lives of women and children in Mchinji. 


You can help us by:

  • Donating money to help us continue our work saving the lives of mothers and children
  • Sharing our campaign through social media
  • Following our updates and those of our partners (and here!)

By donating or sharing our campaign, you can help us save lives and improve the health and well being of communities in rural Malawi, so please donate and share!

story:
What is pcWRT?

pcWRT is an OpenWrt based wifi router. It comes with solid parental control tools to protect children on your home network.

What can you do with pcWRT parental control?

Unlike parental control software that you have to install and configure on each and every device, pcWRT provides a centralized place from where you can manage your children's Internet access. With pcWRT, you configure the rules once at the router and all devices connected to your wifi network are protected - computers, smartphones, tablets, even game consoles with built-in browsers.

Here are some examples of what you can do:
  1. Block pornography and other undesirable content with OpenDNS or Norton ConnectSafe.
  2. Prevent inappropriate images from showing up in Google search by enforcing SafeSearch.
  3. Limit children's time on social networking and video sites such as Facebook, Instagram and Youtube, while allowing unlimited time for school related sites.
  4. Turn off Internet at night for children only, with no impact on parent's Internet access or the functioning of your IP phone.
  5. Manage parental control settings from any device, either smart phone, tablet or your laptop pc.
  6. Unlimited user/device specific white list/black list overrides.

What makes pcWRT different?

Nowadays every wireless router comes with some kind of parental control feature, with varying degrees of usability and effectiveness.

We believe pcWRT offers the best well-rounded balance between control, usability and effectiveness. We aimed to create a solution that parents love but children don't hate. We want to control the contents made available to children but not so much so that it inhibits usability. We want to block the ways that such controls can be bypassed, but we don't want parents to get a computer science degree in order to do that. Here's a short list of pcWRT's unique features:

Please take a look at our demo site to see how the router management UI works: http://demo.pcwrt.com

What we've accomplished, and what's coming up

Why we need your support

We believe that pcWRT is the most flexible and easy to use wireless router for parents to manage their home networks. Compared to similar products on the market, it is also the most affordable. Our mission is to make it available to all parents who are concerned about their children's online experience. Currently the core product is completed and is working on hardware provided by our OEM partner. In order to start mass production, we need to raise $25,000 so that our OEM partner can start producing the first batch.

Router Spec

  • CPU: 580Mhz
  • SPI Flash: 8MB
  • SDRAM: 64MB
  • 100Mbps wired Ethernet ports (4 LAN + 1 Internet)
  • Wireless: 802.11n 2T/2R (2x2:2) 2.4 GHz 300Mbps
  • Wireless Security: WPA-PSK, WPA2-PSK, TKIP, AES

Risks & Challenges

We are passionate about what we are doing and we are confident that we can get it done right. Therefore, it is only reasonable that we shoulder most of the risks for this project.

To boost your confidence level, we are going to ship 25 units to our backers during the campaign window. We are hoping that these 25 supporters will act as our advocates and provide live feedback during the campaign. Immediately after the campaign, we'll ship an additional 100 units. By doing this, we are hoping that any concerns that our supporters might have will be addressed early on, and that all our supporters will be happy when we finally deliver the product into their hands.

Other Ways You Can Help

We do understand that sometimes backing may not be the best option for you, and we appreciate any other help you would generously be willing to offer. In particular, please help us spread the word:
  • Use Indiegogo tools to share this campaign with friends
  • "Like" us on Facebook, "Follow" us on Twitter
  • Forward links of this campaign to friends
  • Any other means you can think of is also deeply appreciated
story_txt:
What is pcWRT?
 pcWRT is an OpenWrt based wifi router. It comes with solid parental control tools to protect children on your home network.
What can you do with pcWRT parental control?
Unlike parental control software that you have to install and configure on each and every device, pcWRT provides a centralized place from where you can manage your children's Internet access. With pcWRT, you configure the rules once at the router and all devices connected to your wifi network are protected - computers, smartphones, tablets, even game consoles with built-in browsers.Here are some examples of what you can do:

Block pornography and other undesirable content with OpenDNS or Norton ConnectSafe.
Prevent inappropriate images from showing up in Google search by enforcing SafeSearch.
Limit children's time on social networking and video sites such as Facebook, Instagram and Youtube, while allowing unlimited time for school related sites.
Turn off Internet at night for children only, with no impact on parent's Internet access or the functioning of your IP phone.

Manage parental control settings from any device, either smart phone, tablet or your laptop pc.
Unlimited user/device specific white list/black list overrides.


What makes pcWRT different?
Nowadays every wireless router comes with some kind of parental control feature, with varying degrees of usability and effectiveness.
We believe pcWRT offers the best well-rounded balance between control, usability and effectiveness. We aimed to create a solution that parents love but children don't hate. We want to control the contents made available to children but not so much so that it inhibits usability. We want to block the ways that such controls can be bypassed, but we don't want parents to get a computer science degree in order to do that. Here's a short list of pcWRT's unique features:

Please take a look at our demo site to see how the router management UI works: http://demo.pcwrt.com
  
What we've accomplished, and what's coming up




  Why we need your support We believe that pcWRT is the most flexible and easy to use wireless router for parents to manage their home networks. Compared to similar products on the market, it is also the most affordable. Our mission is to make it available to all parents who are concerned about their children's online experience. Currently the core product is completed and is working on hardware provided by our OEM partner. In order to start mass production, we need to raise $25,000 so that our OEM partner can start producing the first batch.


Router Spec



CPU: 580Mhz
SPI Flash: 8MB
SDRAM: 64MB
100Mbps wired Ethernet ports (4 LAN + 1 Internet)
Wireless:  802.11n 2T/2R (2x2:2) 2.4 GHz 300Mbps
Wireless Security: WPA-PSK, WPA2-PSK, TKIP, AES

Risks & Challenges We are passionate about what we are doing and we are confident that we can get it done right. Therefore, it is only reasonable that we shoulder most of the risks for this project. 
To boost your confidence level, we are going to ship 25 units to our backers during the campaign window. We are hoping that these 25 supporters will act as our advocates and provide live feedback during the campaign. Immediately after the campaign, we'll ship an additional 100 units. By doing this, we are hoping that any concerns that our supporters might have will be addressed early on, and that all our supporters will be happy when we finally deliver the product into their hands.
  Other Ways You Can HelpWe do understand that sometimes backing may not be the best option for you, and we appreciate any other help you would generously be willing to offer. In particular, please help us spread the word:
Use Indiegogo tools to share this campaign with friends

"Like" us on Facebook, "Follow" us on Twitter
Forward links of this campaign to friends
Any other means you can think of is also deeply appreciated

story:
***Please note that the video I've uploaded is to just give you an idea of what I hope to do.***

There's a man, dressed all in black, who you may have seen wondering round the town of St Peter Port. His name is Wesley. He is a kind man with a warm heart. Someone who needs our help. I'm setting this page up in the hope of helping him get back on his feet. The money raised here will go towards food, water, new clothes and anything else to help him get a job, find a place to stay and find hope for the future. Of course he doesn't know I'm doing this, so it's going to be a surprise!

For those who wish to know, he came from the UK and having moved around different bins and hostels, he's decided to not only move here, but wishes to permanently live here. He's had a lot of help from different businesses and people in town, which has no doubt helped a lot, but needs something more.

So I hope you can all help towards raising some money. Let's change this guys life around!

P.S. I'm not going to force the money onto him. So if he for whatever reason chooses not to accept the money or if after speaking to more people, it turns out that money isn't the answer, (baring in mind I don't plan to just hand it over to him), then it will go to the local homeless charities and business that help him and others.

story:
What is Central Florida NORML?


The National Organization for the Reform of Marijuana Laws (NORML) since 1970 has fought to reform marijuana laws in America.  Central Florida NORML is a grassroots, non-profit 501(c)(4) organization dedicated to reforming the draconian marijuana laws in Florida and our nation.  CFL NORML fights for safe access and the rights of patients and responsible cannabis users.  At our core, we are a civil rights organization on the front lines fighting everyday for hard working Americans.

      


Why We Need Your Support

Last election cycle, voters in Florida had the opportunity to weigh-in on a medical marijuana initiative known as Amendment 2.  Falling just short of the 60% of votes needed to adopt the measure, the people looked to the Florida Legislature for reform.  In two years, the Florida Legislature has failed to pass meaningful medical marijuana laws.  After a long and hard year collecting petitions through unbearable sun and torrential rain, medical marijuana is back on the ballot.  Voters this November will have the opportunity to once again vote for medical marijuana.

However, eighty years of Prohibition is not going to end without a fight.  The Opposition and their prohibitionist allies have seen a surge of campaign funding.  And, this election cycle, Opposition leadership has vowed to spend over $10 million dollars to defeat medical marijuana in Florida. 

With your support, and the power of Indiegogo crowdfunding, we hope to level the playing field.  The insurmountable Opposition war chest can be overcome in this battle by your contribution.  Whether your contribution be big or small, together we can defeat the prohibitionist forces that seek to continue unjust and inhumane policies against suffering patients across Florida.

                          


How We Can Help Together

CFL NORML's vision is to bring together the cannabis industry under one roof.  Your contribution will allow us find a permanent home for CFL NORML featuring a special area for patients to share their stories and industry partners to collaborate and advocate for patient-centric regulations.  Other proceeds from the campaign will go towards purchasing television ads to combat the opposition's propaganda and lies.  And, of course, funds will be used to alleviate the struggles of patients and veterans here in Florida. 


Your Impact

By contributing to our Indiegogo campaign you'll help us fund patient advocacy and public education about the benefits of cannabis therapy.  You and your voice will be joined with thousands of others all across this nation in fighting back against the Opposition and their propaganda.  Yet, may ask yourself why does this matter?

We all know someone affected by the ravages of cancer, seen loved ones slip away due to Alzheimer's and Dementia, watch as they fight seizure after seizure due to epilepsy, or even see a veteran suffer in silence as they relieve past battles brought on by PTSD.

Your contribution gives voice to their struggle and will ensure an end to the injustice inflicted by prohibition.


Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can contribute, but all can help by:

  • Spreading the word about our Indiegogo Campaign on Social Media

  • Visit www.CFLNORML.org to stay up to date with the movement

  • Become a member of CFL NORML

  • Start a CFL NORML council in your local community

  • And of course, register to vote, and VOTE YES ON 2!


Follow us on Facebook at CentralFLNORML or on Twitter and Instagram @CFLNORML

story:
There is an employment paradox in the United States. Many millions of jobs go unfilled at the same time that many millions of job seekers struggle to find living wage employment.

For many thousands of the homeless, chronically poor, or returning ex-offenders, finding and maintaining living-wage employment is an uphill struggle.  It is extremely difficult for most to overcome the social stigma that employers often feel and deploy when screening these applicants.

At the same time, in 2012 there were 1.7 million jobs that went unfilled in the U.S. In 2014 that number rose to almost 3 million. By the year 2020 the number of unfilled jobs is expected to surpass 5 million.  The cost to our economy for these unfilled positions is figured at $160 billion per year. 

This paradox is causing many employers to move away from looking only at people with a specific set of hard skills and experience, and are first assessing candidates’ attitudes and behaviors to find the right ‘fit’ and then training them for their available jobs. Those companies look carefully at the soft skill traits of their current, proven top performers, then come up with a profile of who is most likely to succeed, and hire people who match the profile, even if their hard skills and experience aren’t ideal.

Racine Vocational Ministry, Inc. (RVM),  a 13-yr. old non-profit organization located in Racine County Wisconsin, is seeking $17,500 to pilot a six-month project that will determine if employability can be improved for chronically unemployed, homeless and ex-offenders through the use of ‘proven’ soft skill assessment tools.

These assessment tools, such as those developed by Profiles International, are well-established and used by thousands of employers worldwide to determine how well job candidates ‘fit’ specific job opportunities. Funds will be used to purchase an assessment system along with the inventory necessary to assess forty pilot project participants.

The project will offer employers a free assessment report that compares the individual’s compatibility with performance benchmarks that are established by the employer. This objective data will hopefully outweigh the negative perceptions that comes with being chronically unemployed.

Donors will receive a copy of the project’s results upon request. For more detail about Racine Vocational Ministry please see RVMRacine.org.

story:
Hola a tod@s,
como muchos de vosotros ya sabéis, somos un bar cultural que se encuentra en la Plaza de Montesión, en Sevilla.
Desde hace un par de años realizamos muchos eventos socio-culturales como los martes de cocina mexicana y Jam session de blues, los miércoles comida italiana y espectáculo de magia, los jueves Sushi para cenar y jam artística, conciertos todos los fines de semana... y también hemos apostado por el circo y las actividades para los niños.
Todo el barrio participa de manera directa e indirecta en los eventos , nos ayudamos entre todos, también en el trabajo, eso hace que el Kilo de Higos no sea  solo un bar sino también un lugar y un espacio social y cultural donde se desarollan los proyectos de la gente del barrio.
Esta campaña se  debe  al  cierre temporal y "forzado" del local por papeleo en lo que, nuestros arquitectos ,estan trabajando ya. Todo esto tiene muchos gastos, el alquiler del bar es lo mas importante para volver a nuestro proyecto lo mas pronto posible.
Gracias a vuestra ayuda podremos continuar con todo lo que implica el Kilo de Higos: amor, diversión, cultura, música, arte y trabajo para y por el barrio!!
Lo que necesitamos es llegar a 600 euros, que es por lo menos un mes de alquiler de los tres  (o mas..), tiempo que permanecerà el Kilo cerrado.
Al final de la campaña regaleremos a todos un cd de musica con los conciertos del bar, con varias grabaciones también hechas en nuestro programa radio "De kilo en kilo" de Trompeta Verde Radio!!!
Si no conseguimos llegar a la cantidad de dinero que hemos puesto como objetivo ,de igual modo ayudarán al mismo fin.

Llevamos cerrados desde hace casi un mes pero a los pocos dias, de lo que pasó ,nos reunimos el Kilo con su familia y amigos para buscar soluciones ,De allí surgió la idea de llevar los eventos culturales a otros espacios creando el mismo ambiente de nuestro bar para poder seguir, de una forma única y social, el proyecto del Kilo de higos.

Pedimos a tod@s nuestros amigos el difundir y compartir nuestra iniciativa!!!
Al abrir tendremos una fantástica inauguración donde os invitaremos también a una paellita!!!

story:
العربية     עברית     

Our Roots are Far-Reaching, and Our Vision is Big

Northwest Compassionate Communication is invested in mentoring a network of families in the Middle East who can contribute to a culture of peace and nonviolence in their region. This summer, we have the opportunity to leverage our 11 years of experience in transforming families into peacemakers by bringing together at our Vashon Island Nonviolent Communication Family Camp—for the first time ever!—teams that include Jewish Israelis, Arab Palestinian Israeli citizens and West Bank Palestinians. Our intentions are to provide the conditions for connection, understanding, team building, mentorship and program development for three Middle East Nonviolent Communication family camps: one in Israel, one in the West Bank and, ultimately, a co-hosted NVC Israeli-Palestinian family camp.

Why Nonviolent Communication?

Nonviolent Communication (NVC) is a practice that assumes people are compassionate by nature, and that many violent behaviors—verbal, or physical—are a result of judgmental ways of thinking, taught by and upheld in our cultures. NVC also assumes that we all share the same, basic, human needs, and that everything we say and do in life is a strategy to meet those needs. It helps people find creative ways for all of us to get our needs met, without the use of guilt, shame, blame, coercion or threats. 

“With its focus on feelings and universal human needs, the practice of NVC stimulates deeper understanding of ourselves and others and provides a compassionate way to relate to one another, even in the face of conflict.”
—Marshall Rosenberg, Ph.D., Creator of Nonviolent Communication

Planting Our Garden in Three Phases

There are currently nine Nonviolent Communication family camps around the world. We, Center for Nonviolent Communication-Certified Trainers Barbara Larson, Douglas Dolstad and Elana Sabajon, started Vashon Island Family Camp with youth educator, Maren Metke, 11 years ago. Our camp gave rise to the creation of four other family camps in the U.S.

Together, with your support, we're already nurturing such seeds in the Middle East. Our plan involves three phases, one of which we completed last year:

  • Phase 1 (2014): Thanks to your contributions, our first Palestinian partner for peace, Azzam Talhami, joined us at Vashon Island Family Camp! He works with the West Bank team to plan their camp back home. 
  • Phase 2 (2015): Azzam will return to camp, along with eight committed and inspired members of NVC family camp teams in Israel and Palestine. (Click on the "Gallery" tab at the top of the page to see their pics.)
  • Phase 3 (2015-2018): Establishment of the first ever NVC family camps in the Middle East (Israel, the West Bank and then a combined camp).

Above: Kristen Jawad and Pam Orbach connecting with and learning
from our Palestinian partner, Azzam Talhami, at Vashon Island in 2014.
Photo by Jeff Birkner.

Phase 2: Camp in the Puget Sound this August

Four members of an Israeli team and four members of a Palestinian team will join us as we live a 12-day, all-encompassing, NVC experience. Over the past few years, these eight have been attending annual, nine-day Nonviolent Communication immersion workshops for Israeli and Palestinian adults, together. That's where inspiration struck them to create the first ever, combined Israeli-Palestinian NVC family camp.

Northwest Compassionate Communication regards NVC family camps as unique and fertile ground for giving rise to a next generation of skilled peacemakers. Opportunities to practice the principles and skills of peace continually emerge, and the community supports conflict mediation, healing, empathy and honest sharing. And when families—especially children—play, live, learn and relate compassionately with one another at camp, they cultivate deep, lasting connections.

Your investment will make it possible for four Israeli and four Palestinian team members to:
  • Participate in an NVC family camp for the very first time.
  • Learn the ropes of planning, setting up, running and evaluating their own family camps.
  • Create the cross-cultural team bond they need to work together.
  • Camp in tents in the fields, forests, orchards and organic gardens of our 26-acre Cedar Spring Farm on Vashon Island—just a ferry ride from Seattle.
  • Connect with American and international families—from babes in arms to grandparents. (Many return to our camp, year after year, and even travel to visit each other between camps!)
  • Experience workshops, projects, crafts, theatre and nature adventures that weave concrete peacemaking principles and skills into their fabric.
  • Debrief with the Vashon leadership team.
Thanks to you, they'll also take home:
  • Our long-term commitment to mentor them through the first year of organizing their camps. (With the hope of attending their first camps to make sure they have immediate support.)
  • Venue, logistical and staffing considerations.
  • Budgeting, fundraising and program support.
  • A wealth of supporting documents.
  • Connections to a global web of skilled support.

Your support is vital!

We’re excited and humbled to take what we’ve developed and use it to offer a real, tangible way to contribute to compassionate change for the future of our world’s children. If you, too, can see the possibilities, please become a partner for peace with us, and contribute whatever amount would most inspire you.

  • $25,000: the total cost of bringing over and hosting eight NVC team members from Israel and Palestine
  • $2,200: Travel and incidental costs, per person
  • $600: Camp tuition and meals for one
  • Please consider supporting one partner for peace at $2,800!
Please let us know if your employer offers matching gifts.


Regarding our financial goal:
  • Up to 10.75% of your online contribution will be used to cover gift processing fees (less if we meet or exceed our goal).
  • Fundraising work is being done by volunteers.
  • Any dollars we raise above what we need to host participants will be split between general scholarships (to help provide a rich, multi-cultural camp experience) and Phase 3 costs associated with planning and hosting camps in the Middle East.
  • If we don't meet our goal, we'll host as many team members as we can, with what we have.
  • The more team members we host, the deeper the learning, shared understanding and cohesion in their teams, and the more successful their camps back home!
  • We can not guarantee that all team members will receive the Visas and permissions needed to make the journey.

Other Ways to Contribute

Please send any amount, large or small, to:

Northwest Compassionate Communication
11205 SW Corbin Beach Rd., #2
Vashon Island, WA 98070

Make checks out to Northwest Compassionate Communication and note "Israel/Palestine Scholarship." Gifts are tax-deductible.

Just can't make a financial contribution?
Please use your voice and Indiegogo's sharing tools to spread the word to anyone in your community that's passionate about peace and nonviolence!

THANK YOU!     شكرا     תודה 


Links

  • Northwest Compassionate Communication
  • Vashon Island NVC Family Camp
  • Vashon Island NVC Family Camp documentary short, "Doing Love"
  • Center for Nonviolent Communication

Our plan involves three phases, one of which we completed last year:
Phase 1 (2014): Thanks to your contributions, our first Palestinian partner for peace, Azzam Talhami, joined us at Vashon Island Family Camp! He works with the West Bank team to plan their camp back home. 
Phase 2 (2015): Azzam will return to camp, along with eight committed and inspired members of NVC family camp teams in Israel and Palestine. (Click on the "Gallery" tab at the top of the page to see their pics.)
Phase 3 (2015-2018): Establishment of the first ever NVC family camps in the Middle East (Israel, the West Bank and then a combined camp).

Above: Kristen Jawad and Pam Orbach connecting with and learning from our Palestinian partner, Azzam Talhami, at Vashon Island in 2014. Photo by Jeff Birkner.

Phase 2: Camp in the Puget Sound this August


Four members of an Israeli team and four members of a Palestinian team will join us as we live a 12-day, all-encompassing, NVC experience. Over the past few years, these eight have been attending annual, nine-day Nonviolent Communication immersion workshops for Israeli and Palestinian adults, together. That's where inspiration struck them to create
the first ever, combined Israeli-Palestinian NVC family camp.
Northwest Compassionate Communication regards NVC family camps as unique and fertile ground for giving rise to a next generation of skilled peacemakers. Opportunities to practice the principles and skills of peace continually emerge, and the community supports conflict mediation, healing, empathy and honest sharing. And when families—especially
children—play, live, learn and relate compassionately with one another at camp, they
cultivate deep, lasting connections.

Your investment will make it possible for four Israeli and four Palestinian team members to:
Participate in an NVC family camp for the very first time.
Learn the ropes of planning, setting up, running and evaluating their own family camps.
Create the cross-cultural team bond they need to work together.
Camp in tents in the fields, forests, orchards and organic gardens of our 26-acre Cedar Spring Farm on Vashon Island—just a ferry ride from Seattle.
Connect with American and international families—from babes in arms to grandparents. (Many return to our camp, year after year, and even travel to visit each other between camps!)
Experience workshops, projects, crafts, theatre and nature adventures that weave concrete peacemaking principles and skills into their fabric.

Debrief with the Vashon leadership team.

Thanks to you, they'll also take home:
Our long-term commitment to mentor them through the first year of organizing their camps. (With the hope of attending their first camps to make sure they have immediate support.)

Venue, logistical and staffing considerations.
Budgeting, fundraising and program support.
A wealth of supporting documents.
Connections to a global web of skilled support.


Your support is vital!
We’re excited and humbled to take what we’ve developed and use it to offer a real, tangible way to contribute to compassionate change for the future of our world’s children. If you, too, can see the possibilities, please become a partner for peace with us, and contribute whatever amount would most inspire you.


$25,000: the total cost of bringing over and hosting eight NVC team members from Israel and Palestine

$2,200: Travel and incidental costs, per person

$600: Camp tuition and meals for one
Please consider supporting one partner for peace at $2,800! 
Please let us know if your employer offers matching gifts.

Regarding our financial goal:
Up to 10.75% of your online contribution will be used to cover gift processing fees (less if we meet or exceed our goal).
Fundraising work is being done by volunteers.

Any dollars we raise above what we need to host participants will be split between general scholarships (to help provide a rich, multi-cultural camp experience) and Phase 3 costs associated with planning and hosting camps in the Middle East.
If we don't meet our goal, we'll host as many team members as we can, with what we have. 

The more team members we host, the deeper the learning, shared understanding and cohesion in their teams, and the more successful their camps back home!
We can not guarantee that all team members will receive the Visas and permissions needed to make the journey.







  Other Ways to Contribute
 
Please send any amount, large or small, to:
Northwest Compassionate Communication11205 SW Corbin Beach Rd., #2Vashon Island, WA 98070
Make checks out to Northwest Compassionate Communication and note "Israel/Palestine Scholarship." Gifts are tax-deductible.
Just can't make a financial contribution?Please use your voice and Indiegogo's sharing tools to spread the word to anyone in your community that's passionate about peace and nonviolence!THANK YOU!     شكرا      תודה  


Links


Northwest Compassionate Communication
Vashon Island NVC Family Camp
Vashon Island NVC Family Camp documentary short, "Doing Love"
Center for Nonviolent Communication

story:
The Momentum Dryer is TRULY REVOLUTIONARY!! 

The Momentum Dryer is the first real enhancement in the process of getting your hair dried with a hooded hair dryer. I looked up some of the older and more recent hair dryer units after I patented the Momentum Dryer and discovered that the way hair is dried with those units HAS NOT CHANGED AT ALL. Hot air is still being forced down into the breathing space of users and the comfort of the user is secondary to the drying of the hair. Besides, most kids and adults can't endure 30 minutes under these hair dryers without getting up and walking around to get some relief. 

The Momentum Dryer's engineering group is anxious to help bring this to life. From enhanced structural integrity on each screw position to well set steps in production to simplify production and streamline the manufacturing process, we will deliver a simply superior product.


DETAILS

If you incorporate excellence at every pivotal point, you reduce and eliminate negative potential in production. Quality in leads to quality outcome. The Momentum Dryer, truly, takes the user's comfort and drying experience to heart.

With injection molded products, the biggest obstacles occur in creation of the molds. Having the molds engineered with quality at the forefront of all calculations, we can ensure proper production, which will extend the life of molds and maximize the efficiency of all pieces that comprise the production process. Cost are kept low by streamlining the steps in production.

Keeping all expectations, realistic allows us to under promise and over deliver. Using a manufacturer that is already experienced in making hooded hair dryers, allows their expertise to be utilized in this new design. The changes incorporated by the Momentum Dryer are simple and easily achievable. Using the same materials as other hair dryers and only changing the air direction, allows manufacturers to operate in a comfort zone.

story:
Short Summary

Burning Nest radio is coming live. This year let people hear your voice, your ideas, your inspiration!

Burning Nest Radio is an art & communication project based on the 10 principles of Burning Man. We plan to broadcast community created radio for 6 days at Nest festival, the official UK regional burn running from the 21-26 May. Nest is an inclusive and uplifting six day celebration of art, education & music inspired by Burning Man. As a non-profit organised & run entirely by volunteers, Nest is a place for radical self-expression, discovery and acceptance held in our very own beautiful valley in West Glamorgan, South Wales.

Burning Nest Radio hopes to perform a valuable function for the 460 attendees, both informing on useful information and providing an opportunity for people to collaborate & reach out to others with their own brand of self-expression.

What is Burning Nest Radio?

Its a short-term licensed radio station broadcasting for the duration of Nest with 100% of content created by, and for, attendees. Content will depend entirely on what people want to do, we rely on the community to participate and create a schedule of music, talk, comedy, and whatever else there is inspiration to create. Burning Nest Radio will be broadcasting 24/7 for 6 days, so 144 hours of content provided by you for you. At this point it isn't possible to say what will be broadcast, but we trust the burner community & expect a wide variety. We can quickly make a list of what you can expect:

* Music of course : all kinds and all tastes will be satisfied, and our favourite DJs at Nest will also be part of the program. The opportunity to present a radio show and select the music is open to all – just volunteer - so there'll be a wide range to suit all tastes. If you want to do a show featuring Ethiopian Dubstep, Country & Western Grindcore or just random tunes step forward & take the opportunity.

* Information : a weather forecast, announcements of planned events, workshops & other impromptu occurrences, together with sudden changes to planned events, information on the 10 principles of burning man and other useful things.

* Talk : talk shows, radio workshops, interviews, drama. Whatever people want to create, the burner community is full of creativity, imagination and variety & we hope to give you – yes YOU - the chance to express yourself & share with a wider audience.

* Community Assistance : advertising for car sharing, important lost & found announcements, whatever else people need to know.


What We Need & What You Get

We'll be operating as an official, licensed short-term radio station and to ensure we're acting within the law need to have OFCOM licences (both Wireless Telegraphy Act Licence & Broadcasting Act Licence) which are around £600.

We also have to pay the Performing Rights Society & Phonographic Performance Ltd who pay royalties to artists, musicians, songwriters & composers for any music played. This is around £550. In addition there is equipment to obtain and other incidental costs. We're very fortunate to be able to borrow most equipment & to have an Art Grant from Nest which covers part of the cost but we still need to raise £800 (asking for £875 due to Indiegogo fees) which is why we're doing this Indiegogo campaign and asking for your generous gifts.

Burning Nest Radio, like Nest, is non-profit run by volunteers and no one is paid. If we end up collecting more money than we need the surplus will be donated to Nest to defray the cost of the event or to support Nest for next year.

Our perks are all involving the radio station, we're not spending money to create tacky little give-away geegaws as we want to use it to create a great radio station, a vehicle for peoples creativity & self-expression & a public service to the Burner/Nest community.


Risks & Challenges

We're broadcasting on the radio so everything we put out there will be available not just to those on-site but anyone within range on the right frequency, also by law all broadcasts have to be recorded and kept for 42 days. As such we might have to exercise a little discretion in what's broadcast though throughout freedom of expression is the key principle for us... with love, respect & fun of course.

That said it's an opportunity too as anyone can pick up our broadcast & get introduced to what we're doing & the great spirit & enthusiasm of our community. Throughout this platform will be in the hands of those with ideas, creativity & a desire to participate. It'll be YOUR tool for fun, for love, for pleasure, for information, for inspiration…

One definite challenge is scheduling & PLANNING. If you've ever been to a burner event you'll know about 'burner time' – things don't always happen when they're expected to, plans change, no one looks at a watch. That's something we just need to be flexible about. We'll put a schedule in place, but we'll be adaptable. If you pledge money and are due a reward, like your own show, we will give you priority & aim to find a suitable time.

Our main challenge is providing 6 days of content.

BUT the community is the answer, The BNR team trust the Burning Man community to provide a varied, exciting & fun range of broadcasts to suit all tastes.

Even if you cannot give as much money as you wish, don't be discouraged: volunteer your time & creativity. We'll consider everyone & try to give you the opportunity to broadcast, we do have 144 hours to fill so there should a good chance of your voice spreading around Port Talbot and the world.

There is no problem, only a solution and the solution is YOU.

So get involved pledge to support us or contact us to volunteer & create content for everyone to enjoy.

contact : Burning Nest Radio on facebook
e mail : BurningNestRadio@gmail.com

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Hey there; I'm Holly (that's me, on the left, up there ^). Welcome to my IndieGoGo campaign page. 

I started my local food journey in 2007 when my daughter, then 16, told me she was going to become a vegetarian after watching PETA videos all night. Instead of opting out of meat, we opted in to the local food movement and started purchasing our beef, pork, poultry and seafood from ranchers and fisherfolks living within a 25 miles radius of our home.

In 2008 my passion for small, independent farmers and food producers was ignited when I helped start a farmers market in our rural community on the Key Peninsula. For two years I managed that market, wrote a weekly newsletter, and engaged people in an active discussion around the benefits of eating fresh, whole foods grown by our neighbors.

My local food education continued when I added management of a suburban farmers market in Bremerton, joined the Washington State Farmers Market Association board, and participated with the Tahoma Food Policy Coalition.

In 2010, I co-founded the Fresh Food Revolution Co-op and managed the business until May 2014. During my tenure membership grew to 125 family/member-owners, we processed 50 orders a week during the peak season, and offered products from 33 growers, 2 dairies, 3 ranchers, 1 fisherman, and 13 food producers. Pierce Conservation District honored me with the "2011 Commercial Farmer of the Year" award for creating the FFR Co-op and providing local farmers and food producers with a viable, year round market for their goods.

At heart I am a community organizer, idea generator and implementor, have interests in cooperative development, local food and family farming, gift economies, time banks, diversity, inclusion, kids, families, empowering people, and being good to each other.

So what's this campaign all about? It's definitely about bringing quality, locally produced food, personal care and household items to the historic Freighthouse Station Marketplace in Tacoma's Dome District - where locals and travelers mingle, entrepreneurs run awesome shops and restaurants (you can find everything from enormous cinnamon rolls to Seahawks gear, afternoon tea, fish and chips, and almost every international cuisine you can think of), and the merchants are like a family.

Enter Hollyhock Mercantile, an old fashioned general store meets a farmers market; where you'll know the names, history, and location of every person who makes, grows, or produces every item on every shelf. 

Great things are coming to Freighthouse... and we want Hollyhock Mercantile to be one of them. Not only will the South Sound have access to variety of beautiful, delicious, and sustainable foods available in one location, commuters will be able to pick up weekly CSA boxes on their way home, and soon Amtrak travelers will have the opportunity to take with them boxed lunches filled with these regional treats.

We'll stock everything from coffee, tea, and pastries to beef jerky, candy, and snacks, and even some on-the-go meal options as well as regular grocery items like flour, milk, butter, eggs, cheese, meat, seafood, ice cream, honey, herbs and spices, fruit, vegetables, flowers, bath and personal care products. 

Local producers are enthusiastically embracing the mercantile's mission to not only showcase their goods, but to educate and inform the public on the best way to use ingredients (food demos! tastings! recipe cards!) and provide access to the good food for all members of our community.

Your contribution towards this campaign helps make Hollyhock Mercantile a reality! You'll be giving me the opportunity to grow a new local food venture; one that aims to provide not only that wondrous connection between people and our food providers, but also allows me to offer a living wage to employees, and helps in furthering to strengthen our community.


The funds we raise via this campaign literally launches the Hollyhock Mercantile, from the ground up. We're fortunate to have a space inside Freighthouse Station Marketplace awaiting our arrival, conveniently located on the platform side of the building, with two windows facing the trains.

The mercantile is already rolling right along thanks to an incredible team of friends who have donated their time and materials to help create this community mercantile. My brother is designing the floor plan, a wood floor has been donated, stationary and moveable display shelving units will be built by friends from Tacoma and Seattle, and I bet we'll host a painting party, or two.

As for the nitty gritty, here's what we need to open the mercantile:



The costs of hosting the campaign, the credit card fees, and the perks costs shown above are the totals if all Perks levels completely sell out. So don't let those numbers scare you too much. We need 35K to open the store and about 10K to cover the costs of running the campaign. If we meet the 45K goal, IndieGoGo will refund 5% of the campaign hosting fees.

If, perchance, our campaign goes viral and all those Perks levels sell out, they will generate 76K in estimated profit (that's 103K gross, less the 27K cost estimate). So it does work out in the end.

What you get for your contribution, besides the satisfaction of helping me realize this dream, is a fantastic selection of Perks ranging from shout outs on our Facebook page, to a reusable tote or organic T-shirt with our logo (screen printed by a local artisan), food donations for low income families, to swanky parties for you and a few friends (parties you do not have to clean up after... can't beat that). We're pretty sure you'll find something fun to suit your budget and support the mercantile. 

If we're missing a Perk level at which you want to participate let us know and we might be able to build one to suit your needs! Maybe we'll even let you name the level. How's that for a perk? :) 

~ * ~ * ~

We're particularly excited to offer perk options to help our lower income friends and neighbors. For $150, the Community Hug, we will donate a box of non-perishable local food items to Northwest Harvest Food Bank in your name - this is our Featured Perk. 

At the $350 level, Team Member Deen (our Cook Extraordinaire) will prepare the Meal Time Helper - five healthy dinners, three breakfasts, and two snacks for each person in a four member, low income household in Pierce County.

~ * ~ * ~

If we don't reach our 45K fundraising goal, all monies raised will still go directly toward opening the Hollyhock Mercantile. We do have a priority list; for instance, purchasing equipment and any inventory requiring cold holding may need to be delayed until more funds are raised, donations and/or grants received to cover those expenses. 

Our community has already been extremely generous with their time, expertise, supplies, and enthusiasm; I have no doubt we will meet our goal, even if it takes a little longer than we'd like.


Hollyhock Mercantile is an incubator of small, independent food producers, providing a year-round, accessible market showcasing their unique products. The store may be small (about 275 sq. ft. of retail space), but I'm big on commitment to local, sustainable food systems. 

Finding these producers isn't easy for the average consumer, but is something I love doing... really, really love doing. I scout farmers markets, hunt down local food merchant guilds, surf independent farm organization webpages, cruise co-op shelves, and more. I am constantly on the hunt for new and wonderful producers. 

I also have a strong desire to make quality food accessible to all people, regardless of socio-economic status. In addition to offering EBT (food stamps) redemption in the mercantile, we plan to create a fund to make locally produced food more affordable, as well as provide healthy meal preparation assistance, for low income families (see our Stretch Goals below for details). 

~ * ~ * ~

You've heard of Stretch Goals, right? Think Exploding Kittens. If we exceed our 45K campaign funding goal we have two terrific projects we'd love to launch.

The first is modeled after the Fresh Bucks farmers market program in Seattle that doubles the buying power of SNAP/EBT customers for purchasing fruits and vegetables. Every dollar we raise between 45K- 50K will be set aside to seed our own version of Fresh Bucks, making the often more expensive locally produced food more accessible to low income individuals. 

Funds raised between 50K - 55K will be used to officially launch the second project, Team Member Deen's Meal Time Helper program, to continue offering meal preparation assistance to low income families in Pierce County. The idea is to prepare a week's worth of meals (breakfast, snacks, and dinner) for busy, working folks without the time, expertise, or financial ability to cook healthy meals for their families.

Development and funding for both of these programs will continue after our crowdfunding campaign concludes through special purchase days, community participation in fundraising activities, and grant requests.

The Hollyhock Mercantile will be a community store with a mission to educate, promote, and feed all the people.


It's my goal to open the doors to the Hollyhock Mercantile on June 1st - undoubtedly an ambitious goal. Fear not friends for there is magic afoot. 

Back in the late 1990's I managed a small LGBTQ book store and coffee shop in Santa Barbara, CA, getting it out of debt and well on its way to becoming sustainable, while serving a relatively small clientele base. That was my first opportunity to build strong support for a common goal - a resilient community.

When I started the Key Peninsula Farmers Market in 2008, I did it in two months time without any previous farmers market experience. That was a steep learning curve and the knowledge, skills, and connections I gathered up then help make this road to opening day that much easier... including an excellent working relationship with the health department.

My favorite way to overcome risks and challenges is by teaming up with others to pool our collective resources and ideas. The Hollyhock Mercantile isn't *my* store, it's OUR store. From the first moment I shared my idea for the mercantile, friends were offering their support, ideas, guidance, materials, and more. I'm very lucky to have a team of advisors and confidantes who have already proven the Hollyhock Mercantile  will be a success due to one simple concept: Together we are stronger.


I know not all of you can contribute financially to the crowd funding campaign, but that doesn't mean you can't us help reach our goal. 

One of the most important things you can do for the Hollyhock Mercantile is to share this campaign with your friends, family, co-workers, neighbors, colleagues... anyone you think would be interested in supporting us in supporting local farmers, food producers, and the artisanal community, contributing towards our goals of providing access to healthy food for everyone, and creating a healthier, more resilient community.

When you share our story remember to tell folks why the Hollyhock Mercantile is important to you. 

Perhaps you have a skill to offer, or an idea to implement, or a product you think would be great for the mercantile? We love in-kind contributions, too! Just send us an email using the link in the upper left corner of the campaign page, or post a comment using the link at the top of the page.

Stay in touch with us after the store opens by signing up for our newsletter: http://eepurl.com/bjFGr5.

When the Hollyhock Mercantile opens, come on down to visit us; buy something local and delicious to take home and savor. Make it a habit; we can promise you'll always find something amazing at the mercantile.


Here's the mock up of the reusable Hollyhock Mercantile tote available at the $25 High Five / Fist Bump and $50 Gold Star perk level. Because I'm a buy local, support independent businesses gal, it's being printed by Andy at NW Fan Gear in Puyallup, WA. You can buy his stuff at another shop in Freighthouse: Noble Trove.
