story:
Our Story:

Thank you for taking the time to read about our campaign! We are here to introduce to you the world’s first dating site and community forum. We cater to both medical and recreational marijuana users, giving them a social media platform and information/research center to connect with others who have common interests, while at the same time, making a love connection! Hempstersonly.com is a one of a kind dating and information platform providing love and social connections along with interesting articles, forums, and more!

For people in our community, being a marijuana user isn’t just an individual recreational habit, but is something embedded in our culture and our social life. In the process of sharing this lifestyle with a potential mate, telling someone that you smoke pot, even medically, can be a deal breaker. When this lifestyle is your life, it can be difficult to give it up for a relationship. Here at hempstersonly.com you won’t have to feel awkward in disclosing your preferences, and can find someone who shares the same interests, habits, and goals.

Impact:

We are working towards building a community of progressive, forward-thinking, educated and articulate marijuana users. We are dedicated to demolishing the stereotype that marijuana users are couch potatoes, uneducated “burn-outs” who waste their lives on an illicit drug. We are reaching out to marijuana-friendly people of all ages (adults), races, creeds, and sexual preferences.

Hempstersonly.com is unique to the dating sites out there for two reasons. For one, we focus exclusively on marijuana users, ensuring that our users can connect with others who are invested in the same lifestyle. In addition, our website goes above and beyond the current marijuana dating sites to provide orientations, articles, and blog news related to the status of the fight to legalize marijuana nationwide. We also welcome our users to become contributors to our community through an online forum about all aspects of life including political, romantic, and more!

As the use of marijuana becomes decriminalized across the country, more and more people are finding that they want to connect with others who share the same interests, without the judgement, criticism, and debate that can come along with explaining your choices to a new date. Hempsteronly.com can provide that safety net, where you can rest assured that our clients are all interested in similar hobbies and interests as you.

What We Need:

As a brand new website, we’re just in the final stages of getting everything online and ready for our first clients. We are very excited to share our new dating site with the world! We want to present it as a legit product, so we are offering the first 4,200 customers to join for free, including the first 4 months and 20 days FREE. This way we can give our clients 4,200 REAL choices, not filler, to connect with. Life is just too short to sort through profiles of people who don’t actually exist!

For our campaign we are aiming to raise $12,000 to get us through the first 4 months of providing FREE services to our new clients. We anticipate that our numbers will be at least twice that once we are fully operational after the first 4 months, which will give us a chance to earn back the money that went towards our new clients, and begin reaching out to thousands of people looking for love. Isn’t that what it’s all about?

So what are you waiting for? Find the perfect match! Register Now! To meet classic singles who are marijuana friendly. Start Dating Now!

Other Ways You Can Help:

If you can’t make a donation at this time, we understand that times are tough for everyone out there! But don’t fear! There are still ways you can help support our campaign! Please take a few minutes to share our information with your friends and family via social media, email, and through word of mouth!

With your generous donations we can go live with our first set of clients and make romantic dreams come true for thousands of dedicated marijuana enthusiasts!

Thank you in advance for your support and generous donations!

story:
HEMOS CONSEGUIDO NUESTRO OBJETIVO, A PARTIR DE AHORA CUALQUIER APORTACIÓN IRÁ DESTINADA A FUTURAS CAMPAÑAS.

GRACIAS A TODOS POR VUESTRA APORTACIÓN.

“Una pila para Ana” es un reto que emprendemos en “Proyecto | Tierra de Esperanza”. Reto en el cual, nuestra intención es de recaudar dinero para poder ayudar a Ana, una joven madre hondureña, la cual es viuda y madre de una niña pequeña llamada Chelito.

Nuestra intención es, con el dinero recaudado, el poder construirle a Ana y a su hija una pila donde poder almacenar el agua en condiciones óptimas para la salud de Ana y su hija Chelito.

Realmente solo necesitamos 0€ 235€ 310€ 380€ , pero en Indiegogo el monto debe ser como mínimo de 500€.

Os damos las gracias de antemano por colaborar.

Diego Moya [Fotodocumentalista]
“Proyecto | Tierra de Esperanza”

====================================================

WE HAVE GOT OUR GOAL, FROM NOW ANY CONTRIBUTION WILL GO TO FUTURE CAMPAIGNS.

THANK YOU ALL FOR YOUR CONTRIBUTION.

“Una pila para Ana” ("A tank for Ana") is a challenge we take on "Project | Land of Hope". Challenge in which our intention is to collect money to help Ana, a young Honduran mother, who is a widow and mother of a little girl named Chelito.

Our intention is, with the money collected, to build to Ana and his daughter a pile where they can store water in optimum conditions for the health of Ana and his daughter Chelito.

Really only we need 0€ 235€ 310€ 380€, but in Indiegogo the amount should be at least 500 €.

We thank you in advance for helping.

Diego Moya [Photodocumentalist]
"Project | Land of Hope"

story:
Hey good people!

I'm Jason, an organizer with BLM Chi. 

So. 

We all feel and witness the intense movement moment we are in right now. So many of us are shifting our understandings of what's at stake, what we really want, and what it looks like to affirm, protect and honor all Black Lives.

As Black organizers of cis experience, this is what lay heavy on our minds when we began to consider how we might move the brilliance and power of our Black Trans  siblings into the center of our work. Seldom do we take seriously the harrowing task of building safety for Black Lives through the lens of gender self-determination, or consider how our current framings of economic and labor struggle disregard the survival economy building Black Trans women have always innovated amidst crushing and oppressive  conditions.

We are only beginning to ask the questions: 

• What does it *really* mean to show up for and co-resist with Black Femmes and Trans Women, while honoring their labor (in all its forms)?

• How do we resist the criminalization of self-determined Black survival economies? 

• Though current estimates reveal that only 1 out of 10 of our incarcerated  folks do contract labor - through the Prison Industries Enhancement Certification Program (PIECP) and Federal Prison Industries - we know that these workers are compensated at less than half of the federal minimum wage. How can labor movement stakeholders show up for Black Trans Women captured in prisons and detention centers? To what extent can the labor union imperative bring safety and power to Black Trans Lives?  

With your support, we can begin to unpack these questions at our groundbreaking Townhall event: Black Trans Lives + Labor!!

You are needed ;-)

Thanks to the generosity of the Social Justice Initiative at UIC, we are convening this event in the Pop Up JUST Art Gallery! We do however, need to cover a few costs to make this evening all that it can be:

Our main line items include securing the catering from a reputed Black owned social enterprise, livestreaming services, event photography and a sound system. 

Convening an event about economic and labor organizing realities for Black Trans Women also means honoring the labor of their time, knowledge and experience with these issues. Our panel of speakers - Chicago based Black Trans leaders across grassroots organizations - will be receiving honorariums.

STAY TUNED for a few surprise perks as we roll them out later in the campaign!!

The Impact

BLACK TRANS LIVES is a **dedicated** campaign and issue area of BLM Chi! As our flagship event for this campaign, we aim to deepen the continuing work being done to expand our understandings of state *and* extrajudicial violence, and to grapple with what this means for labor and economic justice organizing today.

We know that this is severely unfunded work, particularly for Black Femmes and Trans Women organizing their own communities on these issues. We are urgently turning to **you** to "greenlight" this event and this work long term.

The reality is that this event cannot happen without your support. Your contribution will facilitate an intentional space for the self-determination of Black Trans Femmes and Women, Black Trans and Queer youth and Black low wage workers to flourish, manifesting much needed strategy building, knowledge production and action.

The chance we are taking on each other

Illinois Justice Foundation, our gracious fiscal sponsor, has agreed to receive contributions on behalf of this project.  Your donation will be restricted for use by this campaign only, and will be tax deductible to the fullest extent of the law.

We are honored to have received contributions and endorsements from many reputed labor unions and local constituency groups for this groundbreaking event. The Coalition of Black Trade Unionists are the first among a growing list of organizations have offered support.

Should we exceed our goal, all donations will go toward our restricted fund for activating community in service of BLACK TRANS LIVES.

No Coins?

We get it! Tag us @BLMChi by simply clicking the share buttons here.

Coming soon, there'll be more about live tweeting at the event.

We will need a few hands on deck to support with behind the scenes prep and cleanup on the day of the event.  If you can pitch in, please reach out via email with the subject line "VOLUNTEER"

WE MUST LOVE AND PROTECT EACH OTHER!! WE HAVE NOTHING TO LOSE BUT OUR CHAINS!!

story:
The problem

What do you believe is the single greatest challenge or problem of our existence? if you were to say: overpopulation, population, global warming, childhood obesity, marital infidelity,  corrupt politicians, etc.., you would probably be right. At Montabass Academy, our  take the position that the single greatest challenge of our existence is getting what we need, want, desire, crave, yearn and/or burn for. In other words, we believe that our existential problem is in solving how we get from where we are today (aka. here) to where we need and want to be tomorrow (aka. there). We believe that this has been the problem since the beginning for time.

Just think about it. When we are hungry, what happens? When we have the need for attention and care, what happens? When we have the desire for a better life, what happens? When we want material possessions, what happens? When we crave power and fame, what happens? When we yearn for the love of another, what happens? This list can go on and on. The point is that it does not matter what the “there” is.  The “there” can be as mundane as getting to work on time or as grand as finding a cure for cancer.  Because of this existential problem we are driven to try or execute a myriad of ways by which we will ultimately be successful. We only stop seeking fulfillment when we have succeeded in getting what we want or need.

That seems pretty straight forward right?  The sad reality, however, is that the vast majority of people are not succeeding in getting what they need, want or desire. Far too many family members, friends, and people that we have met in our lives struggle to actually achieve that which they set out to achieve. They tend to settle for what they feel is considered “success” not what they actually sought out to be “success”.  We have always been curious as to why. Why, when presented with comparable opportunities, are there individuals that seem to superbly capitalize on opportunities and overcome whatever obstacles, challenges or roadblocks put before them and succeed? While there are others who never show up, barely make it out the gate, give up along the way or simply never reach the pinnacle of their success.  Then there are individuals who attend every wealth and success seminar, read every book on the latest "secrets to success", and follow the "success gurus" on social media platforms, but again, never quite get there. 

Now, we are not defining success in money terms alone, but rather, the successful pursuit and attainment of any worthy goal.  And while we could probably speak generally about success and how to be successful, we are focusing specifically on 3 areas that we called the foundational areas our lives. That is success as an individual, success as a couple and success as a parent.  We called them foundational areas because research proves that success in one of all of these areas not only makes success easier to achieve in other areas of our lives, but also that the probability of peak success if almost guaranteed.

Existing Solutions

If you conducted a Google search on Personal Development and Success Training, you will get roughly 18+ Million hits. These hits undoubtedly include notable individuals and companies ranging from Napoleon Hill, Earl Nightingale,  Tony Robbins International, Landmark Forum, Eric Thomas, Les Brown, Brian Tracy International, plus an innumerable quantity of companies and individuals that all claim in one fashion or another to help individuals achieve various levels of personal, relationship and financial success.  Now, it is not our intention to examine and evaluate the effectiveness of the major programs in the marketplace.  Instead, we would like to share our experiences and the experiences of many of our friends and associates that have attended and been students of these programs and teachings. 

We are not going to minimize the huge positive impacts that many of these organizations and individuals have in the lives of everyday people.  For example, some are very powerful in getting individuals inspired and motivated for big changes and profound transformation; many programs help the participants develop a change in perspective sometimes leading to tremendous breakthroughs. Both Landmark and Life Spring Training come to mind here.  A number of programs also lead to the development of a number of new abilities and skills.  Moreover, many have an ancillary type benefits like forming new friendships and support groups, beginning a lifelong journey of self-reflection and improvement and simply being a better human being.

However, despite these huge benefits that cannot be denied, we have unfortunately experienced and witnessed a number of cons as well. For instance, some people feel that many of these organization tend to be cult like in nature. They tend to focus more on the personality of the founders rather than upon the soundness and ability to duplicate its teachings in a variety of situations and circumstances.  Many participants leave post event feeling inspired and motivated to take on the world, to change their lives or at the very least make some significant behavioral changes. This feeling however, is short lived with the attendees seeing or experiencing no lasting tangible differences in their lives.  A large percentage of these programs are more focused on providing information rather than the development of practical skills. Many times this overemphasis on knowledge leads to information overload with the program participants. Also, a number of programs lack any effective assessment or Gap-Analysis component.  This piece is critical for determining what “is” or “is not” working. Because once this is known, it is important that corrective action be taken on the spot to modify that which is not working and codify that which is working.  Many of these programs, unfortunately have little in the way of providing feedback loops. Finally, the teaching of some, not all but some, is not supported by rigorous research. 

Our Solution

At Montabass Academy, our aim is to fill this gap. We take an "applied science" approach to the study and realization of success and achievement.  We begin by  systemically examining the existing research on achievement to identify the critical problems that stop people from being successful as individuals, as couples and as parents.  We then identify the best in class solutions for solving those problems. Finally, we develop "seminars" and "workshops" that are designed to not only lead to a fundamental shift in perspective on success and achievement, but more importantly lead to the attainment of those repeatable and sustainable skills necessary for resolving those critical problems that impede success as an individual, a couple and as a parent.  

The Offering

The seminars and workshops that we  are designed and conducted differently from many of the alternatives in the marketplace. That is, while we understand how knowledge leads to a better awareness, understanding and perspective broadening, we know that knowledge alone is not enough to effectively solve the critical challenges of achieving that which we set out to achieve.  It is only when a person has develop the skills and executed those skills consistently is success more probable.  Thus while there will be a knowledge portion to each and every seminar and workshop, there will also be hands-on exercises and drills that will lead to the development of the necessary skills. But this is just the beginning. There will be a review and assessment portion to the course so that the student will know what is and is not working. Moreover, there will be a feedback mechanism so that action can be taken to continuing doing what is working and modify what is not working.

Where we are right now?

Whenever we share this story with others, we get comments like: Wow! That is incredible! Why didn't I think of that, and so on?  Thus, we know that it is a good business model conceptually; what we don’t know yet is if there is a willingness of potential customers to pay for the service.  

We have our general business plan outlined. We know what the core problem(s) that we will be seeking to solve are. We have a business model of how we will go about solving the defined marketplace problem. We have our website completed; we are promoting our business and getting the word out via our blog, Facebook, Twitter and LinkedIn pages. We have a few FREE introductory events scheduled.  There are, however, still a few things we still need to launch.

What else do we need?

We are looking to put together a small research team to help us put a model that we can scale.  We have certain needs like:

1.  Small  team for research and  development;

2.  Small team for marketing;

3.  Other research, marketing, HR and other legal needs;

How you can help?

Like any start up, cash is king. Thus, the first contribution that you can help with to build this model is cash. We need approximately $150K for startup costs that will cover both talent acquisition costs and other business startup and operational related costs.

To make this dream a reality, we need a small, yet passionate, team. While we can’t provide top pay for top researchers, we are looking to attract young and bright talent either still in school but at the senior level or newly graduates that have extensive research experience. We are hoping that they see this as an opportunity to work on real world problems while gaining real world experience. The money will be used for

1. Talent acquisition costs

- 3-4 new jobs in research and development and marketing.

2. Business operation costs:

-  Business formation;

- Marketing and promotion;

- Research;

- Seminar and workshop hosting;

- Legal costs;


Perks:

Now we are not looking for simply donation. We are not asking to get something for nothing.  With your  contribution, you’ll get to choose from a variety of items, called “perks” on Indiegogo.   To keep things fresh and interesting, we may add new perks throughout the campaign.  At certain levels, we will be offering advertising opportunities as part of our workshop hand-out material for other businesses -- a great opportunity to feature your business while supporting ours!  Be sure to check in from time to time.

Can't donate right now?

Even if you, personally, can't donate...we are sure you know someone who can. Won't you please share this with your social media world? Link to  us on Facebook, Twitter and LinkedIn.  Or simply share the Indiegogo campaign with your own community - use all the social media buttons every time we send you an update. Finally talk to everyone you meet about our project if you believe that it is a great project to shout about!
story_txt:
The problem
What do you believe is the single greatest challenge or
problem of our existence? if you were to say: overpopulation, population, global warming, childhood obesity, marital infidelity,  corrupt politicians, etc.., you would probably be right. At Montabass Academy, our  take the position that the single greatest challenge of our
existence is getting what we need, want, desire, crave, yearn and/or burn for.
In other words, we believe that our existential problem is in solving how we
get from where we are today (aka. here) to where we need and want to be
tomorrow (aka. there). We believe that this has been the problem since the
beginning for time.
Just think about it. When
we are hungry, what happens? When we have the need for attention and care, what
happens? When we have the desire for a better life, what happens? When we want
material possessions, what happens? When we crave power and fame, what happens?
When we yearn for the love of another, what happens? This list can go on and
on. The point is that it does not matter what the “there” is.  The “there” can be as mundane as getting to
work on time or as grand as finding a cure for cancer.  Because of this existential problem we are
driven to try or execute a myriad of ways by which we will ultimately be
successful. We only stop seeking fulfillment when we have succeeded in getting
what we want or need. 
That seems pretty straight forward right?  The sad reality, however, is that the vast
majority of people are not succeeding in getting what they need, want or
desire. Far too many family members, friends, and people that we have met in
our lives struggle to actually achieve that which they set out to achieve.
They tend to settle for what they feel is considered “success” not what they
actually sought out to be “success”.  We
have always been curious as to why. Why, when presented with comparable opportunities, are
there individuals that seem to superbly capitalize on opportunities
and overcome whatever obstacles, challenges or roadblocks put
before them and succeed? While there are others who never
show up, barely make it out the gate, give up along the way or simply
never reach the pinnacle of their success.  Then there are individuals who
attend every wealth and success seminar, read every book on the latest
"secrets to success", and follow the "success gurus"
on social media platforms, but again, never quite get there. 
Now, we are not defining success in money terms alone,
but rather, the successful pursuit and attainment of any worthy goal.
 And while we could probably speak generally about success and how to be successful,
we are focusing specifically on 3 areas that we called the foundational areas
our lives. That is success as an individual, success as a couple and success as
a parent.  We called them foundational areas because research proves that success
in one of all of these areas not only makes success easier to achieve in other
areas of our lives, but also that the probability of peak success if almost guaranteed.

search on Personal Development and Success Training, you will get roughly 18+

story:
THE CROSS AND THE TOWERS

I almost gave up but God gave me hope


It’s because of caring people like you that others can be blessed and encouraged with the word of God. Your tax deductible contributions allow us to continue reaching out to so many who are hurting and in need of encouragement.

Matthew 25:40 Truly I tell you, whatever you did for one of the least of these brothers and sister of mine, you did for me.

Our goal…. is to raise an initial $225,000 in an effort to continue building the resources needed that will help produce content and offer a place of refuge to anyone who hurts and is in need of spiritual healing.

Our Mission……at The Cross And The Towers is to help people in difficult circumstances understand the love of God surpasses all understanding.

Hurt……

Matthew 11:28 Come to me, all who are weary and burdened, and I will give you rest.

People hurt in different ways. Sometimes the very people we love hurt us. Sometimes our parents hurt us and other times it is our friends, the expectation of others or others expectation towards us, communication breakdown between people, or damaged emotions of others who in turn inflict their pain on us.

Then there are the more traumatic hurts such as the death of a family member or friend, a failed marriage ending in divorce, domestic abuse, sexual abuse and rape, illness, war, natural disaster, abandonment, drug and alcohol addiction,

pornography, death of a child, spouse, or family member. Hurt doesn’t discriminate and it happens to both Christian and non Christian alike.

Response….

No matter what the circumstances, people are hurting everywhere and are looking for answers and direction.

Traditional Clinical Responses - deal in methods such as medication and professional counseling.

Emotional Response - considers the approaches of communicating experiences to family or close friends, allowing time to heal, support groups, maintaining structured activities and daily routines, avoiding major life decisions, the pursuit of hobbies or other interests, and spending time with others

Spiritual Response – lets others know you are not alone in your struggle and there are people who have struggled just like you and are willing to share their experiences of hurt and spiritual healing. Personal testimony is one of the best ways to learn how others grieved, responded, and were healed

Do Something Today……

Join us in an effort to help those who are hurting understand they are not alone. For every person who hurts there is someone else who has experienced and overcome a similar hurt. Help us connect these individuals together using visual media so one can help and encourage the other.

Here’s how you can help….

1. Pray for those who hurt!

2. Give! Your donations to The Cross And The Towers allow for the continued producing and story gathering that help others in their struggles and pain. Visual representation allows anyone to anonymously see into the lives of others and through their testimony spark a response that can lead to action. Once the action starts the healing can begin. The combination of video and internet allows for the connection to be made worldwide.

3. Share! Use the links provided to share this story

on Facebook, Twitter, or email to help friends connect with this cause.

4. Tell us about your story and how you were healed.

5. Show The Cross And The Towers in your church! Sign-up now for information on how to bring The Cross And The Towers to your church. This is a great way to reach friends who are hurting.

story:
“The mobile phone acts as a cursor to connect the digital and physical.”

― Marissa Meyer


Together we can sow the seed of peace in the world.

We are passionate about cultivating and growing the seed within all people to find their full potential. We want to share what makes the Soulseeds community so inspiring and vital to the global community.

"Just one thought can lead you toward a more loving and peaceful life. It can also seed the change of love in the world." 

How convenient would it be to download your favorite Soulseeds video, audio, and other resources to your phone, to have available at any time even without an internet connection? To view our weekly videos, download quotes and music, sign up for subscriptions, purchase inspirational gifts and simply reading Ian's or Meg's blog posts without the text restrictions of a site that is not mobile-friendly?

We have reached a point in our shared journey where we hope to take the next step in growing our network, by offering a mobile-friendly version of our website. Going mobile will enable us to reach more people, and share our message in the most convenient way possible!  An estimated 38% of Americans use their smart phone as their primary web-browsing tool. 

In order to create a mobile-friendly site that will provide all of the features that are required, we need to raise $10,000. This cost covers the development, design and implementation of our mobile site. 

Just think of the number of new people we can reach with an easy and interactive mobile experience!

You can donate any amount you would like, or choose one of our Perks and enjoy the offer that comes with it! Perks will be administered when the campaign ends, we will email you instructions for activating  your Perk.

Help us to seed the change of love to more people of all faiths and no faith, to nurture spiritual growth and global healing, by donating to our campaign.

story:
The Slaughterhouse Sandwich Legacy

Slaughterhouse Sandwich company has created a meat unlike any other.  Its unique blend of a variety of meats produces a rich flavor that works well with any sauce or topping, but may best be served just by itself. No matter how you eat it, the flavor will always stand out.  It is more tender than pulled pork, more versatile than bacon, more flavorful than any meat you have ever had, and possibly more addictive than crack.  We guarantee you'll fall in love with it and be eager to see just how many ways you love to eat it.

Here at Slaughterhouse Sandwich Company, we believe success is measured not just by what you're able to do for yourself, but more importantly what you do for others.  That is why we are committed to making a difference.

About this project

There are a lot of sandwiches out there and a lot of meats, but as amazing as meat is, most either require the addition of sauce or their flavor is lost when sauce and toppings are added. A meat that is flavorful enough to stand up to sauces and toppings as well as stand alone is needed. Something that can be served on a sandwich, piled on a baked potato, rolled in a burrito, tossed in a pasta, or scrambled with eggs is something that just isn't out there. But for now, let's just start with the sandwich.  

The Slaughterhouse meat is unlike any other meat you've ever had. It is a unique blend of meats and a variety of cuts that creates a flavor like nothing else. Don't worry, there's nothing strange in it. Its texture is similar to pulled or shredded pork, but it is much richer and more flavorful due to the happy marriage of fats. Originally it was designed to go on a sandwich, but its versatility has led it to find itself in eggs, on potatoes, in pastas, and pretty much anywhere you can imagine. Everyone has a way they think is best, be it the sauce they prefer, the toppings they put on it, or simply just eating it by itself.  

The popularity of the meat has led us to make it the center of our restaurant concept. While the long term goal is to eventually open a traditional brick and mortar restaurant serving the meat in a variety of ways, for now we are simply starting small. Our immediate goal is to just focus on the sandwich and in doing so, start a pop up sandwich shop and catering company. By doing this, we have the opportunity to test the market and develop a following with minimal financial risk, hopefully raising the capital needed to open a traditional establishment. 

As a pop up sandwich shop, our target market are meat lovers and sandwich lovers everywhere. That's a pretty large group, so for now, we're mostly hoping to pop up near colleges and market to the early twenties crowd.

One of the many beauties of the Slaughterhouse Sandwich is that no one makes anything like it, meaning there's no direct competition. Indirectly, we'll still be competing with other sandwich and burger joints, but the only place you can get a Slaughterhouse Sandwich is from us.

Here at Slaughterhouse Sandwich Company, we believe success is measured not just by what you're able to do for yourself, but more importantly what you do for others. That is why we are committed to making a difference. From day one, 15% of all profits (not start up contributions) will be donated to charities. This is just the starting point. At this time, most profits will be going directly back into the business so that we can grow. Once we become truly established, we hope to increase that 15% significantly. Each month we will select a specific charity to support. In addition to the base 15% designated for that charity, we will also work to build events and promotions to raise even more money for that charity. All selected charities will support causes that are typically supported by almost everyone, such as cancer research, feeding the homeless, and finding cures for intolerable diseases. 

In an effort to make our dreams a reality, we have put together a small team that includes an artistic designer, a social media liaison, an attorney that specializes in intellectual property, and a business editor to help with writing and editing our official business plan. In addition, we have made numerous contacts in Chicago's culinary field and business development, securing further advice and assistance along the way. Combine the knowledge and abilities of our supporters with my fifteen years of restaurant experience, from back to front of the house, and we have a group that's destined to succeed.

Slaughterhouse Sandwich Company has what it takes to establish itself first as a pop up sandwich shop and then grow into a national phenomenon. Just like with the meat itself, the possibilities are endless.


Risks and challenges

While our goal is to eventually grow into a traditional restaurant, we've decided to start off small as a pop up sandwich shop and catering company. This limits the the financial risk overall and minimizes the start up funds needed.

By establishing ourselves at a regular venue one day a week, say at Bob's Bar every Tuesday from 11-2, or until we run out of meat, we should be able to create a loyal fan base and a higher demand through a limited supply. If people that love the sandwich know they can only get it on Tuesdays, they'll be sure to be there on Tuesdays. This concept also allows us to hit a wider market once we secure multiple weekly locations in different Chicago neighborhoods.

The biggest obstacle is finding locations that are willing to work with us. As of now, we've begun our search by targeting bars and restaurants that are closed at times that could be profitable for us. In that way, we are not competing with the services these establishments offer and we would be able to not only be profitable on our end, but also bring profit to these locations at a time when they are generating zero revenue.

On the catering side of things, the biggest concern is licensed kitchen space. While there are many rent-able spaces available, the cost of renting forces us to significantly raise our price point. Thankfully I have secured a licensed kitchen at a reasonable; however, that kitchen is still under construction, but should be available early 2016.

There is also some concern that by operating as a pop up we may not be able to keep up with demand and thus limit our success and profits. While that is potentially an issue, it would be a good problem to have. Should that time arise, if we have been unable to secure enough to open our own place, we will begin to seek financial investors and have a proven product to work with.

With every project there are risks, but this idea has been in the works for the last four years and it is time to set it in motion. After working in the restaurant industry for over a decade, I can confidently say that any challenges that come my way will be small compared to those challenges I faced teaching high school for six years. In both cases, it's a passion for work that makes me successful. I loved teaching and I loved the kids. I love food, I love this meat, and I love this concept. Hopefully you do to.


BUDGET IN BRIEF

INDIEGOGO GOAL:     $10,000

LICENSING, CERTIFICATIONS, ETC.                                                                        $2000

    Estimated cost for all of our business start up fees including but not limited to all of our start up licensing with federal, state, and local governments, trademarking, etc.  

PROMOTIONAL MERCHANDISE AND MARKETING FEES                                       $2000

    Estimated cost for promotional events and materials such as kickoff events, t-shirts, printing, etc.

CATERING SUPPLIES AND KITCHEN NEEDS                                                           $1000

    Estimated cost of necessary kitchen and catering supplies including but not limited to chafing dishes, pots and pans, induction burners, cooking utensils, and paper goods for packaging.

FOOD COSTS (FIRST SIX WEEKS)                                                                            $1500

    Estimated food costs for the first six weeks of operation.  This should hopefully be covered by sales, or at least off set a bit; however, to guarantee that we can give the business a chance to grow, we need to be prepared to take a loss in the first few weeks as we learn to adjust to our sales potential, supply and demand.

MISCELLANEOUS COSTS AND CUSHION                                                              $1000

    Just in case we have some expenses that were overlooked, it's always good to have a cushion.  This will also help cover shipping costs for kickstarter promotions and labor costs when needed.

TAXES AND INDIEGOGO FEES                                                                              $2500

    You know Uncle Sam is going to take some of what we raise.  Thankfully our goal is low enough that we shouldn't take a huge hit, but it's better to be prepared.  Plus Indiegogo gets a cut and there are fees for credit card processing.


Biography

I've done a little bit of everything over the years. I've spent most of the past seven years teaching high school English. I love teaching, but my passion for food has always led to say, "Someday I'm going to open a restaurant." Finally figured it is time to make someday today.

I am a self taught cook with over a decade in the restaurant business. I've worked in the back of the house, as a server, and as a bartender. I've gone through management training at a couple of restaurants, acted as a trainer and service leader, and have worked in fine dining, casual dining, and a sandwich shop.

In addition to all of that, I spent most of my life living in California, but I've also lived in Boston, Las Vegas, North Carolina, and now plan to make Chicago my home.

I have an artistic background including playwriting, acting, directing, producing, stand up comedy, and creative writing of all kinds. My passion for literature, film and comic books has led me to put a slight literary spin on everything we serve here, so you may notice that all of our sandwich names are in some way related to a character from books, film, television or comics.

I am confident in what I do, but also know the importance of surrounding myself with people that specialize in areas that I don't. Rebekah is my biggest partner in all of this and she handles a lot of the advertising and social media elements that I'm not a fan of dealing with, but she does a lot more than that. Simply put, she is amazing, my biggest supporter, my biggest partner, my biggest fan.  As a man I can easily say, it's a lot easier to succeed in life when you have an amazing woman in your corner and at your side.  Krista is our artistic designer (her link is attached) and is handling the logo design and a few other things. I have an attorney to help us with creative licensing and trademarks as well as help with setting everything up so we're on the up and up. I also have a business editor to help with writing the business plan and a film maker to help with our videos and food porn. We have a solid team.

And let's not forget Barley (our dog) and Mr. Hamlet (our cat). Barley is one of the happiest dogs you'll ever meet and serves as a constant reminder to eat a little, play a little, rest a little and not take life too seriously and just smile. Hamlet is her best friend, kind of a psychotic jerk unless he feels like being nice, but reminds us the importance of going a little crazy from time to time.


Other Ways You Can Help

So you love our sandwich, you kind of like us, or maybe you just appreciate the concept, but you don't have money to help.  We get it.  Let's face it, that's why we're here.  But there are still a lot of ways you can help.  Follow us on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter.  Share our sites with your friends.  Bring someone to one of our events.  Once we start popping up, come and have a sandwich or tell somebody they need to have a sandwich.  Word of mouth is the most powerful form of advertising.  Or maybe you're working on a project of your own.  If so, get in touch with us, maybe we can bring some of our fans to you and gain some of your fans along the way.  If you believe in any of what we have to offer, then maybe the people you share it with will give us a shot.  And in truth, isn't that all any of us really want.
story_txt:
The Slaughterhouse Sandwich Legacy Slaughterhouse Sandwich company has created a meat unlike any other.  Its unique blend of a variety of meats produces a rich flavor that works well with any sauce or topping, but may best be served just by itself. No matter how you eat it, the flavor will always stand out.  It is more tender than pulled pork, more versatile than bacon, more flavorful than any meat you have ever had, and possibly more addictive than crack.  We guarantee you'll fall in love with it and be eager to see just how many ways you love to eat it. Here at Slaughterhouse Sandwich Company, we believe success is measured not just by what you're able to do for yourself, but more importantly what you do for others.  That is why we are committed to making a difference.
  
About this projectThere are a lot of sandwiches out there and a lot of meats, but as amazing as meat is, most either require the addition of sauce or their flavor is lost when sauce and toppings are added. A meat that is flavorful enough to stand up to sauces and toppings as well as stand alone is needed. Something that can be served on a sandwich, piled on a baked potato, rolled in a burrito, tossed in a pasta, or scrambled with eggs is something that just isn't out there. But for now, let's just start with the sandwich.  The Slaughterhouse meat is unlike any other meat you've ever had. It is a unique blend of meats and a variety of cuts that creates a flavor like nothing else. Don't worry, there's nothing strange in it. Its texture is similar to pulled or shredded pork, but it is much richer and more flavorful due to the happy marriage of fats. Originally it was designed to go on a sandwich, but its versatility has led it to find itself in eggs, on potatoes, in pastas, and pretty much anywhere you can imagine. Everyone has a way they think is best, be it the sauce they prefer, the toppings they put on it, or simply just eating it by itself.  
The popularity of the meat has led us to make it the center of our restaurant concept. While the long term goal is to eventually open a traditional brick and mortar restaurant serving the meat in a variety of ways, for now we are simply starting small. Our immediate goal is to just focus on the sandwich and in doing so, start a pop up sandwich shop and catering company. By doing this, we have the opportunity to test the market and develop a following with minimal financial risk, hopefully raising the capital needed to open a traditional establishment. 

As a pop up sandwich shop, our target market are meat lovers and sandwich lovers everywhere. That's a pretty large group, so for now, we're mostly hoping to pop up near colleges and market to the early twenties crowd.
One of the many beauties of the Slaughterhouse Sandwich is that no one makes anything like it, meaning there's no direct competition. Indirectly, we'll still be competing with other sandwich and burger joints, but the only place you can get a Slaughterhouse Sandwich is from us.
Here at Slaughterhouse Sandwich Company, we believe success is measured not just by what you're able to do for yourself, but more importantly what you do for others. That is why we are committed to making a difference. From day one, 15% of all profits (not start up contributions) will be donated to charities. This is just the starting point. At this time, most profits will be going directly back into the business so that we can grow. Once we become truly established, we hope to increase that 15% significantly. Each month we will select a specific charity to support. In addition to the base 15% designated for that charity, we will also work to build events and promotions to raise even more money for that charity. All selected charities will support causes that are typically supported by almost everyone, such as cancer research, feeding the homeless, and finding cures for intolerable diseases. 
In an effort to make our dreams a reality, we have put together a small team that includes an artistic designer, a social media liaison, an attorney that specializes in intellectual property, and a business editor to help with writing and editing our official business plan. In addition, we have made numerous contacts in Chicago's culinary field and business development, securing further advice and assistance along the way. Combine the knowledge and abilities of our supporters with my fifteen years of restaurant experience, from back to front of the house, and we have a group that's destined to succeed.
Slaughterhouse Sandwich Company has what it takes to establish itself first as a pop up sandwich shop and then grow into a national phenomenon. Just like with the meat itself, the possibilities are endless.


Risks and challengesWhile our goal is to eventually grow into a traditional restaurant, we've decided to start off small as a pop up sandwich shop and catering company. This limits the the financial risk overall and minimizes the start up funds needed.By establishing ourselves at a regular venue one day a week, say at Bob's Bar every Tuesday from 11-2, or until we run out of meat, we should be able to create a loyal fan base and a higher demand through a limited supply. If people that love the sandwich know they can only get it on Tuesdays, they'll be sure to be there on Tuesdays. This concept also allows us to hit a wider market once we secure multiple weekly locations in different Chicago neighborhoods.The biggest obstacle is finding locations that are willing to work with us. As of now, we've begun our search by targeting bars and restaurants that are closed at times that could be profitable for us. In that way, we are not competing with the services these establishments offer and we would be able to not only be profitable on our end, but also bring profit to these locations at a time when they are generating zero revenue.On the catering side of things, the biggest concern is licensed kitchen space. While there are many rent-able spaces available, the cost of renting forces us to significantly raise our price point. Thankfully I have secured a licensed kitchen at a reasonable; however, that kitchen is still under construction, but should be available early 2016.There is also some concern that by operating as a pop up we may not be able to keep up with demand and thus limit our success and profits. While that is potentially an issue, it would be a good problem to have. Should that time arise, if we have been unable to secure enough to open our own place, we will begin to seek financial investors and have a proven product to work with.With every project there are risks, but this idea has been in the works for the last four years and it is time to set it in motion. After working in the restaurant industry for over a decade, I can confidently say that any challenges that come my way will be small compared to those challenges I faced teaching high school for six years. In both cases, it's a passion for work that makes me successful. I loved teaching and I loved the kids. I love food, I love this meat, and I love this concept. Hopefully you do to.BUDGET IN BRIEFINDIEGOGO GOAL:     $10,000LICENSING, CERTIFICATIONS, ETC.                                                                        $2000    Estimated cost for all of our business start up fees including but not limited to all of our start up licensing with federal, state, and local governments, trademarking, etc.  PROMOTIONAL MERCHANDISE AND MARKETING FEES                                       $2000    Estimated cost for promotional events and materials such as kickoff events, t-shirts, printing, etc.CATERING SUPPLIES AND KITCHEN NEEDS                                                           $1000    Estimated cost of necessary kitchen and catering supplies including but not limited to chafing dishes, pots and pans, induction burners, cooking utensils, and paper goods for packaging.FOOD COSTS (FIRST SIX WEEKS)                                                                            $1500    Estimated food costs for the first six weeks of operation.  This should hopefully be covered by sales, or at least off set a bit; however, to guarantee that we can give the business a chance to grow, we need to be prepared to take a loss in the first few weeks as we learn to adjust to our sales potential, supply and demand.MISCELLANEOUS COSTS AND CUSHION                                                              $1000    Just in case we have some expenses that were overlooked, it's always good to have a cushion.  This will also help cover shipping costs for kickstarter promotions and labor costs when needed.TAXES AND INDIEGOGO FEES                                                                              $2500    You know Uncle Sam is going to take some of what we raise.  Thankfully our goal is low enough that we shouldn't take a huge hit, but it's better to be prepared.  Plus Indiegogo gets a cut and there are fees for credit card processing.BiographyI've done a little bit of everything over the years. Finally figured it is time to make someday today.I am a self taught cook with over a decade in the restaurant business. I've worked in the back of the house, as a server, and as a bartender. I've gone through management training at a couple of restaurants, acted as a trainer and service leader, and have worked in fine dining, casual dining, and a sandwich shop.In addition to all of that, I spent most of my life living in California, but I've also lived in Boston, Las Vegas, North Carolina, and now plan to make Chicago my home.I have an artistic background including playwriting, acting, directing, producing, stand up comedy, and creative writing of all kinds. My passion for literature, film and comic books has led me to put a slight literary spin on everything we serve here, so you may notice that all of our sandwich names are in some way related to a character from books, film, television or comics.I am confident in what I do, but also know the importance of surrounding myself with people that specialize in areas that I don't.
