story:
Short Summary

The publishing industry has many good people in it, but it's also full of bad people. It's full of people happy to rip you off and let you pay for things you don't need. It's full of people "too busy" for you. It's full of people who are stuck in the past. The publishing industry needs more good people and more good companies. There are good people and good companies in the publishing industry, but there need to be more.

Sage Ink Group will eventually have an author services company, a literary agency, and a literary academy. In time, we could also like to add a book distribution company to our group. These companies will be run with the mindset that the only way to succeed is to help our clients succeed. The publishing industry needs more companies with that mindset. Join us and help us launch ours.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are going to require a minimum of four websites. While our CEO can and is going to design them himself, we do require some money to get them fully operational with domain names and full plans. We also need money to get literary agents involved and ready to work with us until they can be financially stable with the commissions they will receive.
  • Our CEO is a marketing guy and an author. He understands book marketing very well as well as the publishing industry as a whole. The services offered as perks are quality ones that would be of help to just about any writer or author. Dan Brown is probably set as is J.K. Rowling, but most non-celebrity authors will find the perks to be very helpful. PLEASE NOTE THAT OUR CEO HAS OVER 20,000 FOLLOWERS ON HIS LARGEST ACCOUNT AND LIKELY THREE TIMES THAT SPREAD OVER HIS OTHERS!
  • Just as a back up and not in any way to be downers, we want you guys to know that should we not make our goal, we will simply use the funds raised to pay as many literary agents as possible and will get our websites up and running.

The Impact

  • The world needs great books. That's very simple. Big publishing companies require literary agents, and Sage Ink Group will own and operate a literary agency, giving authors another avenue to get their work to the big publishers. Not only will we be another avenue, but we will be an avenue that isn't clogged with all kinds of things that make response times months like at many literary agencies.
  • Our author services company will provide services that are actually needed, that are of the highest quality, and that are actually needed. Too many companies charge hundreds or thousands of dollars for peanuts. Too many companies deliver, to be frank, useless services that sound good. Too many companies simply produce garbage. Sage Ink Group's author services company will be much different, only providing the best by contracting with the most experienced freelancers, folks who work for Writer's Digest or who have done art for the New York Times, for instance.
  • There are tons and tons and tons of books all over the place designed to help authors. With our literary academy, we intend to condense all of the information out there and pick out the very best to share with those who "enroll" in our academy. We will also be training (free of charge) folks who would like to become literary agents. Don't you want the next generation of literary agents to be good ones?

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Even if you can't contribute to the campaign, we would love it if you were to share it with others. Getting the word out would help us a ton.
  • Please feel free to give us any feedback that you have. Our goal is to be a help to those in the publishing industry, and your insight could prove to be incredibly valuable to us.

Our goal is to be a help to those in the publishing industry, and your insight could prove to be incredibly valuable to us.

story:
A Little Bit About Us

Casa Grande proud to be the very first and only UK's producer of organic dried pasta! 

Find out more about our artisan, bronze extruded, slow dried pasta made with organic fresh free-range eggs at Casa Grande.  Our pasta is just like homemade, it tastes like fresh but with the convenience of dried. It has higher nutritional value than any other pasta available at supermarkets. 

Founders are Katie Beech, Tatiana and Derek Curtis. Our backgrounds are varied! Katie & Tatiana met as trainee psychotherapists and Derek is an artist who also designed our logo! We came together to produce high quality ethical organic pasta, using Tatiana's family recipes and to create an exciting and innovative company together!

A contribution from you will enable the only organic British pasta to be more widely available - providing a unique alternative to imported, mass produced pasta.

What We Need & What You Get

We need £8,000 to pay for:

  • A food accreditation called SALSA, so we are able to sell our pasta to bigger retailers and distributors such as Ocado.
  • Organic September  is coming! We want to spread the word about our organic pasta, some of the funds will be used on PR and broadcasting.
  • Begin to pay a part-time member of staff to work in our kitchen producing and packing pasta, look at how we are looking for this new employee!
  • Business running costs 
  • You'll get original, delicious and beautiful gifts as a thank you for your contribution!   
If we don't reach our goal:
We will prioritise fulfilling the perks and gaining our Salsa accreditation.

The Impact

Your contribution will enable our business to continue to grow. 

We currently sell our pasta to over 30 UK stores. Your support will help enable UK organic produced pasta to become more widely available across the country, and in more places where people are buying their groceries.

Some of the differences your contribution will make: 

  • You will contribute to providing an alternative to mass produced, imported pasta
  • We will have extra capacity in our kitchen by employing a part-time staff member. 
  • We will work in partnership with a local organisation who help disadvantaged and vulnerable people gain employment and work experience.
  • We will be able to sell our pasta to a broader range of shops and restaurants once we have our SALSA accreditation
  • You will be supporting a unique, innovative British manufacturing company which is committed to making ethical, locally produced food available to consumers.

Risks & Challenges

The key challenge is to raise enough money to fulfil purchased perks and increase our sales.
The Founders are currently not taking salaries from the business and haven't done so in the last 18 months and we  need to raise further funds to make more sales and to pay an employee in the next 3 months. 

Other Ways You Can Help

You might not be able to contribute but please do follow us on twitter, like our facebook page and check out our current stockist list and bear us in mind when you think of pasta! 

If you know people passionate about local, real organic food and people who love British quality and innovation pass this message on! 

If you cook,  value real food or are someone who loves innovation and wants to support British quality and creativity, take part in our campaign!
